title: Software Engineer III, Meet Cloud Media
description:
**Minimum qualifications:**
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience.
* 2 years of experience with data structures or algorithms in either an academic or industry setting.
* 2 years of experience with software development in C++, Kotlin, or Java, or 1 year of experience in an industry setting with an advanced degree.
* 2 years of experience with one or more of the following: server development, web/mobile application development, Unix/Linux environments, or distributed and parallel systems.


**Preferred qualifications:**
* Master's degree or PhD in Computer Science or related technical fields.
* 2 years of experience with performance, large-scale systems data analysis, visualization tools, or debugging.
* Experience in software development using a general purpose programming language (e.g., C/C++, Java, Python, JavaScript).
* Proficiency in code and system health, diagnosis and resolution, and software test engineering.


**About The Job**
 Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.
   

  

 In this role, you will manage project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables. You will design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and enhance software solutions.
   

  

 The web is what you make of it and our team is helping the world make more of the web. From open-source pros to user-experience extraordinaires, we develop products that help users connect, communicate and collaborate with others. Our consumer products and cloud platforms are giving millions of users at homes, businesses, universities and nonprofits around the world the tools that shape their web experience -- and changing the way they think about computing.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Collaborate with experts on bandwidth management, enterprise content delivery networks (eCDN), and media routing.
* Measure and improve/optimize how Meet delivers media and signaling to the end users.
* Help identify, design and develop tools and features to simplify enterprise engagements.


 Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
**Senior DevOps Engineer – Stockholm, Hybrid** 




 Are you passionate about building and optimising robust infrastructure solutions for the energy sector in a consultancy environment? Want to play a key role in developing cutting-edge platforms and automation pipelines for a diverse client base, where you'll tackle complex CI/CD challenges and create impactful solutions with a focus on scalable, resilient infrastructure?
 



  





**What's in it for you?** 




 You'll join a dynamic team of software engineers and data scientists, specialising in custom product development for the energy industry. Your role will primarily focus on DevOps and platform engineering, allowing you to dive deep into infrastructure design, data infrastructure, automation, and cloud-native technologies.
 



  





 Enjoy a flexible hybrid work model, balancing time between client offices, your company's headquarters in Stockholm, and remote work. This varied approach allows you to immerse yourself in client environments, collaborate closely with your team, and maintain productivity from home when needed. You'll engage in projects of various scales, collaborating with cross-functional teams and interfacing directly with clients to deliver tailored solutions.
 



  





 You'll get a competitive salary offering up to 70,000 SEK per month (depending on your experience). The company is committed to professional growth, with plans to offer clear paths to leadership roles as the company expands. With ambitious growth plans, there's potential for advancement to senior technical positions in the future. On top of this, you’ll get 30 days vacation, a health and wellness allowance (friskvård), and private pension contributions.
 



  





**What you'd be doing?** 




 You'll typically work in agile teams of 5-6 people, sometimes scaling up for larger projects. You might spearhead new initiatives, assessing client needs and building your team from within the company.
 



  





 Your work will involve designing, implementing, and maintaining infrastructure for CI/CD, automating deployment processes, and managing Kubernetes clusters and related cloud platforms such as AWS and Azure. You’ll be responsible for optimising development pipelines, infrastructure, data, and QA processes, as well as implementing best practices around monitoring, tracing, metrics, and alerts.
 



  





 A key aspect of your role will be enhancing the developer experience within the team and solving customers' infrastructure-related problems. You’ll advocate for solutions and, when appropriate, push for the adoption of the company’s own tools and frameworks. Your consultant-style approach will see you acting as a partner and support outside the customer environment.
 



  





**About you?** 




 Deep experience working with Kubernetes, with a strong focus on automation and infrastructure optimisation. You thrive in environments that require independence in learning and working and enjoy close collaboration with cross-functional teams.
 



  





 You have experience configuring and managing cloud platforms like AWS and Azure, as well as on-premise solutions. An automation-first mindset is crucial, and experience with Python or similar languages is a bonus. Leadership experience and strong communication skills are highly valued, as you'll mentor team members and interface with clients while contributing to the evolution of DevOps practices within the team.
 



  





 Consultant-style experience is beneficial, as client interaction is a significant part of the role, and fluency in both Swedish and English is a must for effective client communication.
 



  





**A bit about them?** 




 A growing tech consultancy in Stockholm, specializing in software and infrastructure solutions for the energy sector. They partner with both established industry leaders and innovative startups, focusing on data-driven applications that promote sustainability.
 



  





 The company culture emphasizes collaboration, continuous learning, and making a positive impact in the green tech space. They're seeking motivated individuals who can drive technical discussions and align with their mission to create meaningful solutions in the energy sector.
 



  





 With a current team of about 45 and plans for significant growth, this role offers an exciting opportunity to be at the forefront of energy tech innovation in a rapidly expanding organization.
 



  





*Don't worry if your CV isn't up to date - just send me a message on LinkedIn or an email over to will@zebrapeople.com and we can go from there.* 




  





  





*3 stage Interview Process* 




*Initial Chat* 




*Technical Discussion* 




*Final with CEO*

title: Junior Utvecklare / Junior Software Developer - Industrial Digitalization
description:
**Företagsbeskrivning**
 AFRY är ett ledande europeiskt företag med global räckvidd inom teknik, design och rådgivning. Vi hjälper våra kunder att accelerera omställningen mot ett hållbart samhälle. Vi är över 19 000 dedikerade experter inom infrastruktur, industri, energi och digitalisering och arbetar med att skapa hållbara lösningar för kommande generationer.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
 Är du nyutexaminerad och vill arbeta med den senaste tekniken inom industriell digitalisering och automation? Vill du vara en del av ett team som utvecklar framtidens industriella lösningar? Vi söker nu juniora utvecklare som vill ansluta sig till vårt team inom Advanced Automation Industrial Digitalization på AFRY!
   

  

 Som junior utvecklare kommer du att få möjligheten att arbeta med spännande projekt där vi hjälper våra kunder att dra nytta av digitalisering och Industri 4.0. Du kommer att delta i allt från implementering av autonoma fordonslösningar, som självkörande gruvmaskiner och autonoma mobila robotar (AMR), till att optimera produktionsprocesser i realtid. Tillsammans med vårt erfarna team får du stöd och handledning för att växa i din roll och få en bred förståelse för hela digitaliseringskedjan inom industrin.
   

  

 I denna roll kommer du även att ha kontakt med kunder och arbeta med att hitta kreativa lösningar som verkligen gör skillnad för deras verksamhet. Om du gillar att kombinera ditt tekniska intresse med att bygga relationer och bidra till utvecklingen av hållbara, innovativa lösningar, så är detta rätt plats för dig.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 Vi söker dig som nyligen har tagit examen inom en relevant universitetsutbildning, exempelvis inom datateknik eller liknande. Det viktigaste för oss är att du har en stark vilja att lära och utvecklas tillsammans med oss. För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du:
   

  

* Har en relevant universitetsutbildning inom IT.
* Har ett intresse för att arbeta med både teknik och människor, där du ser värdet av att skapa innovativa lösningar tillsammans med kunder.
* Trivs i en roll där du får vara delaktig i hela processen – från planering och utveckling till implementering och vidare förvaltning.
* Har grundläggande kunskaper i mjukvaruutveckling, gärna i språk som C# eller Java.
* Är nyfiken på industriella projekt och vill utveckla din affärsmässighet inom branschen.


**Meriterande** 
 :
   

  

* Kunskap eller erfarenhet av agila arbetssätt.
* Kännedom om industriella system som PLC, SCADA, eller IIoT.


**Ytterligare information**
**Vad du får i gengäld:**
* Personlig utveckling: Hos oss får du en introduktionsprocess anpassad för att lära dig de tekniker och verktyg vi arbetar med. Vi satsar stort på att ge våra juniora medarbetare de bästa förutsättningarna att växa och erbjuder löpande utbildningsmöjligheter inom vår teknikstack, produktionsprocesser och andra relevanta områden.
* Balans mellan arbete och privatliv: Vi erbjuder en hybrid arbetsplats med flexibilitet där du kan kombinera arbete på kontoret med distansarbete. Vi värdesätter gemenskap och har kul tillsammans genom olika aktiviteter.


**Förmåner:**
* Du omfattas av förmåner som AFRY erbjuder, från friskvårdsbidrag till förmånliga försäkringar. Genom Club AFRY kan du delta i en mängd sport- och kulturaktiviteter.


**Ansökan och Kontaktuppgifter**
 Sista ansökningsdatum är 2024-10-11, och vi rekryterar löpande så vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan! Startdatum för tjänsten bestäms i dialog mellan dig och oss.
   

  

**Placeringsort:** 
 Nynäshamn eller Solna.
   

  

**Kontaktperson:** 
 Alexander Lindqvist – Business Segment Manager
   

  

 Telefon: +46 10 505 65 25
   

  

 E-post: alexander.lindqvist@afry.com
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att få höra från dig och välkomnar dig som vill vara med på vår resa mot en mer digitaliserad industri!
   

  

*På AFRY driver vi förändring i allt vi gör. Vi anser att förändring sker när modiga idéer möts, när vi samarbetar, skapar innovation och omfamnar kreativa lösningar, det är så vi skapar framtiden. Vi söker konstant kvalificerade kandidater som vill ansluta sig till våra inkluderande team runt om i världen. Bli en del av oss och påskynda den gröna omställningen*

title: Software Developer to FX team
description:
SEB is a leading financial services group and one of the largest IT employers in the Nordics. As the banking industry rapidly evolves, we take pride in our forward-thinking, innovative approach. Our talented tech team is dedicated to future-proofing SEB’s digital architecture and enhancing products that have a meaningful impact on both customers and colleagues.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
 Joining a small, dynamic team consisting of developers, testers, a UX designer, Scrum Master and a product owner, you'll collaborate closely with business stakeholders throughout the software development lifecycle. Situated within the FX (Foreign Exchange) domain, your work will involve developing solutions for both internal traders and external clients.
   

  

**Who We Are Looking For**
* Minimum of 2-3 years of relevant experience in software development
* Degree in Computer Science or a related field
* Strong communication and collaboration skills, thriving in team environments
* Proficiency in JavaScript and Java


 We’re looking for someone who is passionate about coding and eager to learn new skills. You take pride in writing clean, efficient, and maintainable code. You’re driven, organized, and open to exploring new ideas, and taking on new challenges.
   

  

**As a Team Player**
 We value individuals who contribute to a fun and inclusive work culture. If you enjoy collaborating, learning from others, and bringing a positive energy to the team, you’ll thrive in our environment.
   

  

 It's a bonus if you have an interest or knowledge in foreign exchange or trading and we see that you can communicate in both English and Swedish since our team language is Swedish.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We are committed to providing a positive and supportive workplace with great benefits, including:
   

  

* Healthcare and lifestyle allowances
* Discounts on banking services
* Access to on-site restaurants and a fully equipped gym with fitness classes and sports teams


 Additionally:
   

  

* You’ll gain new technical and financial skills, specifically within FX
* Be part of a friendly, welcoming culture that values work-life balance
* Join a social team that enjoys having fun while getting the work done
* Benefit from a hybrid work setup, offering flexibility


**Ready to Join?**
 We review applications on an ongoing basis, so we encourage you to submit your resume and personal letter as soon as possible, but
 **no later than September 30th, 2024.** 
 In your letter, we would like to hear more about who you are and how you believe you can contribute to our team. For more details about the position, feel free to reach out to Martin Götze, Team Manager for FX Sales, at martin.gotze @seb.se. Learn more about what it's like to work at SEB: www.sebgroup.com/career .

title: Cloud Developer at FLIR
description:
We’re seeking a Cloud Developer to enhance our Cloud Team!
   

  

 This role is ideal for someone with experience in .NET and AWS who is passionate about developing and maintaining scalable cloud-based applications. If you’re driven by innovation and thrive in an environment where cutting-edge technologies are the norm, this is the perfect role for you!
   

  

**Top qualities we value in our new Cloud Developer:**
 ✅ Expertise in cloud application development
   

  

 ✅ Proficiency in .NET and AWS
   

  

 ✅ A proactive approach to problem-solving
   

  

**About The Job**
 As a Cloud Developer at Teledyne FLIR, you will be integral in managing and advancing the infrastructure that underpins our innovative cloud platform and applications. You’ll join a dedicated team, contributing to the development, maintenance, and continuous improvement of our cloud solutions.
   

  

 What You’ll Do
   

  

* Cloud Application Development and Maintenance: Write clean, efficient, and scalable code to enhance our cloud-based platforms. Participate in the ongoing development and optimization of our existing cloud solutions.
* Software Architecture Design and Implementation: Collaborate with senior developers to craft and implement robust software architecture that aligns with our technical objectives.
* Agile Collaboration: Engage fully in our Agile development process, from sprint planning to retrospectives. Take an active role in completing tasks, offering feedback, and advocating for best practices to improve team performance.
* Quality Focus: Ensure high-quality software delivery by adhering to best practices in coding, testing, and documentation. Identify and address bugs in the codebase and participate in code reviews to maintain software excellence.


**About You**
 We are looking for candidates who are skilled in cloud development and ready to engage in a dynamic technical environment.
   

  

* Experienced in .NET: You understand the .NET framework, including common libraries and design patterns, and have applied this knowledge in real-world projects.
* Knowledgeable in Cloud Architecture (AWS or Azure): You have a good grasp of core cloud services and can design simple architectures. Experience setting up basic cloud infrastructures is essential.
* Willing to Learn Scala: You possess a can-do attitude towards learning new technologies.


 Why FLIR?
   

  

 Since our inception, Teledyne FLIR has led the way in thermal imaging and sensor technology, improving operational efficiencies in critical industries across the globe. We pride ourselves on fostering a culture of innovation and support, ensuring your professional development and satisfaction. Enjoy our vibrant work environment, continuous learning opportunities, and community-driven events.
   

  

 Apply now and be a pivotal part of advancing safety and sustainability technology.

title: Senior PHP Developer, Jigsaw (Remote) - $60,000/year USD
description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Jigsaw. Have you got what it takes?
   

  

 Jigsaw is searching for a PHP expert who thrives in fast-paced environments and is eager to drive technological advancements in the software industry. This role is ideal for someone who excels in PHP development and is passionate about leading teams towards innovation.
   

  

 The software industry often suffers from the slow pace of adopting new technologies and methodologies. At Jigsaw, we distinguish ourselves by rapidly embracing and implementing the latest cloud and PHP technologies. As our subject matter expert, you will be a catalyst in accelerating this shift, moving away from conventional development processes to more agile, efficient practices.
   

  

 Your role will involve leading the development and delivery of cutting-edge PHP solutions both in front-end and back-end services. Your expertise in PHP development will not only contribute to the creation of advanced software solutions, but also drive the strategic direction of our product offerings. You'll play a pivotal role in ensuring our solutions align with client needs and industry trends.
   

  

 Joining Jigsaw means becoming part of a dynamic, forward-thinking company where innovative ideas are valued and professional growth is encouraged. If you're ready to join us in transforming the software domain, apply now!
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Spearheading the development of customer-facing UIs and back-end services using PHP, ensuring scalable and efficient solutions
* Taking ownership of end-to-end project delivery, working closely with cross-functional Agile teams
* Guiding and mentoring a talented engineering team, promoting the use of best practices and fostering a culture of technical excellence


**Basic Requirements**
**Senior PHP Developer key responsibilities**
* Must be based in the European Union, United Kingdom, or EEA
* At least 4 years of professional experience in PHP development
* Familiarity with front-end technologies (HTML5, JavaScript, CSS3) and MySQL
* The ability to integrate applications with third-party services using REST APIs with formats like JSON and XML


**About Jigsaw**
 Delivered on a software-as-a-service (SaaS) platform, Jigsaw’s virtual learning and collaboration technology enables our customers to revolutionize how they train, educate, collaborate and work through a virtual environment – helping them embrace digital transformation and enhance their organizations’ success.
   

  

 There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!
   

  

**Working with Crossover**
 This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $30 USD/hour, which equates to $60,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.
   

  

**What to expect next:**
* You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
* Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.


**Important!** 
 If you do not receive an email from us:
   

  

* First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
* Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
* Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
* If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.

title: SharePoint Developer to Bravero
description:
Do you have previous experience with SharePoint Online and want to take the next step in your career? Do you want to be part of a growing consulting company where your expertise is the key to success? Take the opportunity to work on exciting projects and become a key player in Bravero's continued expansion. Apply today – we conduct ongoing selections!
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**Company :**
 Bravero AB
 



  

**City :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Job Category :**
 IT
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time
 



  

**Start date :**
 Immediately
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Recruitment
   




**About the role**

 Bravero AB is a leading player in consultation and expertise for Microsoft 365 and Azure solutions. They aim for long-term client partnerships and focus on delivering quality and innovation. Bravero is now expanding its operations and is looking for a
   

**dedicated developer**
 to strengthen the consulting team.
 


  


 As a consultant, you will work closely with Bravero's clients to
   

**develop and improve their digital solutions**
 using SharePoint Framework (SPFx) and components in Azure. You will play an important role in identifying and solving technical issues and
   

**providing advice, support and recommendations to optimize functionality.**
 In the consulting role, it is important to have
   

**strong social skills**
 and be able to engage in dialogues with clients. You will work closely with clients, alongside your Bravero colleagues, and if interested, you can also take on a sales-supporting role. Bravero is a small consulting company in expansion, so you are expected to contribute to further developing their offerings and the shared expertise within the developer group. Here, you’ll be given much freedom with responsibility and great access to each other's expertise –
   

**Welcome to the Bravero family!**



  

  

**You are offered**
  

  
* Engaged and supportive leadership
  
* Centrally located office in Stockholm
  
* Exciting projects and development opportunities with Bravero's owns clients
  
* Attractive employee benefits, including profit-sharing
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* you with extensive knowledge of the Microsoft 365 platform
  
* you with experience developing in SharePoint Online with SharePoint Framework (SPFx) and React/TypeScript
  
* you with a strong interest in new technology and enjoys exploring new functionality within Microsoft’s cloud platforms
  


  


  

**It is preferred if you**



  

  
* speak fluent Swedish, as many clients use Swedish as their working language
  
* have previous experience in a consulting role where you’ve engaged in requirements and solution dialogues with clients
  
* have experience with PowerShell, APIs, C# .NET, and integrations
  


  


 To succeed in this role, you must have strong problem-solving skills, enjoy working in a team, and communicate effectively with technical and non-technical people. You are quality-conscious, paying attention to your product while also possessing a good business understanding. Does this sound like you? Feel free to apply today!

 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Bravero AB**

 Read more about Bravero here!
   




**Get directly recruited to Bravero AB**

 When you apply to this application, you will get hired by our partner. This means that you can relax while we take care of the application process.
   




**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Elin Sjösten or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on sth3@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15106766

title: Database developer/Administrators to big bank in Stockholm!
description:
We are looking for two Database developers/Administrators to join two exciting teams at one of Europes biggest banks! Do you want to specialize in databases and data management then this role is the perfect next step in your career. Apply now - we use ongoing selection due to startdate!
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 Stockholm, Kungsholmen
 



  

**Job Category :**
 IT
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time, long term employment. Possibility to hybrid work, according to company policy
 



  

**Start date :**
 As soon as possible
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
 



  

**Other :**
 Possibility to work remote
   




**About the role**

 As an Database developer/Administrator, you will be responsible for administrating relational database management systems (RMDS) and assisting in query writing. You will also work on ETL transformations and API integrations. With a focus on maintaining and managing data, you’ll support the specific System Team in delivering high-quality results in an agile, fast-paced environment.
   

**RMD stands for Reference Master Data.**



  


  

**You are offered**



  

  
* An exciting role where you get the chance to grow and work with modern technologies as well as working at the largest financial group in the Nordic region and one of Europe's largest banks.
  
* You'll get the opportunity to join a global team of experts and work with senior colleagues, as well as increase your skills as a Database developer focusing on RDMS.
  
* The opportunity to develop and advance in your career. As well as working at a global company which value a sustainable workplace, work-life balance with remote work and a diverse workplace.
  
* A dedicated consultant manager from Academic Work who will support and coach you in your career. This is a long term assignment at our client and you'll have an ongoing employment at Academic Work.
  

  


**Work tasks**

 In the role you will assist the team with database administration and writing queries and you will work with tools such as SQL, Oracle and Tibco. This is an exciting role for you who have a passion for database- and data management and want to learn more about it to become the expert in the team.
 


  

  
* Administer relational databases and manage queries.
  
* Assist in ETL transformations and API integrations.
  
* Collaborate with Scrum teams to deliver on milestones.
  
* Support the overall data management discipline within the organization.
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science / InformationTechnology
  
* Minimun of 2 years of experience working as a database-developer, with either SQL, Oracle and/or Tibco
  
* Good understanding of data management practices.
  
* Fluent in English in both writing and speaking
  
* Has a Swedish citizenship or a valid long term work permit to start the position immediately.
   

 In the recruitment process, we will assess both personality and logic tests, and it is also mandatory to provide a background check - Belastningsregistret.
  


  


  

**It is meritorious if you have**



  

  
* Familiarity with web services and Kafka
  
* Experience in Master Data Management and knowledge of RMDS (Relational Database Management System)
  
* Experience from the bank industry
  
* Proficent in Swedish
  


  


 Knowledge can be gained through education, experience or self-taught.
 


  


  

**To succeed in the role, your personal skills are:**



  

  
* Change oriented
  
* Communicative
  
* Responsible
  
* Intellectually curious
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Become a part of Academic Work**

 When you apply to this job, you are becoming one of many consultants at Academic Work. This means that not only will you gain fantastic benefits, but also a team of consultant managers to support you through your career with us.
 


 Read more about Academic Work
   

**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Sofie Gillberg or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on stv2@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15106783

title: ServiceNow Developer
description:
Vi söker ServiceNow-utvecklare för ett uppdrag hos vår kund. Två positioner behöver fyllas, där du som konsult kommer att designa, utveckla och implementera moduler i kundens ServiceNow-plattform för att förbättra deras system för incidenthantering och felsökning. Uppdraget inkluderar testledning, kravanalys och nära samarbete med beställare för att förstå deras behov.
 



  




 Skallkrav:
 * Minst 3 års erfarenhet av systemutveckling i ServiceNow-miljö.
* Konsulten behöver behärska det svenska språket.


 Börkrav:
 * Erfarenhet av ITSM-processer och lösningar.
* Meriterande om du har arbetat inom offentlig verksamhet.

title: Android Developer
description:
**Solve complex problems. Decode the future.**
 At Electrolux Group, as a leading global appliance company, we strive every day to shape living for the better for our consumers, our people and our planet. We share ideas and collaborate so that together, we can develop solutions that deliver enjoyable and sustainable living.
   

  

 Come join us as you are. We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and more innovative. In our global community of people from 100+ countries, we listen to each other, actively contribute, and grow together.
   

  

 Join us in our exciting quest to build the future home.
   

  

**All about the role:**
 Electrolux is building and strengthening the Digital Experience Organization to deliver highly scalable services and world-class product experiences for our connected appliances.
   

  

 We are looking for an experienced Android Developer to join the team and take responsibility for contributing to the development of the new IoT Mobile App.
   

  

 Responsibilities will be from writing clean and sophisticated code, developing custom UI widgets and complex layouts with advanced UX, Dealing with complex modular projects, interacting with Electrolux cloud infrastructure and working with a global team spread across different locations worldwide will be yours the day-to-day business.
   

  

 You will be working in contact with many parties that are involved in the development of Electrolux connectable products such as Digital Products, IT, R&D, Marketing and Design. Problem solving, cooperating with coworkers with different backgrounds, point of views and various cultures will be essential.
   

  

**What you'll do:**
* Be involved in all aspects of developing new features including user story elaboration, estimation, analysis, design, programming, unit/integration testing and debugging following Agile development practices.
* Build industry leading mobile apps for connected appliances on a global scale.
* Elaborate, estimate, and design for small increments of work just-in-time.
* Commit to completing well-defined work and deliver on those commitments.
* Perform technology evaluation and design spikes.


**Who you are:**
 You are curious, persistent, logical, and clever – a true techie at heart. You enjoy living by the code of your craft and developing elegant solutions for complex problems. If this sounds like you, this could be the perfect opportunity to join Electrolux within the Digital Experience Organization!
   

  

**Qualifications:**
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, IT or related field or equivalent work experience.
* Minimum 4 years’ experience in Android development for consumer-facing mobile apps
* Strong skills in Kotlin, KMM, KTOR, Corotines or similar programming languages
* Ability to write automation tests
* Familiarity with MVVM, REDUX design patters, SOLID principles
* Understanding in Combine, Async/Await technologies.


**Where you'll be:**
 This is a full-time position, based at our Global Headquarters in Stockholm (Sweden).
   

  

 At our Global Headquarters in Stockholm (Sweden) we are 60+ nationalities under the same roof and we enjoy the look and feel of the office!
   

  

 You will be part of a dynamic international team where English is the natural language.
   

  

**Benefit highlights include:**
* Flexible work hours/hybrid work environment.
* Attractive social benefits package.
* Extensive learning opportunities and flexible career path.


 We look forward to receiving you application!

title: Senior Business Developer
description:
**Job ID: 25960**
 Would you like to be part of one of the most exciting programmes the Bank has ever undertaken? We are now looking for a Senior Business Developer to create features and business use cases in order for us to have a prioritized backlog.
 





  

  



 At Nordea, we see that the world is changing fast – and we want to be one step ahead of the curve. That’s why we’re deeply committed to providing the financial solutions of tomorrow to our customers. We’re creating an agile environment where we experiment and grow together – and we need your ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll be in good company with a chance to make your mark on something bigger. 
   

  





**About this opportunity** 






  
 





 Welcome to the CBP Business Design team. We add value by creating a new Core Banking Platform. The new platform will enable further digitalization and allow Nordea to simplify its banking platform across the four Nordic countries. As the Senior Business Analyst, you’ll play a valuable role in this journey by collecting and documenting business requirements. 
 





  

  



**What you’ll be doing:** 





* Gather requirements from stakeholders
* Document requirements in business use cases and features
* Be part of the CBP Business Analyst community where the BA’s support each other
* Cooperate with the agile team of PO’s, testers and developers



  
 





 You’ll join a team of almost 30 Business Analyst who work together as a community to make sure we get the most out of the team. Location: Stockholm, Helsinki, Copenhagen, Oslo, Tri City, Warsaw.
 





  

  



**Who you are**




 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.  
   

  

**To succeed in this role, we believe that you:** 





* Are a team player who enjoys collaboration in a multicultural environment
* Have excellent communication and analysis skills
* Are good at engaging stakeholders at different levels



  

  



**Your experience and background:** 





* Experience within finance industry
* Experience working in an agile project
* Experience saving and/or lending products
* 5-10 years of experience in a similar role
* Excellent written and spoken communication skills in English



  

  



 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 





  
 





**Next steps**




 Submit your application no later than 30/09/2024. 
   

  

 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.
 

  
 





**Only for candidates in Sweden -** 
 For union information, please contact Finansförbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com.
 





  
 





**Only for candidates in Poland -** 
  Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following:
   

  

 In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp.
   

  

 The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at: nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdf.
   

  

 We reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

title: Public 360° App-Utvikler (m/f/d)- Tietoevry Industry
description:
**You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.**
**Are you our new app developer?**
 Tietoevry Industry - Public 360° is looking for an App Developer
   

  

 With us, you will develop the public sector through digitization and streamlining of some of the most business-critical systems in the state and municipality. Simpler, open, and more unified processes for you and me as citizens are an important piece in our trust-based society.
   

  

 You will have the opportunity to prototype and test new technology, as we are a "first mover" in several areas when technology is introduced to the market. Our technology park includes .Net (C#), React.js, Xamarin / .NET MAUI, Azure DevOps, Containers, and Orchestration with Kubernetes, AI and more.
   

  

 We can also promise you personal development, perhaps most of all by working side by side with some of the most skilled and experienced colleagues in the field. We work in agile and distributed teams and follow Scrum development methodology. You will also find great opportunities for courses, certifications, and career development – internally as well as across departments.
   

  

 The position will support one of our strategic initiatives for government ministries in the Nordic region.
   

  

 Together with the product team you will have the opportunity to influence both architecture and implementation of the solutions. You will be required to have close interaction and dialog with customers to support the team in getting the correct requirements and user experience in place.
   

  

**The most important tasks will be:**
* New development, further development, and management of our solutions
* Mainly app development on iOS and Android
* Technologies: .NET MAUI, Xamarin, React.js, .NET Core (C#), MS SQL Server, etc.


**We are looking for someone with the following background:**
* Higher IT education at Bachelor/Master level, but relevant experience can compensate for lack of education
* Experience with development with a focus on app development with Xamarin / .NET MAUI or equivalent technology
* Knowledge of React.js, .NET Core, SQL Server, Git is an advantage
* Experience working in an agile team (Scrum)
* Experience from working with enterprise app development will be an advantage
* Good communication skills both orally and in writing in English and one of the following languages Norwegian, Swedish or Danish.
* Work location will be within the EU boundaries in one of our offices in Oslo, Stockholm, Copenhagen or Helsinki.


**We are looking for someone with the following personal qualities:**
* Passionate about good user interfaces
* Enjoys working in a team and likes to make those around you better
* You must be able to work structured and enjoy tackling challenges, big and small


**The most important things we can offer you in this job are:**
* Access to some of the latest technology in the industry
* Professional development, including through an international competence development forum
* Highly competent, committed, and motivated colleagues with a typical "doer attitude"
* A high degree of freedom and flexible working arrangements
* Career opportunities in a large and international company
* Competitive conditions


**In** 
**terested?**
 We look forward to receiving your application and the opportunity to meet you! Tietoevry values diversity and encourages everyone to apply. If you have any questions, please contact hiring manager, Geir Are Bjørnsrud, at geirare.bjornsrud@tietoevry.com. Or you can contact our Talent Acqusition Partner, Rojin Amini, at rojin.amini@tietoevry.com.
   

  

**About Us**
 Tietoevry creates meaningful technology that helps make the world a better place. We are a leading technology company with a solid Nordic heritage and global capacity. Based on our core values of openness, credibility, and diversity, we work together with our customers to develop a digital future where businesses, societies, and people can grow. Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of customers in the business and public sectors in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry's annual revenue is around 3 billion euros, and the company is listed on NASDAQ in Helsinki and Stockholm, in addition to Oslo Børs.
   

  

 At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Service och Business Developer sökes!
description:
Har du tidigare erfarenhet av projektledning, agila metoder och B2B försäljning? Är du dessutom flexibel, självgående och redo för en ny utmaning? Då kan det vara dig vi söker för uppdrag inom energibranschen! Start är omgående så tveka inte på att ansöka redan idag.
 



  

**Företag :**
 Fortum Sverige AB
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 Försäljning
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Omgående, september
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Konsultuppdrag
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Academic work söker för vår kunds räkning en driven New Service och Business Developer till B2B-segment. I denna roll blir du en del av vårt nordiska team och ansvarar för att utveckla och lansera nya tjänster för kundens entreprenörer och småföretag i Norden.
 


  


  

**Om kunden**



  


 "Fortum Oyj is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our ~5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace".
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* **Ett flexibelt konsultuppdrag där du har möjlighet att arbeta helt på distans.**
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**

 Du kommer att ingå i ett team som är ansvariga för affärsexploration och utveckling av nya tjänster. Ni kommer tillsammans att arbeta för att säkerställa att arbetet genomförs i enlighet med er strategi. Du kommer även att leda och delta i arbete relaterat till alla faser av utvecklingen av nya tjänster som syftar till att öka deras attraktionskraft bland befintliga och nya kunder.
   




**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har minst tre års erfarenhet av B2B försäljning och projektledning.
  
* Har arbetat med agila metoder.
  
* Har flytande kunskaper i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.
  


  


  

**Det är meriterande om du:**



  

  
* Har erfarenhet inom energibranschen.
  


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**



  

  
* Samarbetsvillig
  
* Målmedveten
  
* Stabil
  
* Ansvarstagande
  
* Socialt självsäker
  
* Intellektuellt nyfiken
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Bli en del av Academic Work**

 Som konsult för Academic Work erbjuds du stora möjligheter att växa professionellt och knyta värdefulla kontakter för framtiden. Du får en konsultchef som stöttar dig under resans gång och får ta del av olika förmåner, bl.a. möjlighet till kompetensutveckling i form av en grundläggande hållbarhetsutbildning.
 


 Läs mer om vårt konsulterbjudande här
   

**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Beatrice Hyllstam eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på sth5@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15107074

title: Senior ServiceNow utvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett behov hos en kund efter en ServiceNow utvecklare och söker därför en kollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd som konsult och arbetar hos kund alt. interna åtaganden gentemot våra kunder.
   

  

**Vår ambitioner**
 Vår målsättning är att vara det ledande IT-konsultföretaget med de mest nöjda medarbetarna och kunderna. Hos oss arbetar du inte för cheferna – ledarskapet är här för att stötta dig. Vi sätter dig i centrum och strävar efter att du ska utvecklas och växa. Vi erbjuder en inspirerande arbetsmiljö med god stämning, intressanta projekt hos intressanta kunder och en stark kultur av kunskapsdelning. Vi har tilltro till våra medarbetares innovationskraft och ger dig och dina kollegor möjlighet att både utvidga och fördjupa era kunskaper.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
 Du ska designa, utveckla och implementera flera moduler i Serviceförvaltningens ServiceNow on-premise plattform samt delta i felsökning och incidenthantering. I arbetet ingår även att stödja andra roller såsom testledning och kravanalyser, lyssna på beställarnas behov och översätta dessa till utveckling av bästa lösningar samt förvaltning av dem. Som systemutvecklare kommer du vara delaktig i kodgranskning och kvalitetsarbetet. Resursen kommer också delta i olika projekt med sin verksamhets- och ServiceNow-kompetens. Fokus ligger på att stötta arbetet med ITSM-applikationer, automationslösningar, utveckla och testa workflows och flows, vidareutveckling av serviceportal samt ha driv att lära sig flera delar i ServiceNow-plattformen.
   

  

 Det är mycket meriterande att kunna verka som system- och/eller lösningsarkitekt. Erfarenhet av CMDB och Asset Management är också mycket meriterande
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av systemutveckling av Servicenow i praktiken.


**Meriterande**
* ITIL Foundation 4
* Certified System Administrator - Servicenow
* Servicenow Platform Implementation - Servicenow
* God processkännedom gällande ITSM processerna och kan bygga lösningar som stödjer dessa processer
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i större offentlig verksamhet
* Scripting Applikation Developer – Servicenow
* Certified Application Developer – Servicenow.
* Kompetens inom Javascript.


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 19-09-2024
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag seniora IT-specialister, inom bl.a. utveckling, test, testledning, projektledning, databas, Drift, Linux och ser oss alltid om efter fler kompetenta medarbetare.
   

  

 Transparens och flexibilitet är i alla fall viktigt för oss, med oss får man som konsult majoriteten av sin egen intäkt, i snitt har våra medarbetare höjt sin ersättning med 43% och har samtidigt ett av marknadens bästa förmånspaket. De som är med på vår resa idag har en trygg anställning MEN sätter sin egen lön och bestämmer själva över sina förmåner så som pension, utbildning, arbetstid och tjänstebil.
   

  

 Våra kunder finns bland annat inom detaljhandel, bank/finans/försäkring, energi, transport och offentlig sektor. De flesta av våra kunder är i Stockholmsregionen men vi har även kunder i andra delar av landet.
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket och semestertider dröjer återkoppling längre än vanligt.

title: Snowflake developer to big bank in Stockholm!
description:
Do you have experience with Snowflake and are eager to work in a dynamic global team? A major bank in Stockholm is looking for a passionate Snowflake Developer to join the team and contribute to long-term sustainable systems. Apply now and help them grow in Stockholm!
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 Stockholm, Kungsholmen
 



  

**Job Category :**
 IT
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time, long term employment
 



  

**Start date :**
 As soon as possible
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
 



  

**Other :**
 Possibility to work remote
   




**About the role**

 In this role, you will be a key player in the banks global development team in Stockholm, working on one of the largest data warehouses. The team is distributed across Stockholm, Poland and India, with ambitions to expand the expertise in Stockholm. You’ll collaborate closely with other developers, testers and Product Owners and participate in daily Scrum activities such as sprint planning and demos.
 


  


 You will be a part of the Development team on Data Warehouse which is a global team with colleagues in Poland and India, however your closest manager is based in Stockholm as well as two of your team members who will guide you during your onboarding. You'll work with technologies such as DataStage, UNIX, TWS and Snowflake and SAFe as methodology and you will have opportunity to perform development activities in Data warehousing solution.
 


  


 The role offers the opportunity to grow within the company, starting as a consultant via Academic Work with a long-term aim for full-time employment at the bank if all parts are happy with the collaboration.
 


  


  

**You are offered**



  

  
* An exciting role where you get the chance to grow and work with modern technologies as well as working at the largest financial group in the Nordic region and one of Europe's largest banks.
  
* You'll get the opportunity to join a global team of experts and learn from senior colleagues, as well as increase your skills as a Snowflake Developer.
  
* The opportunity to develop and advance in your career. As well as working at a global company which value a sustainable workplace, work-life balance with remote work and a diverse workplace.
  
* A dedicated consultant manager from Academic Work who will support and coach you in your career. This is a long term assignment at our client and you'll have an ongoing employment at Academic Work.
  

  


**Work tasks**

 You will work independently to understand requirements from the business teams and implement them in Snowflake following SDLC (Software Development Life Cycle) process and contribute to ensure sustainable system solutions through efficient coding and testing.
 


  

  
* Snowflake development in the banks Common Data Warehouse.
  
* Work with data modelers/business to understand the requirement and then implement in the code.
  
* Understanding of SDLC cycle.
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* **Bachelor's degree in Computer Science / InformationTechnology**
  
* Minimun of 2 years of experience from working with Snowflake development
  
* Knowledge of Airflow and an understanding of SDLC cycle.
  
* Fluent in English in both writing and speaking
  
* Has a Swedish citizenship or a valid long term work permit to start the position immediately.
  


  


  

**It is meritorious if you have**



  

  
* Experience from working with DataStage, UNIX and TWS
  
* Experience from working with different databases such as SQL or Oracle
  
* Experience from development
  
* Experience from the bank industry
  


  


  

**To succeed in the role, your personal skills are:**



  

  
* **Responsible**
  
* **Team-player**
  
* **Intellectually curious**
  

  

**As a person you are**
  

 A team player with the will to help, take ownership and learn. You enjoy collaborating in teams, are eager to develop and learn new skills and you are not afraid to bring your insights to the team / stakeholders. You are curious and have a strong passion for IT!
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Become a part of Academic Work**

 When you apply to this job, you are becoming one of many consultants at Academic Work. This means that not only will you gain fantastic benefits, but also a team of consultant managers to support you through your career with us.
 


 Read more about Academic Work
   

**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Milla Olsson or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on stv2@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15106781

title: Back End Senior Software Engineer (Bangkok based – Relocation provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**Get to Know our Team**
 In Agoda’s Back-End Engineering department, we build scalable, fault-tolerant systems and APIs that host our core business logic. Our systems cover all major areas of our business: inventory and pricing, product information, customer data, communications, partner data, booking systems, payments, and more. We employ state-of-the-art CI/CD and testing techniques to ensure everything works without downtime. Our systems are self-healing, responding gracefully to extreme loads or unexpected input. We use modern languages like Kotlin and Scala, Data technologies Kafka, Spark, MLflow, Kubeflow, VastStorage, StarRocks and agile development practices. Most importantly, we hire great people from around the world and empower them to be successful.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
 Agoda Platform team is looking for developers to work on mission-critical systems that serve millions of users daily. You will have the chance to work on innovative projects, using cutting-edge technologies, and make a significant impact on our business and the travel industry.
   

  

**What You’ll Need To Succeed**
* 5+ years of experience developing performance-critical applications in a production environment using Scala, Java, Kotlin, C#, Go or relevant modern programming languages.
* Strong RDBMS knowledge (SQL Server, Oracle, MySQL, or other).
* Ability to design and implement scalable architectures
* Deeply involved in hands-on coding, developing and maintaining high-quality software solutions on a daily basis
* Good command of the English language.
* Engages in cross-team collaborations to ensure cohesive solutions
* Implement advanced CI/CD pipelines and robust testing strategies to ensure seamless integration, deployment, and high code quality.
* Passion for software development and continuous improvement of your knowledge and skills.


**It’s Great if You Have**
* Knowledge in NoSQL, Queueing systems (Kafka, RabbitMQ, ActiveMQ, MSMQ), and Play framework.

title: Senior Developer till PE Accounting
description:
Vill du arbeta på ett dynamiskt och innovativt produktbolag? Blir en del av vårt team som senior utvecklare!
   

  

 👉🏼 Hos oss blir du en del av ett starkt team av engagerade utvecklare vars dagliga arbete & åsikter är avgörande för bolagets fortsatta tillväxt. Som utvecklare på PE arbetar du i en helt egenutvecklad produkt, som vi utvecklar och produktionssätter och du får stor kreativ frihet och möjligheter att ständigt växa i rollen som utvecklare på PE!
   

  

**Vår Utvecklingsmiljö**
 Vi är ett produktbolag med en modern, agil utvecklingsprocess där teamen själva sätter sina milstolpar och sköter prioriteringen utifrån uppsatta affärsmål. Vi tror starkt på att det är roligare att arbeta om man förstår användarnas behov och ser utmaningar och möjligheter. Därför arbetar varje squad med en del av applikationen, men i hela teknikstacken. Vårt inhouse-utvecklingsteam består idag av utvecklare fördelat på 5 team, där teamen samarbetar nära en dedikerad produktägare.
   

  

 Kodbasen, som till största del är skriven i Java, är välskriven och vi kvalitetssäkrar vår kod genom automatiserade tester. Vi uppgraderar löpande till senaste versionen av våra verktyg och tredjepartskomponenter. Hela miljön är containerbaserad och releaser görs veckovis.
   

  

 Vi har ett helt nytt, fräscht och påkostat kontor i centrala Stockholm (Fleminggatan 14) där vi möts, tar en pingismatch, utbyter idéer och samlas runt en whiteboard eller för ett retrospective. Vi vet att även flexibilitet i vardagen är viktigt, därför finns det även möjligheten att arbeta remote!
   

  

**Rollen Som Senior Developer På PE**
 Som Senior Developer hos oss kommer du att spela en viktig roll i att utveckla och förbättra vår produkt samt bidra till företagets tekniska resa framåt. Vi tror att du trivs i ett modernt produktbolag och i en roll där du får chans att verkligen vara med och påverka produkten och utvecklingen av den.
   

  

 Dina ansvarsområden i rollen 👇🏼
   

  

* Delta i hela utvecklingscykeln – från kravspecifikation till implementering
* Samarbeta nära Product Owner, Engineering Manager och teammedlemmar för att säkerställa att produktens vision och tekniska mål uppnås
* Ett tekniskt ansvar för en del av applikationen när det kommer till datamodell, arkitektur, prestanda, säkerhet m.m.
* Bidra med din tekniska expertis och erfarenhet för att kontinuerligt förbättra våra utvecklingsprocesser


**Vem är du?**
 Vi tror att du har flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet av Java samt SQL och du är inte rädd för att komma med egna tankar och idéer som vi tillsammans förverkligar! Du talar och skriver svenska obehindrat. Som person är du nyfiken och motiveras av att testa och lära dig nya saker inom ditt område.
   

  

**Mer Om PE Som Bolag**
 Vi grundades 2011 och är ett modernt & värderingsstyrt produktbolag. I över 12 år har vi skapat innovation och hjälpt små & medelstora bolag att automatisera sin ekonomi. Vi har en väldigt stabil affärsmodell som bolag och växer organiskt, med sunda finanser - vilket bland annat har gjort oss till sexfaldiga DI Gaseller. I skrivande stund närmar vi oss 200 kollegor och finns med kontor i centrala Stockholm, Göteborg & Malmö.
   

  

*Vi ser verkligen fram emot att höra ifrån dig!*
 Se mer om oss på: accounting.pe/karriar & instagram.com/peaccounting
   

  

 Vi genomför bakgrundskontroller i slutskedet av våra rekryteringsprocesser.
   

  

*Sökord: Java 19, Spring, Docker, REST, Linux, MySQL, Microservices, IntelliJ, Jenkins, Git, Remix. Fullstack, Backend, Produktbolag.*
 Vi på PE Accounting ändrar sättet världen ser på ekonomi- och lönehantering!
   

  

 Vårt automatiserade system, i kombination med vår tjänsteleverans bildar tillsammans en helhetslösning som ger våra kunder möjligheten att outsourca sin ekonomifunktion, och samtidigt behålla 100% kontroll - i realtid.
   

  

 Vi har en stabil affärsmodell, där över 90% av intäkterna är prenumerationsbaserade. Tillväxten har skett organiskt och med sunda finanser. Vi har fått utmärkelsen DI Gasell sex år i rad och är ett värderingsstyrt bolag med stort fokus på glädje, ansvar, prestigelöshet och nyfikenhet!

title: Senior Software Engineer within eHealth
description:
*Cambio is one of the Nordics' leading suppliers in eHealth with a comprehensive offering for the entire health and care chain. Our eHealth solutions support healthcare professionals in their daily work and offer patients safer and more easily accessible care. We are proud to be an important part of Swedish health and social care. We are growing continuously and now have about 1000 employees in several countries.*
**The position**
 As a Senior software engineer at R&D Integrations, you will be working in an agile team with experienced developers, scrum masters, and business analysts where knowledge sharing is part of the daily work. You will also work closely with architects, product owners, and other stakeholders.
   

  

 Within R&D Integrations, we work with exciting initiatives where we enable information to be available at the right place at the right time, through various integrations. The integrations enable, for example, patients to be able to read their medical records or book appointments online. It also enables healthcare professionals to read and use information from an external ambulance system in the system used at the emergency wards, or to manage electronic sick leave certificates directly in our electronic health record COSMIC.
   

  

 At Cambio, we encourage taking initiatives that contribute to the development of the company and ourselves. For us, it is important that you should have the opportunity to grow, both as a person and as an employee. Our culture is described through the words “Trust”, “Care” and “Together” which permeate everything we do.
   

  

**About You**
 As a Senior software engineer, you enjoy developing and coaching the team in your area of expertise. We believe that you have great technical skills and have a keen interest in integrations and software development. You strive to understand the business and its purpose, using that knowledge to create high-quality technical solutions with your team.
   

  

 You take pride in working together with others to solve problems and improve existing solutions. You have a quality-driven mindset, are detail-oriented, organized, and able to manage multiple tasks and priorities simultaneously. You are proactive and able to take the initiative to identify areas for improvement. You have excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with other teams and stakeholders.
   

  

**Requirements** 
  

  

* 3+ years of working with Java.
* Familiar with REST, SOAP, XML, JSON
* Can communicate fluently in English.


**It's a bonus if you**
* Experience of integration work
* Experience within the area of Swedish health and social care
* Knowledge of healthcare standards and specifications (FHIR, HL7v2, RIVTA, OpenEHR, SNOMED CT)


**Place of employment** 
 : Linköping or Stockholm
   

  

 At Cambio we value a healthy work-life balance, and to encourage that we apply a hybrid working-model. Together with your team you decide which days you work at the office. On the remaining days you can work remotely from home, but you are always more than welcome to work at the office too.
   

  

**Scope** 
 : Full time
   

  

**Form of employment:** 
 Permanent employment, 6 months trial period
   

  

**Other:** 
 We screen the applications and hold interviews continuously so please send your application as soon as possible via the link.
   

  

 We encourage and eagerly welcome all applications, but we will only consider candidates who are located and have the legal right to work in
 **Sweden.** 
 We will ask for verification during the process.
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**
 Read more about us
 **here!**
 Are you interested in Cambio but you don’t feel that this position is the perfect match? Check out our other open positions at the career site
 **here!**
 Cambio Healthcare Systems is Sweden’s leading suppliers of healthcare information systems and a growing player in the European market with just over 100,000 users across general and university hospitals, specialist units and outpatient units. Through the use of our integrated solutions, our customers provide services to 4 million patients.

title: SDE II - iOS Software Developer, Sye
description:
**Description**
 Come build the future of entertainment with us. Are you interested in shaping the future of movies and television? Do you want to define the next generation of how and what Amazon customers are watching?
   

  

 Prime Video is a premium streaming service that offers customers a vast collection of TV shows and movies - all with the ease of finding what they love to watch in one place. We offer customers thousands of popular movies and TV shows including Amazon Originals and exclusive licensed content to exciting live sports events. We also offer our members the opportunity to subscribe to add-on channels which they can cancel at anytime and to rent or buy new release movies and TV box sets on the Prime Video Store. Prime Video is a fast-paced, growth business - available in over 240 countries and territories worldwide. The team works in a dynamic environment where innovating on behalf of our customers is at the heart of everything we do. If this sounds exciting to you, please read on.
   

  

 In this role, you will be joining the live low latency streaming team as an iOS specialised developer. We deliver Sye, a revolutionary streaming platform primarily used for live sporting events and concerts. Our ambition is to drastically improve the customer experience of watching live streams by providing minimal latency and synchronized playback to all viewers across the globe.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 As an iOS developer on our live low latency streaming player team, you will innovate on and improve the components providing live streaming capabilities to end user applications. The platforms that the team supports include Android, iOS, web, smart-TVs, set-top-boxes and game consoles, where you will focus on iOS.
   

  

 Your will work on the SDKs we provide as well as their integration into Prime Video applications that are used by millions of customers around the world. Your work will also include developing reference and demo implementations, setting up automated tests for different hardware and software platforms.
   

  

 A day in the life
   

  

 As part of the Sye team you will be involved with daily stand-ups, coding, code reviews for team members, internal and cross team meetings to align on technical complexities, estimate deliveries with milestones and write technical documents. Large events involves planning of new features to be deployed, tests to be performed and data to be analyzed in order to continuously improve the customer experience. Status and goals tracking are expected every so often.
   

  

**About The Team**
 The team owns the live low latency player SDKs for supported platforms, and we also work on the integration of them into Prime Video applications.
   

  

 We are growing, and with us you will also be able to grow as we work together. There are lots of opportunities to interact with other teams globally. Together with partners such as Twitch and IMDb TV, we are part of a strong video streaming community that will be available to you.
   

  

 We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:
   

  

 Stockholm, SWE
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* iOS specific experience in professional, non-internship software development
* Proven experience in non-internship design or architecture (design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and existing systems experience
* Experience programming with at least one software programming language
* Experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems
* Experience programming with at least one iOS language such as Objective C or Swift.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience in full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations experience
* Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - Amazon Corporate Services Sweden AB
   

  

 Job ID: A2656468

title: Staff Software Engineer – JVM/Rust Expert (Bangkok-based, Full Relocation Package Provided)
description:
****About Agoda****
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

****About Agoda****
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Get to know our team – Observability Platform in Agoda**
 Within the WhiteFalcon team, we build and maintain Agoda’s time series database and log aggregation system. We process tens of millions of measurements per second and hundreds of terabytes of logs per day in multiple datacenters, powering thousands of dashboards and alerts. Our biggest challenges are to support the ever-growing need for collecting more data, faster and at lower cost.
   

  

**In This Role, You’ll Get to**
* Build fault-tolerant, horizontally scalable solutions running in multi-tenant environments
* Solve challenging problems in distributed and highly concurrent environment
* Impact all developers in Agoda, providing better observability instruments


****What You’ll Need To Succeed****
* At least 8 years of experience writing performant and scalable code using JVM (Java/Scala/Kotlin) or Rust (C++) languages
* User/dev experience of one of the following products: Prometheus, InfluxDB, Victoria Metrics, Elasticsearch, Grafana Loki
* Production experience with messaging queues (Kafka)
* Deep understanding of concurrency and multithreading
* Value code simplicity and performance
* Demonstrate proficiency in communication and collaboration skill


**It’s Great If You Have**
* Strong background in DB internals, indexes, data formats (AVRO, Protobuf)
* You generally understand observability data types, such as logs and metrics
* Profilers, debuggers, tracers hide no secrets from you, especially in a Linux environment
* Experience building large-scale time series data stores and monitoring solutions
* Experience with S3 (Ceph), Elasticsearch, Grafana and other open-source components
* You can get down to the low-level when needed
