title: Senior Manager Foodservice Support Europe
description:
**Job Description**


To support our future growth ambitions, we are on a journey to develop our Foodservice Business by introducing new offers with supporting in store processes, production infrastructure and a fresh food supply chain.

  

We are looking for a Senior Manager Foodservice Support with deep knowledge from change processes to create and support implementation of strategies for Circle K Foodservice business development.

**Senior Manager Food Service Support**
=======================================

**Type of Employment:** Permanent

**Location:** Stockholm, Sweden

**Visa requirements:** A valid work permit from the EU/EEA (relocation assistance is not provided)

**THE ROLE**


Your role will be to support the European Food Service team in the following areas:

* Food Packaging: Leading the entire Food Service packaging development and distribution.
* Procurement projects: Overseeing the food procurement projects and partnering with different stakeholders within the organization.
* Digital solutions: Ensuring digital tool planning, optimization, and implementation to enhance customer experience and drive business efficiency.
* Point of contact in the food team for activities such as “Too Good To Go." Etc.

**WHAT YOU'LL DO**

* Food packaging: The role involves liaising with various stakeholders, including packaging producers, warehouses, distribution partners, Business units, and Food Service directors. Ensure efficient packaging solutions that comply with regulatory requirements.  

Consolidate packaging ranges to ensure alignment with business needs, availability across the European markets, and best prices.
* Procurement projects: Manage and oversee the Food Service procurement project planning and prioritization. Ensure that all projects align with annual goals and objectives, focusing on delivering high-impact results. Cooperate with Global and European procurement teams to ensure procurement projects are aligned with business needs.
* Digital solutions: Coordinate execution of digital strategy that integrates technology into Food Service operations including food ordering, customer engagement programs, and deliveries. Coordinate seamless integration between different digital tools (Food production, Menu boards, Queue management, Food ordering, AI,) to provide an efficient workflow across the organization.  


	+ Collaborate with internal teams, such as UX, IT, to represent Food Service needs and ensure prioritization of Food Service-related digital tools.
	+ Design a digital customer journey for food from the customer's perspective.
* Be responsible for networking and coordinating with supporting functions and team members in Europe and North America as needed (Marketing, Concept, Comms, Procurement, Training, Packaging, Supply Chain, Analytics, HSE, Food Safety, etc.).

*The position is based within the European Market Area, and it offers flexible working hours and travel requirements to accommodate global operational needs.*

**WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR**

* Experience in packaging or supply chain roles within a retail or food industry context.
* Proven ability to manage and prioritize multiple areas of responsibility effectively. Experience in business continuity planning.
* Strong skills in collaboration, cooperation, and communication.
* Strong communication skills in English, both verbally and written.
* Experienced with relevant Microsoft business suite software and other industry programs.
* A bachelor’s degree in economics/marketing or related fields.
* Ability to travel about 20% project specific.

**WHY WORK WITH US**


Our office employment opportunities offer you career growth with an international company, plus a dynamic work environment that puts people first. Wherever you are in your journey, we have a place for you. Here’s some of the exciting perks we offer:

* *Alimentation Couche-Tard* is a proud receiver Gallup Exceptional Workplace Award (GEWA) for 3 years in a row.
* Complete benefits packages (health insurance, pension contribution etc.).
* Possibility to enroll in stock purchase plan.
* Employee discount on fuel.
* Paid time off plan including vacation, sick days and personal days.
* Work in a collaborative, dynamic, high performing and diverse team.
* Learning opportunities to develop new skills and to evolve professionally in a fast-growing company.
* Hybrid work to allow a sustainable work-life balance.


At Circle K, our culture is shaped by our team members and how we treat each other. Our guiding principles are the core values we live by and inform all our actions and business decisions. You can find them at Values and Culture | Circle K. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.

**INTERESTED?**

We encourage you to apply by **September 23, 2024** The candidates will be reviewed on continuous basis.


You don't meet all the necessary qualifications? At Circle K, we are fully committed to creating a diverse, inclusive, and genuine work environment. Therefore, if you're enthusiastic about this role but your background doesn't perfectly match every qualification, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.


Contact person:

**Alise Kitija Pabērza**

*Recruiter, Europe*


e: alisekitija.paberza@circlekeurope.com


Only applications received through our online system will be considered, not via e-mail. **We are looking forward to your application!**
company_description: Circle K is a global leader in the convenience store industry operating stores in the USA, Canada, Hong Kong, & Europe(including stores in several Scandinavian and Baltic Countries, Ireland & Poland).

title: Product Designer
description:
Natural Cycles is a leading women’s health company that developed the world’s first birth control app, used by millions globally. We are a fast growing startup, and we promote an international working environment filled with smart and ambitious colleagues based in Stockholm, Geneva, New York, and remotely. Our mission is to pioneer women’s health through research and passion, empowering every woman with the knowledge she needs to take charge of her health.
  
We’re looking for a Product Designer for the Device Integrations area in our Product team to help us define how our users interact with our app through different measuring devices - oral thermometers and wearables (Oura Ring and Apple Watch).
  
By joining our team, you’ll get the opportunity to collaborate on a variety of projects with a team of Product Designers, User Researchers, Software Engineers, and Data Scientists in a fast-paced, rapidly growing environment. You’ll work on strategic projects as well as short, iterative A/B tests where you’ll get to see the impact of your work right away. What you will be doing
  
  

You’ll be a part of the Product team and work across our app but your main focus will be on designing a smooth experience for our users regardless of the measuring device they use with our app.
  
  

You’ll work on projects from start to finish - mapping out user journeys, wireframing, sketching, and creating polished visual mockups. Your main focus will be designing how users connect devices and interact with data from integrations.
  
  

You’ll collaborate with our Software Engineers to build up and improve our existing integrations.
  
  

You’ll be working in a tight-knit agile team with a Product Manager, other Designers, Software Engineers and Quality Assurance Engineer on a day-to-day basis.
  
  

You’ll be frequently collaborating with our User Research team at different stages of product development.
  
  

You’ll have the opportunity to contribute to the team’s product roadmap, ideating ways to improve our product on your own and with the team.
  
  

You’ll also be a part of the Product Design team, collaborating with designers from across product teams at Natural Cycles. You’ll contribute to the development and maintenance of our design system and brand, collaborate on strategic projects, and help build team processes.
  
  

What skills and experience we think you have
  
  

You’ve been working with Product Design for 3+ years in consumer-focused products.
  
  

You have a good understanding of UX processes and user/centered design practice.
  
  

You have experience in advocating for a user-centered mindset in your team and stakeholders around you by conducting workshops, brainstorming sessions, etc.
  
  

You can design beautiful interfaces, applying your knowledge of color, typography, layout, and other design principles.
  
  

You have experience working with design systems.
  
  

You’re used to working with a data-driven design process and incorporate both quantitative and qualitative data in your work.
  
  

You’re able to articulate and explain your ideas, can listen to and give feedback, and work well both independently and as part of a team.
  
  

You might also have experience working with device integrations or complex user flows.
  
  

You have an online portfolio or PDF with case studies of projects and design implementations that you can’t wait to share with us!
  
  

What we offer
  
  

Flexible work arrangement - you will be part of a team based in and around Stockholm that values effective collaboration and transparent communication, irrespective of work location
  
  

Professional development - you will collaborate with industry leading developers, promoting continuous growth and skill enhancement
  
  

Modern technology - you will leverage innovative technologies and tools, within an environment that empowers you to contribute ideas and take ownership of your work
  
  

Impactful projects - you will contribute to groundbreaking projects that redefine industry standards and create tangible value
  
  

Commitment to quality - you will join a dynamic and progressive organization that prioritizes profitable, long-term product development
  
  

Location
  
We are remote-friendly, but we find great value in being able to connect with our teams in person. Most of the Productteam you will work with is located in Stockholm.
  
Sounds interesting?
  
If you want to be part of a successful team, we encourage you to apply for this position as soon as possible.
  
We look forward to hearing from you!
  
  

How to apply
  
To apply, just upload your CV and answer the questions on the application form. Keep in mind that we can't accept applications through email because of GDPR, and only applications submitted via the career site (and in English) will be considered.
  
At Natural Cycles we value diversity and inclusion because we know that teams with people from different backgrounds and experiences are stronger. We welcome candidates from all walks of life and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates.

title: Junior Human Factor Engineer till Saab Järfälla!
description:
Har du nyligen tagit examen som Civilingenjör, med ett gediget intresse för UX/HFI och vill arbeta på en spännande arbetsplats med många coola produkter? Sök då till rollen som Junior Human Factor Engineer till Saab Järfälla idag! Urval sker löpande.
  
  

**OM TJÄNSTEN:**  

Teamet i Saab Järfälla söker nu en ny kollega att ansluta till deras team. I rollen som Junior Human Factor Engineer kommer du att arbeta med design och tester av olika produkter och hela tiden prova dig fram till olika lösningar och resultat. Exempelvis kan du få en produkt att testa mot sand, vatten, vibrationer och därefter se till att ergonomiska ändringar görs så att produkterna blir användarvänliga och formas till att bli anpassade för människor att använda.
  
  

Arbetet är en blandning av hands on tester och att sedan kunna dokumentera resultat och ändringar för att sedan kunna presentera det vidare till kollegor. Det blir väsentligt för rollen att du vågar tycka till och komma med förändringsförslag för att kunna föra arbetet framåt.
  
  

**VI SÖKER DIG SOM:**  

Har en civilingenjörsexamen inom exempelvis UX/HFI
  
Har ett gediget intresse för materiella tester
  
Talar och skriver både svenska och engelska flytande, då båda språken nyttjas i ditt arbete
  
  

Som person tror vi att du är prestigelöst, ödmjuk och inte har några problem med att kunna backa bandet och göra om. Du är även nyfiken, målinriktad och hjälpsam för att tillsammans med ditt team uppnå bra resultat.
  
  

**OM KUNDFÖRETAGET:**  

SAAB är ett globalt försvars- och säkerhetsföretag verksamt inom flyg-, land- och marinförsvar, civil säkerhet och kommersiell flygteknik. De är 15 500 medarbetare och har verksamhet på alla kontinenter. Tekniskt är de ledande inom många områden och en femtedel av deras intäkter går till forskning och utveckling. Kunden ser mångfald som en tillgång och där du som medarbetare får stort ansvar och goda utvecklingsmöjligheter. Företag respekterar varje människas behov av ett liv utanför arbetet.
  
  

**OM ANSTÄLLNINGEN:**  

Detta är ett konsultuppdrag vilket innebär att du kommer till en början att vara anställd av Friday. Ambitionen från Kunden och vår sida är att du på sikt blir direktanställd hos Kunden.
  
  

Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.
  
  

**ÖVRIG INFO:**  

**Omfattning:** Heltid
  
**Start:** Enligt överenskommelse
  
**Placering:** Järfälla
  
**Rekryteringsansvarig:** Alice Tegebro
  
**Lön:** Marknadsmässig
  
  

Ansök genom att klicka på länken nedan. Kom ihåg att vara snabb med din ansökan då vi gör löpande urval av kandidater och att annonsen kan stängs ner innan tjänsten är tillsatt om vi gått över till urvals och intervjufasen.
  
  

**OM FRIDAY:**  

Genom att vara en partner både till våra kandidater och kunder strävar vi efter att hitta den bästa matchningen. Det gör vi genom att lära känna våra kunder och kandidater på riktigt! Vi ser självklart till att kunskaps- och erfarenhetskrav matchar, men framförallt lägger vi vikt vid samsyn kring värderingar och företagskultur som båda parter värdesätter.
  
  

Vår passion är att hjälpa människor till rätt roll, arbetsplats och sammanhang inom IT och teknik. Därför grundade vi Friday med ambition att hjälpa dig till jobbet som ger dig fredagskänslan – varje dag!
  
  

Vi riktar oss främst till dig som är i början av din karriär eller studerar vid högskola/universitet inom IT och Teknik.
  
  

Vår övertygelse är att människor uppnår sin fulla potential när man ser fram emot att gå till jobbet varje morgon. ”Friday – everyday”, hur låter det?

title: UX/UI-Designer
description:
Vi söker en UX/UI-designer till myndighet inom det svenskra kraftsystemet.
   

  

 Detta är ett konsultuppdrag. Du kommer vara anställd av Centio Consulting Group AB och arbeta som konsult.
   

  

 Tjänsten är på heltid, och säkerhetsprövning krävs
   

  

 Uppdraget innebär ett nära samarbete med kunden vilket ställer stora krav på flexibilitet och samarbetsförmåga.
   

  

**Uppdraget**
 Myndigheten är den som ansvarar för att elöverföringssystemet är säkert, miljöanpassat och kostnadseffektivt – i dag och i framtiden. Den drivs i form av ett statligt affärsverk, och har drygt 1400 medarbetare varav de flesta arbetar på huvudkontoret i Sundbyberg, kontor finns även ibland annat Sundsvall, Göteborg, Luleå och Sollefteå.
   

  

 På myndighetens IT-division pågår ett flertal systemutvecklingsprojekt där man till ett av sina team nu söker en UX/UI-designer. Uppdraget innebär att övergripande stödja myndigheten inom området UX/UI-design i utvecklingsprojekt samt i förvaltning. Uppdraget kan även komma att involvera prototypframtagning samt en del frontend utveckling.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
* Iterativt skapa och testa prototyper, mockups och wireframes för ny funktionalitet
* Utveckla interaktions- och designriktlinjer
* Delta i teamets sprintplanering och andra agila planeringsmöten
* Vardaglig kontakt med interna- och externa användare för att få djupare förståelse av deras behov och arbetssätt
* Kontinuerlig avstämning av arbetet med teamet för att bygga upp gemensam kunskap och kultur


**Skallkrav**
 Högskole-/universitetsutbildad inom mjukvaruutveckling där UX/UI-design har ingått, omfattande minst 120/180 hp, alternativt yrkeshögskola 400 YH-poäng, där UX/UI-design har varit huvudinriktning
   

  

 Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet i rollen som UX/UI-designer
   

  

 Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet från att ha arbetat med användarintervjuer och användbarhetstestning
   

  

 Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet från att ha arbetat med responsiva webbaserade applikationer
   

  

 Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet under de senaste 4 åren av att ha arbetat med tillgänglighet för webbplatser och/eller applikationer enligt riktlinjerna/standard WCAG 2.1 eller WCAG 2.0
   

  

**Meriterande**
 Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet från att ha arbetat med frontend utveckling i HTML, CSS eller JavaScript
   

  

 Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet från att ha arbetat med plattformen Microsoft Azure
   

  

 Tidigare arbetslivserfarenhet (minst 2 projekt/uppdrag) från att ha arbetat med att ta fram och införa en UX-strategi för en organisation/företag med syftet att öka mognadsgraden inom aktuellt området
   

  

 Tidigare arbetslivserfarenhet (minst ett projekt/uppdrag) från att ha arbetat med att ta fram minst ett designsystem där bl.a. bibliotek för styling och färdiga komponenter ingått
   

  

**Om oss**
 Centios övergripande mål är att vara ett konsultbolag som erbjuder smarta och hållbara lösningar som utvecklar samhället på ett positivt sätt.
   

  

 Våra medarbetare erbjuds villkor som är anpassade för individen. Det innebär att arbetstider, arbetsomfattning, arbetsplats och kompetensutveckling så långt som möjligt anpassas utifrån medarbetarens behov.
   

  

 Bland våra medarbetare hittar du engagerad personer som brinner för samhällsutveckling. Vi jobbar i små grupper där du kan bidra med dina erfarenheter samtidigt som du får ta del av andras kunskap och erfarenhet.
   

  

 För oss är det viktigt med välmående och att hitta en sund balans mellan arbete och fritid. Därför har vi en nollvision mot stress och sätter trivsel och hälsa främst.
   

  

 Läs gärna mer om oss på centio.se.
   

  

**Vänligen skicka ditt CV på svenska.**
 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: UX/UI designer med fokus på Frontend-utveckling sökes
description:
Vi säker nu dig som har minst 3 års erfarenhet av UX/UI design med vana att jobba mot WCAG 2.1 standarden. På detta statliga bolag kommer du vara med i flera utvecklingsprojekt med att designa och utveckla dina idéer.
 



  

**Plats :**
 Sundbyberg
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid, till slutet på nästa år med möjlig förlängning
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 1:a december
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Konsultuppdrag
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Hos vår kund pågår ett flertal systemutvecklingsprojekt där man till ett av sina team nu söker en UX/UI-designer. Uppdraget innebär att övergripande stödja olika team inom UX/UI-design i utvecklingsprojekt samt i förvaltning. Uppdraget kan även komma att involvera prototypframtagning samt en del frontend utveckling.
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* **Ett konsultuppdrag hos ett av Sveriges viktigaste infrastrukturbolag**
  
* **En trygg anställning hos Academic Work och hjälp att hitta nästa uppdrag efter uppdragets slut**
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Iterativt skapa och testa prototyper, mockups och wireframes för ny funktionalitet
  
* Utveckla interaktions- och designriktlinjer
  
* Delta i teamets sprintplanering och andra agila planeringsmöten
  
* Vardaglig kontakt med interna- och externa användare för att få djupare förståelse av deras behov och arbetssätt
  
* Kontinuerlig avstämning av arbetet med teamet för att bygga upp gemensam kunskap och kultur
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet i rollen som UX/UI-designer
  
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet från att ha arbetat med användarintervjuer och användbarhetstestning
  
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet från att ha arbetat med responsiva webbaserade applikationer
  
* Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet under de senaste 4 åren av att ha arbetat med tillgänglighet för webbplatser och/eller applikationer enligt riktlinjerna/standard WCAG 2.1 eller WCAG 2.0
  


  


  

**Det är meriterande om du har**



  

  
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet från att ha arbetat med frontend utveckling i HTML, CSS eller JavaScript
  
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet från att ha arbetat med plattformen Microsoft Azure
  
* Tidigare arbetslivserfarenhet (minst 2 projekt/uppdrag) från att ha arbetat med att ta fram och införa en UX-strategi för en organisation/företag med syftet att öka mognadsgraden inom aktuellt området
  
* Tidigare arbetslivserfarenhet (minst ett projekt/uppdrag) från att ha arbetat med att ta fram minst ett designsystem där bl.a. bibliotek för styling och färdiga komponenter ingått
  


  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  


 För denna roll kommer du genomgå en säkerhetsklassning som måste godkännas för att du ska kunna tillträda i tjänsten.
 


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Bli en del av Academic Work**

 Som konsult för Academic Work erbjuds du stora möjligheter att växa professionellt och knyta värdefulla kontakter för framtiden. Du får en konsultchef som stöttar dig under resans gång och får ta del av olika förmåner, bl.a. möjlighet till kompetensutveckling i form av en grundläggande hållbarhetsutbildning.
 


 Läs mer om vårt konsulterbjudande här
   

**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Nils Norgren eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på sth2@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15107168

title: Graphic Designer - Intern (Remote Internship - Graphic Design)
description:
Unleash your creativity with a unique internship opportunity offered by Kreativstorm, a dynamic and innovative management-consulting firm based in Berlin, Germany. Work remotely with our multinational team and launch your career in graphic design!
   

  

 If you're passionate about design and have a keen eye for detail, this internship is perfect for you. Under the guidance of seasoned professionals, you'll work on diverse design projects, exploring concepts like branding, digital media, illustration, and layout design. Gain hands-on experience in creating compelling visuals, all from the comfort of your home.
   

  

**Internship Overview and Details:**
* Location: Fully Remote
* Schedule: Part-Time Internship
* Duration: 3 months with the possibility of permanent employment after the internship period


**Requirements**
**Ideal Candidates:**
* Students pursuing a degree or recent graduates in Graphic Design, Visual Arts, or a related field.
* Aspiring graphic designers with a strong portfolio showcasing their design skills.
* Creative thinkers who enjoy crafting visually appealing and impactful designs.
* Effective communicators who thrive in collaborative team environments.
* Detail-oriented individuals excelling in fast-paced, creative settings.
* Enthusiastic learners dedicated to refining their design skills.
* Proficiency in design software such as Adobe Creative Suite (e.g., Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign) is highly valued.
* Familiarity with web design principles and digital media advantageous.
* Some initial industry experience is a big plus.


**Your Contribution:**
* Contribute to graphic design projects, creating visuals for digital and print media.
* Collaborate with the design team to develop branding and marketing materials.
* Assist in creating engaging illustrations and layouts for various platforms.
* Bring fresh perspectives and innovative solutions to design challenges.
* Foster a collaborative team environment focused on excellence in graphic design.
* Support in documenting and presenting design concepts and solutions.


**Benefits**
**Why Join Us?** 
 Kreativstorm is a dynamic and innovative management-consulting firm headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Our team of experienced consultants brings a diverse range of talents and backgrounds, allowing us to provide tailored solutions to businesses of all sizes and industries. As part of the Yes Network Group, LLC, a reputable US holding company, we have access to extensive resources and expertise. Join us and start your journey in graphic design today!
   

  

 Apply now and pave the way for your future in graphic design!

title: Product Designer
description:
*Natural Cycles° is a leading women’s health company that developed the world’s first birth control app, used by millions globally. We are a fast growing startup, and we promote an international working environment filled with smart and ambitious colleagues based in Stockholm, Geneva, New York, and remotely. Our mission is to pioneer women’s health through research and passion, empowering every woman with the knowledge she needs to take charge of her health.* 




  





 We’re looking for a Product Designer for the Device Integrations area in our Product team to help us define how our users interact with our app through different measuring devices - oral thermometers and wearables (Oura Ring and Apple Watch).
 



  





 By joining our team, you’ll get the opportunity to collaborate on a variety of projects with a team of Product Designers, User Researchers, Software Engineers, and Data Scientists in a fast-paced, rapidly growing environment. You’ll work on strategic projects as well as short, iterative A/B tests where you’ll get to see the impact of your work right away.
 



  





  





**What you will be doing** 



* You’ll be a part of the Product team and work across our app but your main focus will be on designing a smooth experience for our users regardless of the measuring device they use with our app.
* You’ll work on projects from start to finish - mapping out user journeys, wireframing, sketching, and creating polished visual mockups. Your main focus will be designing how users connect devices and interact with data from integrations.
* You’ll collaborate with our Software Engineers to build up and improve our existing integrations.
* You’ll be working in a tight-knit agile team with a Product Manager, other Designers, Software Engineers and Quality Assurance Engineer on a day-to-day basis.
* You’ll be frequently collaborating with our User Research team at different stages of product development.
* You’ll have the opportunity to contribute to the team’s product roadmap, ideating ways to improve our product on your own and with the team.
* You’ll also be a part of the Product Design team, collaborating with designers from across product teams at Natural Cycles. You’ll contribute to the development and maintenance of our design system and brand, collaborate on strategic projects, and help build team processes.



  





**What skills and experience we think you have** 



* You’ve been working with Product Design for 3+ years in consumer-focused products.
* You have a good understanding of UX processes and user/centered design practice.
* You have experience in advocating for a user-centered mindset in your team and stakeholders around you by conducting workshops, brainstorming sessions, etc.
* You can design beautiful interfaces, applying your knowledge of color, typography, layout, and other design principles.
* You have experience working with design systems.
* You’re used to working with a data-driven design process and incorporate both quantitative and qualitative data in your work.
* You’re able to articulate and explain your ideas, can listen to and give feedback, and work well both independently and as part of a team.
* You might also have experience working with device integrations or complex user flows.
* You have an online portfolio or PDF with case studies of projects and design implementations that you can’t wait to share with us!
* We are a hybrid-remote team and will prioritize candidates who are located in Stockholm or can travel to our office there regularly.



  





**What we offer** 



* Flexible work arrangement - you will be part of a team based in and around Stockholm that values effective collaboration and transparent communication, irrespective of work location
* Professional development - you will collaborate with industry leading developers, promoting continuous growth and skill enhancement
* Modern technology - you will leverage innovative technologies and tools, within an environment that empowers you to contribute ideas and take ownership of your work
* Impactful projects - you will contribute to groundbreaking projects that redefine industry standards and create tangible value
* Commitment to quality - you will join a dynamic and progressive organization that prioritizes profitable, long-term product development



  





**Location** 




 We are remote-friendly, but we find great value in being able to connect with our teams in person. Most of the Product team you will work with is located in Stockholm.
 



  





**Sounds interesting?** 




 If you want to be part of a successful team, we encourage you to apply for this position as soon as possible.
 



 We look forward to hearing from you!
 



  





**How to apply** 




 To apply, just upload your CV and answer the questions on the application form. Keep in mind that we can't accept applications through email because of GDPR, and only applications submitted via the career site (and in English) will be considered.
 



  





 At Natural Cycles we value diversity and inclusion because we know that teams with people from different backgrounds and experiences are stronger. We welcome candidates from all walks of life and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates.

title: Senior UI Designer (12 month FTC) | Candy Crush Saga
description:
**Craft:**
 UX & UI
   

  

**Job Description:**
 Are you ready to take our players on an incredible journey? Do you aspire to create the world’s best mobile games? We are seeking UI talent to help us level up and ensure our games are as inclusive and engaging as possible. You’ll drive our team forward to deliver unforgettable experiences that delight players across the world.
   

  

 Your role within our Kingdom
   

  

 As an experienced and talented Senior UI Designer, you’ll work closely with UX and game designers, user researchers, developers, game artists and technical artists. Collaborating with internal stakeholders, UI lead and producers, you will work on the effective and optimised user interface systems and new player-centric features for Candy Crush. With your passion for interaction and communication design, you’ll help us to apply design principles in practice and proactively share your knowledge with other UI designers and game artists.
   

  

 As a member of the Candy team you’ll participate in a cross-location collaboration. We believe your communication and organisation skills will help you to champion our cooperation on features and information exchange among the teams.
   

  

 Skills to create Thrills
   

  

* You have experience in UI design for games
* Experience in UI implementation with game engines
* You have a well-developed sense of visual aesthetics
* You have knowledge of technical constraints and assets optimisation
* You can apply interaction and communication design to your work
* You are confident in analysing design specs
* You are a proactive and reliable team player


 Bonus Points
   

  

* Skills in animation, motion design and special effects
* Experience working in an agile project environment
* Passion for mentoring and supporting the growth of others


 A portfolio demonstrating all aspects of your skill, including any relevant personal projects, is required.
   

  

**About King**
 At King, we're Making the World Playful. Heard of Candy Crush? We're the creators behind it. With game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in Dublin, San Francisco, New York, and Malta, we have a 20-year history of delivering some of the world's most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry and are on a mission to level-up the little moments for our more than 200 million active monthly users. But we aren't just crushing it with candies, we're also behind Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch, Pet Rescue and loads of other sweet games. As a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world, King is part of Activision Blizzard, which was acquired by Microsoft.
   

  

**A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes**
 King strives to be a place where everyone can be their most authentic self. We recognize that diversity, equity and inclusion is a vital and continuous conversation, and that change only happens when we all come together. It’s our mission to build a diverse and inclusive Kingdom for our people, players, and community.
   

  

**Making the World Playful**
 Making the World Playful is our mission – it’s the thread that connects our people, our players, and our passion for our games. Let’s face it, who doesn’t love a bit of fun?
   

  

 Kingsters are seriously playful: creative thinkers who balance art and science to bring moments of magic to millions daily. But our players aren’t the only ones that can level-up. We’re always looking for ways to champion each other and make what’s already great, even better.
   

  

 So, if this feels like a fun way to spend your days, and you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful.
   

  

 Applications need to be in English.
   

  

 Discover King at careers.king.com

title: Graphic Designer & Art Director
description:
A Day’s March is seeking a Graphic Designer / Art Director to join our marketing team. We’re looking for someone with a strong passion for design, photography, style, fashion, and marketing. You should have both the ideas and execution skills to ensure A Day’s March stands out in today’s busy digital landscape. To thrive in this role, you’ll need a keen awareness of pop culture and a sharp eye for current visual and marketing trends
 



  





  





**Key Responsibilities** 




  




* Develop and deliver graphic solutions and designs for all communication channels on a daily basis.
* Collaborate with the creative team to plan and execute on-brand photoshoots and videos.
* Manage multiple projects simultaneously, ensuring the timely delivery of high-quality creative assets for organic channels, in-store displays, and paid media.
* Support the clothing design team with visual assets and final artwork when needed, including labels and brand collaborations.
* Stay current with industry trends, competitor activities, and best practices in art direction and graphic design.
* Be open-minded and solution-oriented, especially when receiving feedback from sales channels (e-commerce and retail).
* Provide input on creative briefs and collaborate effectively with team members to achieve project goals.



  





**Qualifications** 




  




* Education from institutions like Hyper Island, Berghs School of Communication, Beckmans School of Design, or relevant experience from a similar position at a design or in-house agency.



  





**Preferred Skills** 




  




* Expertise in Adobe Creative Suite, Figma, and fluency in written and spoken English.
* A strong interest or experience in motion graphics, video editing, or video production is a significant plus.



  





**How to Apply** 



* Interested candidates should submit a resume, cover letter, and portfolio showcasing relevant work to rasmus@adaysmarch.com. Please include "Art Director Application - [Your Name]" in the subject line.

title: Devops, dataengineer, HR, marketing
description:

 noQ is a

 .

 ﻿
 

 See www.noq.nu for more information.

Here are some roles we recruit for: system developer, legal advisor, project manager, art director, doer, finance support, data scientist, copywriter, People and culture specialist, mood manager, data engineer, designer, UX, scrum master, board member, requirement specialist, ML engineer, event manager, product owner, devops, system architect, marketeer, administrator, visionary etc.

 You apply via our homepage to one of our infomeetings: https://noq.nu/bli-volontar/
 



 After this meeting it is up to you to proceed. If you go all in, we decide on a start date together. Welcome to noQ - we have sympathy - do you?

title: Marketing Automation Specialist / Martech Developer
description:
We are the leading marketing and sales transformation partner in the Nordics! We have several years of experience in data-driven marketing and sales across B2C & B2B industries.
   

  

 Our vision is to become the leading actionable marketing data-asset provider in Europe by 2025.
   

  

 We believe that to survive, companies will have to invest in capabilities related to intelligence & AI, customer experience orchestration and change management.
   

  

 Our mission is to foster customer-centric organisations equipped to grow and face the future, our future growth will be heavily driven by applying smart data and analytics for our clients.
   

  

**Why Avaus?**
 We are the leading digital transformation partner for marketing and sales leaders across B2C and B2B in the Nordics. We work with some of the industry leading brands and our offerings are at the forefront of data-driven customer centricity and operational efficiency. We typically advise our clients on how to leverage AI, personalisation, automation, customer experience orchestration (martech) and new ways of working. You will join our 80+ colleagues in Finland, Sweden and Germany, Italy and Poland.
   

  

 Our mission is to foster data-driven and customer-centric organisations equipped to grow and face the future by helping them adopt and apply smart data and analytics at scale, and speed.
   

  

 Our vision is to become a recognized leading European player in our domain. We believe that to survive, and defy hyper competition and other business challenges, companies will have to invest heavily in new sales and marketing capabilities, technical as well as organisational.
   

  

**The team**
 Our team of ambitious martech consultants provide clients with the cutting edge of tools and platforms for data-driven marketing and sales to drive their business results. We convert data into actionable insight and personalised customer experiences at scale.
   

  

 We are growing our engagement technology team in Helsinki and/or Stockholm with more Systems Specialists with experience from different martech suites such as Adobe, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Voyado, Braze etc. We are a lean organisation and every new Avausian is an integral part of our future as well as the foundation of our capabilities. We prioritise the needs of our clients to deliver the best possible service. Our culture is driven by fun, enthusiastic people who are excited by what we do and the genuine impact we deliver in transforming the capabilities of enterprises across the Nordics.
   

  

**The role**
 As a Marketing Automation Specialist You Will Be Working Closely With Our Customers To Create Lasting Customer Experiences And Enable Data Driven Marketing Across Channels. You Will Most Likely Be Doing Most Of These Things
   

  

* Implement martech platforms in clients existing architecture
* Integrate and move data across martech systems with real time integrations as well as batch.
* Advise clients on data technology as well as digital marketing
* Data modelling for clients across various industries
* Customise and optimise functions in martech platforms. Often using built in scripting and mark-up from the target systems
* Be in daily contact with clients and colleagues in cross functional teams
* Deliver key business results such as driving customer acquisition, increasing up & cross-sell activities, churn reduction and increasing ROI.
* Build campaign/landing pages and other applications using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL etc
* Operate Marketing Automation software, including building customer journeys, campaign management and activating customer engagement in different channels
* Support in the analysis and optimisation of digital advertising campaigns with an omni-channel touch (Display, Social, SEM)
* Analyse web, CRM and digital marketing results and creating suggestions for further improvement and optimisation across channels.
* Execute continuous A/B testing and optimising workflows based on results.


**Who are you?**
**Skills**
 We think your personality, attitude and ambition are just as important as the skills you have. There are some things we think will help you succeed in this role at Avaus:
   

  

* Business and marketing oriented mindset
* Solution and results oriented - consultancy mindset focusing on the big picture
* Curiosity to learn more about data driven marketing and marketing technology
* Team player skills with consultative ”can-do” attitude and good communication skills
* Quick understanding of customers marketing and business needs
* Fluency in English and preferable in Finnish and/or Swedish


**Technical Skills That Are Required**
* Some experience in marketing automation platforms such as Adobe Campaign, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Unica, Hubspot, Pardot, Marketo, Voyado or Braze etc
* Experience and understanding of relational databases with at least a basic level of proficiency in SQL.
* Data modelling skills
* Good to have at least basic knowledge in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
* Proficiency in some programming language (C#, VB, Java)


**Technical Skills That Are a Bonus**
* Technical experience of digital channels such as e-mail, SMS
* Familiarity with analytics tools, such as GA/GTM, or Qlik Sense
* Experience working within a version control management system, such as GitHub
* Experience with project management systems, such as Jira or Asana
* Experience with CRM tools, such as MS Dynamics or Salesforce CRM
* Understanding of good semantics and mobile first web design
* Understanding of UX/UI design
* Basics in web / marketing analytics


**Practical Information**
 This is a permanent position with a 6 months’ probation period, based at either our Helsinki or Stockholm office. Starting date as soon as possible or by agreement. We offer a hybrid remote workplace. You will report to the Head of Delivery of the office in which you are employed.
   

  

 Already feel like one of us? Send your applications in English as soon as possible, but no later than October 15. If you have any questions about the position, please contact Matti Cornér in Helsinki or Ellen Lübeck in Stockholm. Due to GDPR, we only accept applications through our career page.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Fintech Services Product Manager
description:
Join our Team
   

  

**About This Opportunity**
 At Ericsson Mobile Financial Services (MFS) we enable financial inclusion - truly using technology for doing good in society! Our systems are used by hundreds of millions every day for services such as peer to peer transfers, payments, disbursements, loans, savings etc. Our Ericsson Wallet Platform (EWP) is a sophisticated product designed to empower our clients—comprising mobile operators and banks—to deliver mobile financial services. Collaboratively, we are dedicated to enhancing the financial well-being of countless users across the world.
   

  

 As Fintech Services Product Manager in MFS, you will be leading the work to create truly user centric financial services for new and existing customers. You will be part of the MFS Product Management team, reporting to the Head of Product Management.
   

  

 Have you ever wondered how important your daily contribution could be if you were given the chance to work in a team using the strength of a big company like Ericsson and the agility of a fintech startup? If yes, this career opportunity will certainly be of interest to you! We are now looking for a passionate, results-oriented and professional teammate to join us.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Create and develop market, industry, customer, business, and competitor knowledge relevant for new fintech services.
* Develop and implement product strategies and roadmap for new fintech services with clear customer and user value in each release.
* Translate and communicate customer and market needs into product requirements for both internal R&D and partner product development.
* Work closely with the engineering team to ensure the timely and quality delivery of product features.
* Design and optimize the customer journey to ensure a seamless and satisfying experience, and work with customer support teams to address issues, gather feedback, and improve the service
* Develop and execute go-to-market strategies for new services or features, and collaborate with product marketing create compelling messaging and promotional materials


**You will bring**
* MBA or relevant business or engineering degree or an education in design-thinking, UX or service design
* At least 5 years' experience from the fintech industry, banking or payments
* Strong empathy for customers and a passion for delivering a high-quality user experience.
* Experience from conducting market research, understand market trends, identifying customer needs, and based on this developing and implementing product strategies that align with the business goals of the organization
* Experienced in agile service development and use of UX & design-thinking tools
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities to overcome obstacles and find innovative solutions
* Proven track-record of leading cross-functional teams and influence others without direct authority
* Excellent communication & presentation skills
* Strong project and program management skills


**Application**
 We look forward to your application with CV in English. We target 40% work-from-home.
   

  

 Last day to apply: 30th of September 2024
   

  

 Please note that we do not accept, proceed, or respond for applications sent via e-mail.
   

  

 If you have specific questions, you are welcome to contact Raheleh Rouhani, Sr. Recruiter at raheleh.rouhani@ericsson.com
   

  

 Location: Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 749644
   

  

 ]]>

title: Senior Software Engineer, Trilogy (Remote) - $60,000/year USD
description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?
   

  

 Are you a talented software engineer who regularly uses AI tools to reach superhero status? We're looking for someone eager to use AI to craft intelligent, forward-thinking solutions that will bring our 100+ product portfolio into the modern world.
   

  

 At Trilogy's core, we have a strategic product line reshaping industries and how people work and learn. Here's a glimpse of our strategic product line:
   

  

* AdvocateHub: Integrate an AI-powered bot using a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) approach with OpenAI's GPT-4. You'll develop a seamless sidebar widget, implement feature flags, and build a robust logging mechanism to capture KPIs. Sharpen your skills in AI integration, UI/UX design, and data-driven development.
* Jive Cloud: Build a game-changing AI feature using generative AI and the Jive REST API. You'll leverage AI interactions within existing user activities, abstract the AI provider for flexibility, and optimize search functionality. Grow your expertise in AI architecture, API design, and performance optimization.
* ACRM: Develop a cutting-edge CRM solution that seamlessly integrates sales, marketing, and support into a sophisticated, user-friendly interface. You'll work on building advanced data analytics modules, implementing machine learning algorithms for predictive insights, and creating intuitive data visualization tools. Expand your skill set in data engineering, AI/ML, and UI/UX design while creating a platform that drives customer success.


 In this role, you can expect to navigate the complexities of integrating AI-driven solutions into these exciting product lines, offering unique opportunities to innovate. Your expertise will guide the development of scalable, serverless applications and innovative features, leveraging the full potential of cloud-native technologies.
   

  

 Here's what you can expect from our application process:
   

  

* A quick check: Answer a few yes/no questions to confirm you meet the basic requirements.
* Prove your potential: Take a 15-minute cognitive assessment (the Criteria CCAT), scientifically proven to be the best predictor of success in roles that require rapidly gaining and applying new knowledge.
* Showcase your skills: Demonstrate your coding prowess by writing, testing, and refactoring code, developing new features with AI, and collaborating with AI to diagnose and solve problems.
* Connect with leadership: Engage in a 30-minute Google Meet interview with a member of our Engineering leadership team.


 This comprehensive process takes approximately 5 hours, which you can complete at your own pace. We value your time and effort, so we'll provide the results of each assessment within 24 hours of completion and interview decisions within 3 business days.
   

  

 Are you up for the challenge? Trilogy is for the brave, the curious, and the forward-thinking. We're remapping the world of work with AI as our compass. Ready to join the journey?
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Leverage cutting-edge AI tools to improve efficiency in coding, error detection, feature development, bug fixing etc.
* Modernize our strategic product lines through AI-driven innovations, enhancing performance, scalability, and user engagement.
* Develop and deploy efficient back-end solutions using serverless technologies, focusing on creating robust, cloud-native applications.
* Conduct comprehensive code reviews and collaborate with a global team to ensure best practices and high standards.
* Crafting AI 2nd Brains --AI-driven summaries of product, domain, or company knowledge--making you and your team smarter and faster.
* Becoming an AI pioneer leading the charge in integrating AI into software engineering, proving it's a force multiplier, not a replacement.


**What You Won’t Be Doing**
* Routine Monotony: We keep cumbersome infrastructure tasks to a minimum so you can focus on creating innovative solutions.
* Endless Meetings: We value your expertise in development over sitting in meeting rooms. Expect more coding, less talking.


**Senior Software Engineer Key Responsibilities**
 Enhance product functionality and effectively integrate AI-driven solutions into our cloud services.
   

  

**Basic Requirements**
* 4+ years of experience in software development with a focus on writing production code for the server-side of web applications.
* At least 2 years of experience being the primary technical contributor in a team for a software product's development.
* At least 1 year of hands-on experience with cloud-native development (any cloud vendor) or serverless architectures.
* Experience leveraging AI tools like Copilot, Cursor, or ChatGPT in day-to-day software development (e.g. creating prompts for coding tasks).
* Proficiency in SQL AND at least 2 other programming languages (preference for Typescript, Javascript, Python, and C#)
* Must be willing to learn and work in new programming languages with the help of AI


**About Trilogy**
 Hundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.
   

  

 There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!
   

  

**Working with Crossover**
 This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $30 USD/hour, which equates to $60,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.
   

  

**What to expect next:**
* You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
* Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.


**Important!** 
 If you do not receive an email from us:
   

  

* First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
* Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
* Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
* If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.


 Crossover Job Code: LJ-3889-SE-Stockhol-SeniorSoftware.026

title: Backend Engineer - Workforce Management
description:
**About Us**
 In 2022, Instabee was founded after combining Budbee and Instabox - two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox, and Porterbuddy. Instabee serves millions of consumers across Europe with convenient deliveries and is on track to become the leading European e-commerce enabler. Always with the consumer at heart.
   

  

 We’re fast, both in terms of parcel delivery and when it comes to growing our business. So far our journey has taken us from Sweden to the rest of Scandinavia and parts of continental Europe, but we have no plans on stopping anytime soon. As we continue to expand, the complexity of Instabee grows in parallel. With that in mind, we’re now looking for you to help us on the journey ahead.
   

  

**Some Of The Things You’ll Do**
 You will work in a team that is creating our workforce management system which includes optimizing scheduling, simplifying shift management for both managers and employees, enabling performance management and more! We streamline communication for staffing needs and time management, and we create efficient conditions for courier management. Your work will have a direct influence on the success of Instabee, making our operational processes more reliable and efficient, and improve workforce performance.
   

  

**Your Future Team**
 The Workforce Management team consists of four developers, a data scientist, and a UX designer today, and we are now looking for one senior backend developer to join our amazing team. The team operates with a high level of autonomy, allowing you to make a significant impact on our systems and processes. We are a highly collaborative team and we’re looking for someone who enjoys learning, sharing, and working with other developers to solve new and interesting problems.
   

  

**What We're Looking For**
 At Instabee we value individuals who are keen to learn, and your eagerness to develop your own skill set will undoubtedly be your strongest asset when joining us. If you're a skilled problem solver who loves coding and making complex things work, then this is the place for you. Beyond that we imagine that you have some of the following points on your resumé:
   

  

* +5 years experience in a backend or fullstack role in a modern Tech environment
* Experience with Java or Kotlin, and/or Node.js
* PostgreSQL and/or MongoDB experience (or equivalent database technologies)
* Basic understanding of Terraform and/or devops
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English


 If this is you then we can’t wait to meet you!
   

  

**What You’ll Get**
 We can promise you that you will be challenged, develop your skills and have the opportunity to work with truly amazing and competent colleagues. If you like changes and want to set new processes and ways of working - this is the place for you!
   

  

**Benefits**
 Of course, we have all the necessary and standard benefits in place, but in addition to this, we can also offer:
   

  

 🌇 Sky-High Office: Modern and newly renovated with a 360-degree view around Stockholm.
   

  

 🐶 Puppy Friendly: Bring your dog to work - we've got a whole floor for our furry friends!
   

  

 🍸 Rooftop Fridays: Chill out at our Friday rooftop bar with the best views in town
   

  

 🥐 Wednesdays Tech Breakfasts: Fuel your midweek with tech talks and tasty bites.
   

  

 👾 Tech Demos: Dive into the latest innovations with our regular tech showcases.
   

  

 💻 Modern Tech Stack: Work with cutting-edge technology every day.
   

  

 🏓 Fun & Games: Ping pong, Shuffleboard, Foosball, and even a Karaoke Room for your leisure time.
   

  

 ⏰ Flexible Hours: Hybrid setup with working hours that adapt to your lifestyle.
   

  

 👶 Parental Pay for Six Months: Step away from work and provide the best care
   

  

 and love to your little one.
   

  

 🎂 A Day Off on Your Birthday: We love to celebrate, so enjoy your birthday to the fullest with a day off each year!
   

  

 Diversity and inclusion is very important to us and we are committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We want to be a workplace where everyone’s perspectives and opinions are valued, and we are dedicated to creating opportunities for all employees to thrive and reach their full potential.
   

  

*This recruitment process consists of background checks via Verifiera as a review of previous public criminal records. The result is public information that is handled confidentially. This is mandatory for all recruitment processes at Instabee (Instabox/Budbee) in Sweden.*
 Instabee was founded in 2022 after combining Budbee and Instabox - two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox and Porterbuddy. Instabee is present in six countries, serving thousands of online merchants, including ASOS, Zalando, Inditex and H&M and is on track to become the most admired European e-commerce enabler.
   

  

 Since the start, Instabee has focused on consumer-centric and sustainable solutions, offering deliveries to boxes and homes using muscle power, electricity, renewable diesel and biofuels. Through bespoke technical solutions, Instabee can guarantee optimal fill rates and routing, minimising any unnecessary transports. Instabee is backed by Kinnevik, Creades and EQT, among others.

title: Backendutvecklare .NET/Azure till prisbelönt digitalbyrå
description:
***Att vakna på morgonen med längtan att gå till jobbet!***
 Vi har ett mål att alla som jobbar hos oss ska trivas så mycket att man vaknar med ett leende på måndag morgon. Vi är kanske inte Sveriges bästa bolag inom alla punkter men vi är Sveriges näst bästa bolag enligt Great Place to Work 2020. Vi tror att det beror på vår energi och nyfikenhet, vårt sätt att välkomna olikheter och våra erfarenheter som vi gärna delar med oss av.
   

  

 Rebel and Bird är ett av B3s dotterbolag som tar hand om kunders önskemål och krav och förädlar dessa till flerfaldigt prisbelönta tekniska lösningar. Du blir inte nedbunden i gamla tekniker utan får möjligheten att jobba med det senaste inom backend och utvecklas med oss varje dag. Vårt absolut tydligaste mål med verksamheten är att alla ska ha kul på jobbet. Det låter som en plattityd men det är vårt stora mål. Vi försöker (när så går) att träffas och göra roliga saker utanför arbetstid någon gång i månaden utöver julfest, sommarfest och konferenser.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
 Du kommer arbeta både i interna och externa åtaganden, dvs i våra egna produktutvecklingsteam där vi tar helhetsgrepp på våra kunders önskemål, från koncept till UX och publicerad webb samt ibland på konsultbasis i våra kunders team. Vi har i dagsläget tre större åtaganden men en hel del mindre inhouse-projekt och externa konsultåtaganden. Här är två större inhouse-åtaganden:
   

  

* Parks and Resorts - Vi utvecklar hela webblösningen inhouse i samarbete med kundens redaktörer och produktägare för samtliga parker. Den tekniska plattformen utvecklas med contentful/gatsby och .NET/Azure. Vi har blivit uppmärksammade nationellt för detta arbete, dels med ett silver i Svenska Designpriset 2019 för Kolmården, en nominering i Svenska Designpriset 2020 för Gröna Lund (prisutdelningen har ännu inte skett så vi vet inte var vi landar) samt Kolmården seger i IDG topp-100 för bästa turismsajt.
* Filmstaden - Har du bokat/köpt biobiljett? Kanske inte på sistone men innan året som gud glömde gjorde du antagligen det har du använt vår lösning. Vi ansvarar för all extern webb samt vissa interna delar. Med denna sajt vann vi IDG topp100 2018 (då SF Bio). Webben utvecklas i en episervermiljö med .NET och Azure.


**Vi tror att du har:**
* Ca 5 års erfarenhet av att arbeta skarpt som utvecklare. Det är viktigt att du arbetat i enterprise-projekt med webb för många slutanvändare.
* .NET och Azure-kompetens


**Det är meriterande om du har:**
* Kapacitet att ta tead-roll i våra projekt.
* Kompetens inom Episerver och Contentful-erfarenhet, Xamarin
* Erfarenhet som konsult


**Vi erbjuder**
 Vi är en flexibel arbetsplats som kommer erbjuda distansarbete även när pandemin är över. För dem som vill jobba från kontoret på Sveavägen är det bara att komma in och jobba, dem som föredrar distansarbete kommer jobba primärt hemifrån men vara på kontoret 1-2 dagar i veckan i alla fall av primärt sociala skäl. Vi vill inte bara vara en namnlista på Slack. Utöver den naturliga komptensutvecklingen som sker av att arbeta i team med likasinnade erbjuder vi både externa och interna utbildningar. Vi startar exempelvis ett nytt initiativ vi kallar Kompetensnätverk - Från utvecklare till arkitekt, där en av våra lösningsarkitekter guidar dem som vill mot mer kunskap inom arkitektur för att förbereda dig för en roll som lösningsarkitekt om du så önskar.
   

  

 Läs mer om hur det är att jobba på B3 och Rebel and Bird och hur vi arbetar med wellness och våra sociala initiativ här
   

  

 Klicka på ansökan eller tveka inte att kontakta Jocke Ginsburg på telefonnummer: 073-8133010 eller email: jocke@rebelandbird.com

title: React Native Utvecklare till B3 Mobile
description:
B3 Mobile är dotterbolaget inom koncernen som är
 ***experter***
 på apputveckling. iOS, Android, Cross-platform - Vi kan det!
   

  

 Vi söker dig som vill ta nästa steg i din karriär. Du kanske har arbetat med React Native utveckling i några år och känner dig redo för något nytt. Håll i hatten, för hos B3 Mobile arbetar vi med några av världens mest spännande kunder baserade både i Stockholm och på andra sidan Atlanten.
   

  

 I rollen som React Native utvecklare kommer du att arbeta tillsammans med ett kompetent och passionerat gäng utvecklare, UX-designers och projektledare både in-house och ute hos kund.
   

  

**Vi letar efter dig som:**
* Har en bakgrund som civilingenjör eller motsvarande
* Besitter goda kunskaper i Svenska, både i tal & skrift
* Har 3+ års erfarenhet som React Native utvecklare
* Kunskap om skillnader mellan standarder och API:er för iOS- och Android-plattformarna
* Erfarenhet av att sätta upp CI/CD pipelines för mobila applikationer
* Arbetar med fokus på slutanvändarnas upplevelse
* Levererar högkvalitativ kod som är ren och lätt att förstå och utöka
* Är proaktiv och kommer med förslag på lösningar inom de projekt du arbetar med


**Intresset ska självfallet vara ömsesidigt. Det här erbjuder vi dig:**
* Möjlighet att arbeta med tekniskt utmanande lösningar hos många olika kunder med ett stort antal användare.
* Flexibilitet & en hybrid modell där vi ses på kontoret en dag i veckan för att träffa kollegor, jobba tillsammans och lära oss nya saker.
* En snabbrörlig, rolig och trygg arbetsplats där vi strävar efter balans både i arbetslivet och livet i stort.
* Friskvårdsbidrag att lägga på gymkort, padel, massage eller andra aktiviteter.
* Wellness satsning för att säkerställa ditt välmående på arbetsplatsen.


 Vi jobbar mycket med kompetensutveckling, du kommer att vidareutvecklas och utforska de senaste teknikerna tillsammans med hela teamet. Du får ett stort ansvar och arbetar både individuellt och i större team. Vi tror att vår energi och nyfikenhet, vårt sätt att välkomna olikheter och vår vilja att dela med oss av våra erfarenheter bidrar till att skapa en miljö där alla, inklusive du, kan växa och utvecklas.
   

  

 För mer information kontakta Max Svensson, konsult på B3 Mobile, på max.svensson@b3.se alternativt VD Camilla Landén på camilla.landen@b3.se

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Company information:**


LeoVegas’ passion is “Greatest Gaming Experience”. LeoVegas is Sweden’s premier GameTech company and is at the forefront of using state-of-the-art technology for mobile gaming.


A large part of this success can be credited to an extreme product and technology focus coupled with effective and data-driven marketing. Technology development is conducted in Sweden, while operations are based in Malta.


LeoVegas offers casino, live casino and sports betting. We operate global and scalable brands including LeoVegas & Royal Panda, as well as several UK facing brands such as Pink Casino & Bet UK.


At LeoVegas, data is essential to all our decision making needs regarding customer behavior, marketing, social media, product development and discovery of new markets.


The Data Engineering Team is responsible for gathering and processing this information into consumable insights using Big Data technologies.


As our Data Engineer you will join a team of four data engineers and two data quality engineers that works with the latest technologies available inside the Google GCP ecosystem.


You will be responsible for elaborating new solutions, implementing and maintaining batch, near real-time and real time ETL pipelines having quality, performance and costs optimization in mind.


Our pillars:

* Dataflow
* BigQuery
* Airflow


Our language mix:

* Java
* Python
* SQL


We are constantly experimenting and PoC-ing in order to bring our Data Warehouse to the next level.


At LeoVegas Mobile Gaming Group we firmly believe that our diversity is what makes us unique and that everyone and anyone is welcome to enjoy the ride - regardless of age, gender, disability, race, national or ethnic origin, religion, language, marital or civil partnership status, political beliefs and sexual orientation.


We are highly committed to uphold a high level of diversity and inclusion throughout our entire group. Being a global company with a widely diverse customer base makes it essential for our workforce to be a reflection of this.


By doing so, we believe we will achieve the best possible customer experience and create better value to our shareholders by doing so.  

  

**Working Hours:**


We are currently working 1-2 days from the office and rest is work from home.

**Compensation & Benefits:**

* Competitive basic salary
* Life - Occupational injuries & sickness insurance
* Possibility to enroll in an attractive private health care insurance for both you and your partner
* 3,000 SEK wellness contribution p/a
* 30 annual vacation days
* 1,500 SEK tech allowance
* Occupational Pension - Details on request
* Benify - A benefits portal with lots of attractive discounts
* Parental pay when you have worked for us 1 year+
* Plenty of great company events!
* Mobile Phone & Laptop
* If you are not based in the job location, we will also provide you with a relocation package including flights and 2 months accommodation.
