 Attach your CV and a cover letter describing yourself and your motivation for this position. We are selecting candidates continuously, so please apply as soon as possible, but no later than October 9th, 2024 at 23:59 CET.
   

  

 If you have questions about the position, you can reach out to Alexander Wojt, Head of SEK Rates, at phone no +46 8 506 230 66, alexander.wojt@seb.se or Filip Holmström, Fixed Income Sales, at phone no + 46 704622594, filip.holmstrom@seb.se

title: Student Worker to Nasdaq Nordic Listing Services
description:
**Why Nasdaq**
 At Nasdaq Nordic Listings, you will work in the center of the capital market and be part of driving it forward. You will do this by supporting sales, planning, and execution of listing ceremonies, and you may from time to time support the development and execution of strategic initiatives.
   

  

 This role will allow you to support and interact with key internal and external stakeholders but also develop yourself in a dynamic and innovative Nasdaq team. The teams’ focus is on delivering for our clients and at the same time developing our platforms, requirements, and offerings, whilst also establishing Nasdaq as the number one choice among global stock exchanges for listed companies with publicly traded securities.
   

  

 Here, you will work for a global tech leader committed to breaking down barriers to inclusive prosperity. We see technology as a means to free people up to work together more efficiently by centralizing data, analytics, and market intelligence.
   

  

 We are committed to building a more diverse and inclusive workforce. Not only is it our responsibility to do better, but we also need representative voices to power the fresh thinking that is vital for our business and our clients.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 Nasdaq's Nordic Listing Services is looking for one student worker to join the team in Stockholm. The team is responsible for equity listings in Nasdaq’s Nordic markets, and manages the contact with companies wanting to list with Nasdaq, as well as provides customer services to already listed companies. This entails all from arranging IPO events and listing ceremonies, communicating with customers, driving improvements of our offerings, development of sales material, and follow-up of customers and progress.
   

  

 The team has frequent contact with management teams of companies and other stakeholders such as financial and legal advisers, banks, and private equity firms, as well as Nasdaq’s internal units such as Surveillance, Finance, and Marketing among others, providing exposure to many different domains and excellent learning opportunities.
   

  

 The team consists of about a dozen employees based in Sweden, Denmark, and Finland. The roles in the team cover relationship managers, sales support and operations, and strategy and business development.
   

  

**You will primarily support us with**
* Updating our CRM system,
* Preparing and facilitating listing ceremonies,
* Assisting the monthly billing,
* Performing ad-hoc analysis,
* Helping with customer events, and
* Development of sales materials


**What We Expect**
* 1-3 years of study behind you, in economics or engineering or a similar field (finance, technology)
* Self-drive and ability to work self-sufficiently with assigned tasks
* Excellent ability to meet deadlines
* Structured approach with attention to details
* Skilled in Excel, PowerPoint and Word
* A curiosity about the stock market and capital markets in general
* Being able to work at least two days per week, and full-time for a few weeks during the summer


**It Will Be Excellent If You Have**
* Working experience with Salesforce or other CRM systems
* Skills in setting up and managing webinars
* Knowledge of capital markets and financial products


 At Nasdaq, we strive to challenge the status quo and always look for new ways to do things to improve and exceed the collective goals of our teams, company, and customers. A strong inner drive and adaptability are therefore essential to succeed at Nasdaq.
   

  

**This is a part-time position in Stockholm, Sweden.** 
 As the process is ongoing, please submit your application in English as soon as possible. If you have any questions, don't hesitate to get in touch with our Talent Acquisition Partner sanna.hedlund@nasdaq.com
   

  

**Come as You Are**
**Nasdaq is an equal opportunity employer. We positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of age, color, disability, national origin, ancestry, race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable law.**
**We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.**

title: SEB LC&FI Summer Internship 2025 - Commodities Sales in Stockholm
description:
SEB’s division Large Corporates and Financial Institutions (LC&FI) offers talented students an exciting opportunity to work with banking and finance for a few intense summer months. If you have the ambition, we will support you in growing your potential at SEB this summer!
   

  

**The internship in short**
 Your internship starts off with an introduction week where you get to know SEB as an employer but also LC&FI as a division. During the introduction you will meet representatives from the division and participate in learning and networking activities. We end the internship with a closing day where we catch up and share about your experience. As an intern, you are recruited to a specific job role where you will be involved in daily business activities and have a great opportunity to explore the environment of banking. You will be guided by at least one tutor during the internship. For more details visit our webpage here .
   

  

**About The Position**
 Commodities is at the center of everything we do at this globe. We need metals to manufacture the future of zero-emission cars and electricity to power them. We need freight to transport finished goods, and agricultural products to meet the growing population at this planet.
   

  

 The Commodities Sales team is responsible for helping clients manage their financial risks relating to commodities, such as the costs of materials in production or securing the sales price of a finished product. We focus on risks and hedging strategies, as well as means to generate business from idea driven sales towards our Swedish and international corporate clients.
   

  

 We are looking for a person who is eager to learn the sales process and can contribute with proactiveness, advisory and quantitative skills. You will from the start be involved in all aspects of the business. This includes trading on behalf of the clients, building business cases and support in the process of producing the right solutions for each client. You will have a good opportunity to challenge yourself in the sales and advisory role by leveraging on your current knowledge, build new relationships and competence, and influence your future career!
   

  

 Commodities Sales consists of a group of full-time sales representatives in Stockholm/Sweden, and cross-product sales representatives at the international SEB sites. We are a commodity family and strongly believe in cross-collaboration between team-members, sites, and products.
   

  

 Globally, SEBs Commodity organization consists of approximately 30 people within the wider FICC Markets department, selling Fixed Income, Currency, and Commodity products to Swedish and International clients. FICC Markets is one of the largest business areas within SEB’s LC&FI division and our main purpose is to provide access to the financial markets for the division’s clients. So, buckle up for a fast-paced, thrilling experience!
   

  

**Who are you?**
 We are looking for an outgoing and highly motivated person with a proactive mindset and genuine interest in financial markets and the sales role. We believe it will be in your favor to have a strong analytical skill-set, focused way of working, enjoy collaboration and a fast-paced working environment. A “can-do” attitude is a must!
   

  

 You have an ongoing university degree, and an inner drive to learn and excel in one of finance’s most interesting business areas. The position requires that you have excellent verbal and written communication skills in both Swedish and English.
   

  

**Learn More About Working At SEB Www.sebgroup.com/career**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

**Welcome with your application**
 Make sure to include your CV (not LinkedIn profile) with your GPA specified, cover letter and grade transcripts (university and high school). Applications without attached CV won’t be considered. Please submit your application as soon as possible, but no later than October 9th, 2024 at 23:59 CET. If you have questions about the recruitment process, please contact
 *Anders Bäckström,*
*Acting Head of Commodities Sales Sweden at* 
*anders.backstrom@seb.se* 
*.*

title: Marketing Intern
description:
**Company Description** 




  






 Boost your career with Adding Value Consulting (AVC) AB, the largest e-learning platform offering over 200 certifications & online courses in Agile, IT, Lean, Project Management, and Quality Management. AVC is a leading Accredited Training Organization known for providing tailored and flexible training solutions through e-learning, virtual, and classroom courses to ensure the highest levels of knowledge, certification, and customer satisfaction. Our office is in the heart of Stockholm city, Sweden. Come join our diverse international team!
 




  





**Role Description** 




  






 This is a remote internship role as a Social Media Marketing Intern at Adding Value Consulting (AVC) AB. The intern will be responsible for social media marketing, content creation, digital marketing, and communication tasks to enhance the online presence and engagement of the company's professional certification training courses.
 




  





**Duration** 




  




* 2-3 months remote unpaid internship
* Flexible working hour arrangement
* Open for university internship credit program
* Possibility for a paid part-time if we find your portfolio interesting!



  





**What You'll Do:** 




  




* Manage company social media content (mainly Facebook, Instagram, and TikTok)
* Craft and execute a social media strategy
* Get hands-on with video editing and content creation (Instagram reels and TikTok)
* Create engaging posts for social media across platforms



  





**Qualifications** 




  




* Applicants outside of Sweden are welcome! We are an international team
* Student pursuing or completed a bachelor degree in Marketing, Communications, Business, or related field are preferable
* Social Media Marketing and Social Media Content Creation skills
* Digital Marketing and Marketing skills
* Strong communication skills
* Ability to create engaging content for social media platforms
* Knowledge of online marketing trends and strategies is a plus!
* Experience with social media analytics and tools is a plus!



  





**What will make you stand out:** 




  




* If you love creating TikToks – that's a big plus!
* A passion for all things social media
* Skills in video editing and creating eye-catching content
* Someone excited to bring fresh ideas to the table!



  





**Application Requirement** 




  




* Please send us a link to your social media marketing experience portfolio. Personal social media is also welcomed (Can be attached in CV or other files)
* Application without portfolio link may not be reviewed
* Please also send your CV and portfolio to recruitment@addingvalue.se



  






 Contact info:
 





 yasmin.putrialifa@addingvalue.se
 





 inken.beeck@adding-value.de

title: DevOps Engineer to Schneider Electric
description:
*Vi söker dig som gillar att anta nya utmaningar och som vill vara med och utveckla en avancerad och skalbar utvecklingsinfrastruktur på Schneider Electric i Lund. Du kommer vara en del av ett seniort DevSecOps-team där du får möjlighet att varje dag skaffa dig nya erfarenheter och jobba nära personer som är väldigt duktiga inom området.*

**Om Schneider Electronics**


Du kommer tillhöra Schneider Electrics Digital Buildings business som tillhandahåller och utvecklar intelligenta byggnadshanteringslösningar. Detta för att hjälpa kunder att skapa en produktiv och bekväm miljö för de som vistas i fastigheterna samt minska energiförbrukningen.


På avdelningen Building business R&D sitter ca 200 ingenjörer uppdelar inom mjukvara och hårdvara.


På Schneider kommer du trivas men även lyckas om du gillar att utvecklas och samverka men andra människor. Ditt engagemang och vilja att lära dig nya saker kommer inte begränsas utan uppmuntras då Schneider värdesätter innovation och nya idéer.


**Om rollen**


Här kommer du få möjlighet att jobba i ett mindre team som besitter mycket kunskap inom området. Teamet utgår från kontoret i Lund men jobbar globalt i organisationen. Rollen innefattar både eget ansvar samtidigt som du ofta jobbar nära tillsammans med dina kollegor och varje dag för att lösa de tekniska problem som dyker upp. För att hålla koll på er backlog så startar alltid dagen med ett morgonmöte där ni prioriterar era arbetsuppgifter för att lägga fokus på rätt sak vid rätt tid.


**Exempel på dina arbetsuppgifter:**

* Utveckla interna verktyg och lösningar för att stödja vår R&D organisation
* Implementera DevSecOps-teknologier och processer – exempelvis bygga upp, testa, säkra och underhålla infrastrukturen
* Automatisera i den mån det går
* Ständigt förnya och utvärdera ny teknik och tillvägagångsätt
* Samarbeta med mjukvaruteam i Europa och USA

**Din profil**


Schneider lägger stor vikt vid att hitta rätt person och de uppskattar personer som är passionerade och som tycker om att ständigt utvecklas. Ingen dag är den andra lik i denna roll vilket är något som ska kännas spännande och inspirerande. De jobbar ständigt för en inkluderande kultur där alla former av mångfald ger ett stort värde till organisationen. Du drivs av att lösa komplexa problem samtidigt som du är duktig på att kommunicera med olika människor över gränserna.


Vi ser gärna att du:

* Har slutfört en kandidat- eller civilingenjörsexamen i datavetenskap eller motsvarande
* Kan skriva och kommunicera på svenska och engelska
* Har goda kunskaper inom Python
* Har med fördel goda kunskaper inom Linux och Windows

**Meriterande/extra plus**

* Förståelse/kunskap inom Kubernetes, Azure och Rust
* Obehindrad i svenska språket

**Placeringsort:**

* Lund

**Om Hubbau:**


Vi tror att det som driver utvecklingen är människor med känslan av att allt är möjligt. Att kunna hjälpa någon att förvandla sina drömmar till verklighet är det som får oss att älska det vi gör, och är den främsta anledningen till att vi startade Hubbau. Vi ger nyutexaminerade individer möjlighet att få bättre och snabbare personlig utveckling under sitt första yrkesår. Vi erbjuder utmanande konsultuppdrag och möjligheten att bygga ditt professionella nätverk av marknadsledande experter inom Vinngroup.
  

  

Hubbau tillhör Vinngroup, en unik samling av 16 expertföretag som tillsammans har skapat en kreativ och entreprenörsdriven plats för modiga människor som tänker annorlunda.

title: DevOps Engineer at FLIR
description:
**We are looking for a DevOps Engineer to pioneer our Cloud Team!**
-------------------------------------------------------------------


This role is perfect for someone with experience in AWS and Docker who is passionate about building scalable solutions and enhancing cloud-based infrastructure. If you thrive in an innovative environment and enjoy working on cutting-edge technologies, this is the role for you!

**Top qualities we value in our new DevOps Engineer:**


Expertise in cloud infrastructure


Proficiency in automation and CI/CD pipelines


A proactive approach to problem-solving

### **About the job**


As a DevOps Engineer at Teledyne FLIR, you will play a pivotal role in managing and enhancing the infrastructure that supports our innovative cloud platform and applications. You’ll join a newly formed team tasked with the ambitious goal of taking over and advancing our cloud platform development.

### **What You’ll Do**

**Design and Implement Scalable Infrastructure:** Enhance our cloud-based platforms, ensuring scalability and reliability.

**Automation Mastery:** Build and refine automation tools to minimize manual interventions, integrating seamlessly into our CI/CD pipelines.

**Performance Monitoring:** Use advanced monitoring tools to oversee infrastructure and application performance, ensuring optimal operation.

**Advanced Troubleshooting:** Handle complex infrastructure challenges swiftly and effectively.

**Security and Compliance:** Uphold high standards of security and compliance across all cloud operations.

### **About You**


We are looking for candidates with experience in cloud development, who are ready to take the helm in a complex technical environment.

**Experienced in Cloud Technologies:** Proficient with AWS and eager to deepen your expertise in cloud infrastructure.

**Proficient in Containerization:** Skilled with Docker, you’re adept at managing containerized environments and integrating them into development pipelines.

**CI/CD Savvy:** Experienced in crafting and managing AWS CI/CD pipelines, you’re a pro at automating builds and deployments.

**A Collaborative Problem Solver:** With strong collaboration and communication skills, you take initiative and tackle problems head-on.

### **Why FLIR?**


Since our inception, Teledyne FLIR has been at the forefront of thermal imaging and sensor technology, enhancing how critical industries operate worldwide. We are a leader in developing the technology that ensures safety and sustainability. By joining us, you will contribute to a team that values innovation and supports your professional growth with continuous learning opportunities. Plus, you will enjoy our vibrant company culture, community events, and much more.


Apply now and help us shape the future of safety and sustainability technology.

title: Join Greenely's Mission as a DevOps Engineer
description:
At Greenely, we’re pioneering Europe's energy transition by making energy consumption smarter and household energy bills lower. We’re looking for a skilled DevOps Engineer to join us on this ambitious journey, driving innovation in infrastructure and automation to support our growing platform. Your work will directly contribute to building a greener future by enhancing the technology behind our energy-saving solutions.


As part of our mission, we are currently migrating from EC2-based compute to ECS, optimizing our infrastructure, and improving resilience. We're looking for someone with the experience and vision to help lead this transformation.

### **Your daily work includes:**

* Designing, building, and maintaining platform components in AWS to support our development infrastructure.
* Optimizing infrastructure provisioning through Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) practices using Terraform, ensuring robust monitoring and alerting.
* Troubleshooting complex production issues alongside cross-functional teams, ensuring high uptime and reliability.
* Leading on-call incident response and actively participating in service restoration when needed.
* Streamlining our CI/CD pipelines and automating deployment processes for rapid, reliable releases.
* Empowering the engineering team with automation solutions that accelerate development.

### **What you'll need to succeed:**

* **Cloud Expertise**: Hands-on experience with AWS services (EKS, ECS, S3, RDS, Route53) and deep knowledge of scaling cloud environments.
* **Backend Development**: Proficiency in Python-based frameworks and microservices architectures.
* **Containerization**: Expertise in deploying containerized applications using Kubernetes and Docker, along with experience in migrating services to container orchestration tools like EKS and ECS.
* **Database Management**: Proven experience with relational databases like Postgres/MySQL, as well as NoSQL solutions like MongoDB/DynamoDB.
* **CI/CD Mastery**: Solid experience in building automated pipelines for testing and deployment, and working with CI/CD tools like GitHub Actions, Travis CI, or CircleCI.
* **Security and Monitoring**: A strong foundation in Linux systems, security best practices, and experience building monitoring and alerting systems with tools like DataDog or NewRelic.

### **We’ll be really impressed if you:**

* Are passionate about automation and have a proven ability to reduce manual tasks through efficient, scalable solutions.
* Have experience working with Terraform to manage complex cloud environments.
* Can troubleshoot networking, security, and system performance issues with ease.
* Have a deep understanding of DevOps principles and a passion for improving development processes.
* Are a proactive problem solver with excellent communication skills, capable of explaining technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* Thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment and can juggle multiple tasks while maintaining high quality.

  

We place high emphasis on your interpersonal abilities at Greenely. Greenely's strength is drawn from team members who don't just do their job, but who actively shape the way we work. We seek individuals who naturally take charge, own their responsibilities with pride, and consistently hold themselves accountable. We're searching for someone who can gracefully navigate change, who sees challenges not as obstacles but as puzzles waiting to be solved, and who values the collective success of the team.

 **What we can offer you** ‍ **:**

* Flexibility: We are an office-first company that values in-person collaboration, offering flexible work arrangements to support your work-life balance. Our vibrant office is conveniently located in the heart of Stockholm at Vasagatan 40.
* *Growth*: Elevate your career with opportunities for skill development, challenging projects, and advancement within our forward-thinking organization.
* *Influence and Impact*: Your voice matters. Shape the future of energy by contributing your ideas, expertise, and playing a key role in decision-making.
* *Innovative Environment*: Thrive in an ever-changing industry, working on cutting-edge projects and staying ahead of the curve in a dynamic and pioneering work atmosphere.

 **About Greenely**  

  

Greenely aims to create the best customer experience for the modern energy consumer through technology. Greenely's integrated mobile application enables households to optimize their energy consumption, reduce their electricity costs, and participate in grid balancing services. By connecting various energy assets in the home, Greenely's platform allows consumers to manage their energy usage efficiently while contributing to the stability of the power system. Greenely's solution addresses the challenges of the modern energy landscape and promotes a more efficient, sustainable, and reliable power system. By providing consumers with savings and new revenue streams, Greenely drives the transition to a cleaner and more resilient energy system.

  

WE ARE **bold and push the limit.**


WE BELIEVE THAT **f****ast is better than slow.**


WE **t****hink like owners.**


WE **lead with knowledge.**

title: Cloud Fault Tracing Engineer
description:
**As a Cloud Fault Tracing Engineer, you will have direct access to our cloud system running on Aws and using the latest tech stack (K8s, Kafka, docker), to our monitoring and fault tracing tools (such as splunk) test rigs to reproduce the issue from the start. You will work closely with all of the DevOps teams always improving our products. This allows you to share your experience and also to always have people close to our market specific implementation. This role requires a very proactive individual who can work in a fast-paced environment, collaborating with cross-functional teams to address complex technical challenges.**


### **Assignment Description**


* Provide satisfaction to our customer by contributing to improve their experience.
* Serve as a subject matter expert for cloud support for the support teams.
* Talk to a lot of people in order to understand the inner working of some services.
* Set-up test equipment such as cars and rigs to reproduce your issue.
* Be well connected to know ahead what changes are getting implemented.
* Build solid documentation on how to solve some misconfiguration you identify.
* Help design interface and tools to make support easier and faster.


**Requirements**


* BSc degree or higher in engineering, or equivalent experience.
* Master the English language both spoken and in writing.
* AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, Envoy, Istio.
* Jira, GitLab, GitHub, Maven, GitOps, Argo CD.
* Splunk, Linux/ssh/bash, Grafana.

title: Jira Administrator
description:
**We are seeking for a Jira Administrator. You will work in an agile, cross-functional, empowered team with your own responsibility to develop and manage the Zephyr Scale plugin for Jira.**


### **Required Skills**


* Jira Data Center admin skills – know how to perform changes in Jira application and understand the impact of the changes.
* Experience with Zephyr Scale plugin and how to customize it according to business needs.
* Understand how Jira project has been setup in VCC (i.e. VIRA).


**Requirements**


* You will work in a cross-functional team.
* You will work all the way in our development process, from creating requirements to putting code in production.
* Participate and contribute to the DevOps practices.
* Build innovative products and services that will deliver value to our customers.
* Provide end-user support and training as necessary.

title: Data Scientist for AI Service
description:

emagine is looking for a Data Scientist with AI experience for a very exciting assignment within the construction industry

title: DevOps engineer
description:
Vill du som vår Devops Engineer vara med och forma framtidens pensionssystem i en roll där din tekniska expertis och innovativa tänkande gör skillnad på riktigt? Vi söker nu en kreativ DevOps Engineer med erfarenhet av linux som tycker om att följa koden från början till slut och hitta möjligheter för automatisering. Du blir en central spelare i vårt största agila tåg där du får stor frihet att ta ansvar, driva förändringar och bidra till vår kontinuerliga utveckling. Om du trivs med att arbeta i en dynamisk miljö och vill vara bryggan mellan utveckling och drift, då är detta möjligheten för dig!


Pensionsmyndigheten är en myndighet som ligger i framkant när det handlar om teknik och utveckling. IT-avdelningen består idag av ca 350 medarbetare och växer kraftigt för att möjliggöra genomförandet av pensionsgruppens överenskommelse om långsiktigt höjda och trygga pensioner. För oss inom IT innebär detta nyutveckling under många år framöver, av ett flertal nya pensionsförmånssystem - med den senaste tekniken och arbetssätt. Som en del av vår IT-avdelning kommer du att verka i en innovativ miljö präglad av stort driv där nya idéer välkomnas.


Visionen är satt: Bäst IT för Sverige 2025!

### **Om jobbet**


Som DevOps Engineer hos oss blir du en nyckelspelare i vårt största agila tåg. Du är bryggan mellan utvecklingsteamen och drift & infrastruktur. Du och ditt team ansvarar för att skapa en robust och pålitlig basplattform som möjliggör smidiga utvecklings- och driftsprocesser. Ditt arbete sker i nära samarbete med plattformsteam där ni tillsammans tar fram och implementerar nya lösningar för automation, releaseprocesser och CI/CD.


Vi arbetar enligt SAFe i en tågstruktur och du kommer att sitta i ett cross-funktionellt team längs med utvecklingsteam och har ett tätt samarbete med våra shared services. Du kommer arbeta nära utvecklare, andra DevOps och scrum master.


Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden och arbetsuppgifter kommer vara:

* Hjälpa till att optimera pipelines för CI/CD för ditt tåg
* Stötta utvecklare i felsökning och projektuppsättning
* Incidenthantering
* Innovativ utveckling, vi uppmuntrar dig att delta aktivt lyfta och driva nya idéer och lösningar till automatisering
* Samverka med kollegor för att säkerställa att infrastrukturen och säkerheten möter myndighetens behov


Du kommer att arbeta i ett cross-funktionellt team där ni tillsammans löser operativa problem och driver utvecklingen framåt. Beredskapsansvar ingår vissa kvällar och helger per år. Beroende på ditt intresse kan du antingen fokusera mer på programmering eller på systemnära utveckling och underhåll.


Några ord från ditt team: "Vi i team Skalman är ett självorganiserat hybridteam som jobbar enligt det agila ramverket SAFe. Vi arbetar i framkant med tekniska utmaningar som berör utveckling av nästa generations pensionssystem, baserat på mikrotjänster. Vi underlättar kvalitetssäkring av tjänster och system. Utöver det är vår vision att driva innovation och ta ansvar för arkitekturen genom att vara ledande inom vårt område. Tillsammans med teamet kommer du ha möjlighet att utvecklas och arbeta med teknik i framkant, vi ser att du vill växa tillsammans med oss i teamet”.

### **Din profil**


Vi söker dig som har:

* flerårig arbetserfarenhet av systemadministration i en Linuxbaserad produktionsmiljö
* flerårig arbetserfarenhet av scriptprogrammering i linuxmiljöer såsom python, ruby, perl, eller motsvarande
* arbetserfarenhet av Continuous Delivery
* arbetserfarenhet av Jenkins Pipeline och Groovy
* arbetserfarenhet av Docker
* arbetserfarenhet av programmeringsspråk
* kunskap om GIT för versionshantering


Du behöver också ha goda kunskaper i tal och skrift i svenska och engelska. Det är meriterande om du har kunskap inom Kubernetes (Rancher) och/eller Java. Det är även en meriterande om du har arbetserfarenhet av Maven, Elastic Stack (Elastic, Logstash, Kibana), Spring/Spring-boot, verktyg som Ansible, Puppet eller likvärdigt automationsverktyg och/eller agilt arbetssätt.


Det är inte endast vad och hur länge du gjort något som är viktigast, utan vad du har förmåga att göra. Din vilja att tänka utanför ramarna är avgörande för att vi ska kunna utveckla våra tjänster och processer. Du är kreativ, ser förbättringsområden, kommer med idéer och förslag. Du vågar att testa nytt och tänka annorlunda. För rollen behöver du också ha mycket god förmåga att samarbeta och kommunicera, både inom och utanför teamet. Du delar med dig av dina kunskaper och söker andras feedback. Du får en hög grad av frihet och vi förväntar oss att du tar ansvar och är självgående. Du tar ditt arbete och leverans på allvar, håller dig informerad och uppdaterad.


Och eftersom vi är lika många experter som medarbetare, behöver alla vara just nyfikna och intresserade av varandras olikheter. Vi lyssnar in och omvärderar kontinuerligt. Vi tror på mångfald, att olika perspektiv berikar och att du är en viktig framgångsfaktor.


I urvalet kommer vi lägga stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.

### **Vi erbjuder**


Ett myndighetsuppdrag som är viktigt på riktigt! En arbetsplats där vi värnar om att våra medarbetare ska ha en god balans mellan arbete och fritid. Vi tillämpar hybridarbetssätt med möjlighet till distansarbete och arbete på kontoret utifrån en överenskommelse med arbetsgivaren. Som statligt anställd har du även goda anställningsvillkor och ett förmånspaket med friskvård, flexibel arbetstid, lediga klämdagar samt goda semester- och pensionsvillkor. Du kan läsa mer om oss och våra förmåner här.

### **Bra att veta**


Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning och vi förbehåller oss rätten att tillämpa provanställning om 6  

månader vid behov. Tjänsten placeras i Stockholm eller Luleå.


Vårt kontor i Stockholm ligger i Hornstull nära tunnelbanan, där vi sitter i ljusa och moderna lokaler. Är du placerad i Luleå sitter vi i vårt nybyggda kontor som är beläget i Science Park på Porsön.


Anställningen kan komma att placeras i säkerhetsklass.

### **Din ansökan**


Vi jobbar kompetensbaserat i hela processen och är måna om en inkluderande, rättvis, objektiv och kandidatvänlig process. Därför ber vi dig att besvara ett antal urvalsfrågor istället för att be om personligt brev, du ska därför inte bifoga det.


Arbetspsykologiska tester kan komma att ingå som en del av rekryteringsprocessen.


Vi strävar efter en jämn könsfördelning och ser mångfald som en styrka och välkomnar därför sökande med olika bakgrund. IT-avdelningen driver sedan en tid tillbaka ett initiativ för att öka medvetandegrad och fokus på jämställdhet.


Har du skyddade personuppgifter kontakta rekryterande chef som hjälper dig med din ansökan.


#LI-HYBRID


ANSÖK HÄR!

title: Jira Data Center Administrator
description:
Techster Solutions befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst 1+ års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.
  
Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.
  
  

**Rollbeskrivning:**  

Assignment Description
  
Our client in the automotive industry is currently seeking a Jira Data Center Administrator. Our client is at the forefront of creating a digital ecosystem aimed at simplifying their customers’ lives. They are looking for curious and creative individuals who want to make an impact by driving innovation.
  
The digital transformation at our client’s organization is built around a human-centric approach, leveraging Agile and DevOps practices. If you are passionate about being part of cutting-edge software development and contributing to the infrastructure that powers future vehicle technologies, then this is the role for you. Join our client’s cross-functional DevOps team, which focuses on building and maintaining the tools essential for the Test & Traceability area of in-house developed vehicle software.
  
As a Jira Data Center Administrator, you will take ownership of developing and managing the Zephyr Scale plugin for Jira, contributing to the company’s goal of becoming a software-driven automotive leader.
  
  

**Main Responsibilities:****In this role, your key responsibilities will include:**  

Collaborating in a cross-functional team with diverse skills across different areas.
  
Working throughout the entire development process, from creating requirements to deploying code in production.
  
Participating in and contributing to DevOps practices.
  
Developing innovative products and services that deliver value to customers.
  
Providing end-user support and training as required.
  
  

**Required Qualifications:****To succeed in this role, you should have:**  

Expertise as a Jira Data Center Administrator, including the ability to perform changes in Jira and assess the impact of these changes.
  
Experience with the Zephyr Scale plugin and the ability to customize it according to business needs.
  
A strong understanding of how Jira projects are set up, specifically related to VIRA.
  
  

**Desired Attributes:**  

Self-motivated and willing to proactively reach out and collaborate with new people.
  
A strong interest in understanding user needs and the user journey to deliver the best outcomes for product teams.
  
Confidence in facilitating stakeholder forums and engaging in detailed requirements discussions.
  
A curious and open-minded approach to problem-solving.
  
A solid understanding of, and commitment to, Agile team principles and ceremonies.
  
A friendly, outgoing, and patient demeanor that fosters teamwork and communication.
  
  

Ansökan Tror du att du är Techster Solutions nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.
  
Arbetsplats och kulturVi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.
  
Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Senior .NET-applikationskonsult – Stockholm heltid
description:
Modernera är ett modernt rekryterings- och bemanningsföretag. http://www.modernera.se
  
För en av våra klienters räkning söker vi nu en senior .NET-applikationskonsult. Klienten är ett framåtsträvande och växande produktbolag som fokuserar på utveckling av nyskapande mjukvara inom områdena CRM, automatisering och digitalisering. Deras avancerade och användarvänliga lösningar är utformade för att optimera affärsprocesser inom en rad områden som försäljning, support, marknadsföring, kundintegration, fälttjänster, ärendehantering med mera. Med en bred kundbas som sträcker sig från bank- och finanssektorn till industrin, är vår klient en dynamisk aktör på marknaden.
  
Du kommer att jobba i trevliga lokaler i centrala Stockholm. Det finns möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån.
  
Du kommer att ha en central roll i ett innovativt och tajt implementationsteam. Tillsammans med projektteamet kommer du att genomföra implementationer, underhåll och uppgraderingar av SaaS-produkter tillsammans med företagets kunder. Du kommer att delta i planeringen av enskilda projekt och koordinering mellan olika projekt som företaget driver parallellt.
  
  

**Vi söker:**  

Vi söker dig som har minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet inom .NET.
  
Azure DevOps
  
Du har mycket goda kunskaper i tal och skrift på både engelska och svenska.
  
  

**Meriterande:**  

Erfarenhet av att konfigurera och anpassa system i kundimplementationer.
  
  

**Du får:**  

Vår kund erbjuder dig karriärmöjligheter på en modern arbetsplats med utmanande arbetsuppgifter och spännande projekt. Du erbjuds bra arbetsvillkor, pension och friskvårdsbidrag.
  
Du kommer att bli anställd hos vår kund på heltid, med en provanställning som övergår i en tillsvidareanställning efter sex månader. Tillträde: omgående.
  
Ansök genom att skicka ditt CV och personligt brev till info@modernera.se. Skriv ”Senior .NET-applikationskonsult – Stockholm heltid” i ärenderaden.

title: AWS Senior DevOps Engineer
description:
**At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.**

**AWS Senior DevOps Engineer**
------------------------------

**The Senior Cloud DevOps Engineer together with the highly skilled and driven team will enable the adoption of Public Cloud utilization and perform operations and development in a complex environment at scale. The position will allow to not only develop and utilize deep technical skills but also contribute to the design and implementation of a Public Cloud platform. We are looking for the person that, together with the team, will secure execution towards roadmap milestones and our Cloud strategy, daily this might include.**  



* **Serve as a subject matter expert (SME) on Amazon Web Services(AWS) cloud platform.**
* **Stay updated with the latest cloud services, features, and capabilities offered by AWS and evaluate their applicability to business needs.**
* **Help the team automate processes related, but not limited to cloud operations, security configuration, account management and cost optimization.**
* **Promote the Public Cloud offering internally to our stakeholders.**
* **Collaborate with cross-functional teams, stakeholders, and business units to understand requirements, prioritize initiatives, and align cloud strategies with business objectives.**
* **Provide technical leadership, mentorship, and guidance to junior architects, engineers, and developers to foster a culture of innovation, learning, and continuous improvement**

  

**Must have skills:**

* **Deep knowledge of AWS. This includes a deep understanding of platform services, features, and best practices.**
* **Ability to build scalable, resilient, and cost-effective cloud platform solutions based on business requirements and industry best practices. This involves adhering to security and compliance standards.**
* **Experience with Cloud Foundations constructs for Enterprises, such as AWS control Tower, Cloud Adoption Framework etc**
* **Familiarity with containerization technologies like Docker and container orchestration platforms such as Kubernetes.**
* **Experience with infrastructure automation tools such as Terraform, AWS CloudFormation templates to provision and manage cloud resources programmatically.**
* **Use of Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery. The tool is less important - experiences and a mindset to try/execute CI/CD pipelines at scale is key.**
* **Comfortable with Go (and Python) since we use these languages extensively on our team to build serverless integrations and API’s.**
* **Fluent with best practices for software development with a passion for automation**
* **Great communication skills plus well spoken and written English**

  

**Nice to have skills:**

* **Other cloud knowledge – GCP/ Azure.**
* **Ability to translate strategic plans to technical deliverables, including to operational readiness and stability.**
* **FinOps – Cloud Economics, Cost Optimization, Cost Visualization**
* **Experience with practical security and networking**

  

**Must have criteria:**

* **EU citizenship - hybrid work model possible within Europe**
* **Start date within 2-3 weeks**

**#LI-JM16**

**Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fuelled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.**

title: Senior Agil Coach
description:
Jobbeskrivning


Vill du vara med på vår tillväxtresa i Gävle och bidra till framtidens digitala lösningar? Bli en del av vårt team där samarbete, kunskapsdelning och digitala lösningar står i fokus! Nu söker vi minst en Senior Agil Coach inom digital transformation.


I denna roll får du arbeta med projekt- och förändringsledning hos våra kunder inom exempelvis tillverkande industri, energi, offentlig sektor och retail. Arbetet kan innebära både inhouse-projekt och att stötta kund på plats.


Kvalifikationer


Vi söker dig som är en erfaren Agil Coach och Scrum Master med flera års arbetslivserfarenhet, är genuint intresserad av organisationsutveckling och hur det kan bidra till vår och våra kunders framgång. Du har god förmåga att samarbeta, bygga relationer och kommunicera tydligt. Du är affärsmässig, visar tydligt ledarskap och har förmåga att motivera och coacha andra.


För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har:

* Dokumenterad utbildning och certifiering inom agil projektledning och i rollen som Scrum Master.
* Har kompetens och erfarenhet av följande: Agile principles, Kanban Boards, Azure DevOps Boards.
* Gedigen erfarenhet som Agil Coach och förändringsledare.
* Tidigare erfarenhet som konsult.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift.


Ett extra plus om du har erfarenhet av kundorganisationer med mångfunktionella team, lång erfarenhet av förändringsledning och bred kunskap av olika metoder och verktyg liksom agil transformation.


Företagsbeskrivning


AFRY erbjuder tjänster inom teknik, design, digitalisering och rådgivning. Vi är hängivna experter inom industri, energi- och infrastruktur, som skapar värde för kommande generationer. AFRY har en global räckvidd med djupa rötter i Norden. Tillsammans accelererar vi omställningen till ett mer hållbart samhälle.


Ytterligare information


Välkommen med din ansökan, sista ansökningsdag är 2024-10-08. *Obs! Vi rekryterar löpande och tjänsten kan därför komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag.*  

  

Kontaktperson för frågor:  

Jens Andersson, Segment Manager  

jens.andersson@afry.com


Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser.

*På AFRY driver vi förändring i allt vi gör. Vi anser att förändring sker när modiga idéer möts, när vi samarbetar, skapar innovation och omfamnar kreativa lösningar, det är så vi skapar framtiden. Vi söker konstant kvalificerade kandidater som vill ansluta sig till våra inkluderande team runt om i världen. Bli en del av oss och påskynda den gröna omställningen*

title: Global Business Analyst – Finance, Pricing & Management
description:
To strengthen our Data Office team, we’re looking for a Global Business Analyst with focus on finance, pricing and management processes. Joining us in this exciting role, you’ll take full ownership of a specific data domain and will be in a pivotal position to enable the next step for Sandvik Coromant’s journey towards becoming a more data-driven organization.
About us
Sandvik Coromant, part of the global industrial engineering group Sandvik, is at the forefront of developing manufacturing tools and machining solutions, with knowledge that drives the industry standards and innovations demanded by the metalworking industry – both now and in the next industrial era. Collaborations with educational institutions, extensive investments in research and development and strong customer partnership ensure the development of machining technologies that change, lead and drive the future of manufacturing. Sandvik Coromant owns over 1700 patents worldwide, employs around 8000 people and is represented in more than 150 countries.
Your mission
You’re the expert of your data domain and the first speaking partner to understand the needs of our stakeholders. You drive the roadmap and the evolution of our data products, and balance short-term value creation with long-term goals. Through Microsoft BI technologies, you secure priority-setting and enable actionable insights for our strategic and operational decisions. You feel comfortable interacting with stakeholders, as well as acting as sparring partner to internal and external experts and data engineers. At the end of the day, you’re not afraid of getting hands-on when needed.  

Embedded in a strong, truly global team, you bring your ideas and experience and can in return count on your colleagues. You define, realize, and manage all related aspects – such as training and self-service BI – and actively contribute to the development of processes, platforms, and data strategies.
We offer an interesting position covering a wide range of responsibilities, such as:* Management of demands and key stakeholders for the finance, controlling as well as pricing and management domain.
* Responsibility for the domain roadmap, prioritization and planning of activities.
* Leadership of the domain team (no line responsibilities) and responsibility for the deliverables to business stakeholders
* Development of the domains’ data products.
* Speaking partner for reporting and analytics-related questions.
* Supporting operational and strategic company performance management.
* Handling of operational aspects or reporting and analytics, such as access management and lifecycle management.
* Contribution to the development of our guidelines, processes, and platforms.
* Enhance and develop reports as needed to enable insights and support decisions.


The location for this position is flexible within Europe, where most of the stakeholders are located. If you’re located close to one of our sites, we support you in balancing remote work and presence in the office.
Your profile
Your personality makes all the difference! You’re a strong leader with very good communication and organizational skills who feels at home at the intersection of business and data engineering. While you’re not afraid to touch and refine PowerBI reports yourself, you excel at working closely together with and coordinate internal and external stakeholders to secure the best business value. With your proactive mindset for problem-solving and flexibility, you can make a difference in our team and the wider organization!
For this position, you need a degree in Economics, IT, Statistics, Engineering or Mathematics, combined with a few years’ experience in data analysis. Your background and knowledge have given you experience in stakeholder management and you’re comfortable in working with senior management.
We also believe that you need the following knowledge to succeed in this role:* A very good understanding of finance and controlling processes and a handful of years’ experience in supporting finance and controlling or pricing in their reporting demands.
* Proven experience in Power BI, including M and DAX.
* Basic understanding of relational databases such as SQL and experience in data modeling.
* Knowledge of Sandvik Coromant’s finance, pricing and management processes is a plus.
* Experience in requirements management is a plus, preferably in Azure DevOps.
* Experience with Azure DataBricks or Fabrics is a plus.
* Fluency in English, verbally and in writing.


Our culture
Innovation is in our DNA and we’re proud to shape the future of manufacturing in close collaboration with our customers and partners. We believe in an inclusive, equal and open-minded culture, and we nurture our diversities to form a solid foundation for achieving great results. Add fair and rewarding benefits, as well as many different career opportunities in an inspiring global environment. Meet some of your future colleagues at our career page or visit our website, LinkedIn or Facebook page to get to know us further.
Contact information
Are you curious to know more about this position? Please contact Hanna Thomas, recruitment specialist, hanna.thomas@sandvik.com
We have already decided on which advertising channels and marketing campaigns we wish to use, and respectfully decline any additional contacts in that matter.
Union contacts – Sweden:* Thomas Lilja, Unionen, +46 (0)70-261 04 82
* Göran Norell, Akademikerföreningen, +46 (0)70-616 43 78
* Peter Olsson-Andrée, Ledarna, +46 (0)70-222 48 55


Hiring Manager: Philipp Hess

title: Senior DevOps Engineer / Platform Engineer (Azure/AWS)
description:
**About the Job:**  

LuunaX is looking for an experienced and skilled Senior DevOps Engineer / Platform Engineer with a strong background in Infrastructure as Code (IaC) to join our growing team. We are seeking individuals with at least 7 years of experience in cloud infrastructure, automation, and platform engineering. You will help design and maintain robust, scalable, and secure cloud environments for our clients, ensuring that their platforms are reliable, secure, and optimized for performance.
  
  

As a Senior DevOps/Platform Engineer, you will work closely with development and operations teams to automate and streamline infrastructure processes. You will be responsible for managing and provisioning cloud infrastructure (Azure or AWS) and ensuring continuous integration and delivery pipelines are optimized. Your expertise will help drive our clients’ digital transformation initiatives by adopting best practices in DevOps and cloud-native architectures.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

* Design, deploy, and manage scalable infrastructure in Azure and/or AWS using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools such as Terraform, CloudFormation, or Pulumi.
* Automate and optimize CI/CD pipelines for efficient software delivery using tools like Jenkins, GitLab CI, Azure DevOps, or AWS CodePipeline.
* Implement and manage containerization with Docker and orchestration using Kubernetes or EKS/AKS.
* Monitor, troubleshoot, and optimize cloud environments for performance, scalability, and cost-effectiveness.
* Work closely with security teams to ensure cloud security best practices, including IAM, encryption, and compliance.
* Collaborate with development teams to implement DevOps practices and ensure infrastructure is aligned with application needs.
* Stay up to date with the latest cloud technologies and trends, and continuously improve our infrastructure setup.


**Must-Have Qualifications:**  

* 5+ years of experience in DevOps, platform engineering, or cloud infrastructure roles.
* Strong proficiency in Azure and/or AWS cloud platforms, with a deep understanding of networking, storage, and compute services.
* Hands-on experience with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using tools like Terraform, CloudFormation, or similar.
* Experience managing CI/CD pipelines using tools like Jenkins, GitLab CI, Azure DevOps, or AWS CodePipeline.
* Proficiency in containerization technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes (EKS/AKS preferred).
* Strong knowledge of cloud security best practices, including IAM, VPCs, encryption, and monitoring.
* Scripting skills in Python, Bash, or PowerShell for automation.
* Experience with monitoring and logging tools (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, CloudWatch, Azure Monitor).
* Proficiency in English (written and spoken).


**Nice-to-Have Qualifications:**  

* Certification in Azure (e.g., Azure Solutions Architect, Azure DevOps Engineer) or AWS (e.g., AWS Certified Solutions Architect, AWS Certified DevOps Engineer).
* Familiarity with Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
* Experience with serverless architectures using AWS Lambda, Azure Functions, or GCP Cloud Functions.
* Experience with microservices architecture and service mesh (e.g., Istio, Linkerd).
* Knowledge of log management and security incident response in cloud environments.
* Familiarity with big data or streaming frameworks such as Kafka, Kinesis, or Azure Event Hubs.
* Proficiency in Swedish (advantage but not required).


**What’s in it for You:**  

* Work with leading clients in diverse industries like automotive, healthcare, finance, and technology.
* Be part of innovative projects that leverage cutting-edge cloud and DevOps practices.
* Opportunities for continuous professional development, including cloud certifications and leadership pathways.
* A supportive environment with a dedicated consultant manager providing feedback and career guidance.
* Visa sponsorship for you and your immediate family, with the possibility of applying for permanent residency after four years and citizenship after five.


We offer a competitive salary, a comprehensive benefits package, and a collaborative work culture that promotes growth, innovation, and teamwork. If you’re passionate about cloud platforms and automation, we encourage you to apply.
  
  

**To Apply:** Please submit your updated resume. We look forward to reviewing your application!
  
Öppen för alla
  
Vi fokuserar på din kompetens, inte dina övriga förutsättningar. Vi är öppna för att anpassa rollen eller arbetsplatsen efter dina behov.

title: Join Greenely's Mission as a DevOps Engineer
description:
At Greenely, we’re pioneering Europe's energy transition by making energy consumption smarter and household energy bills lower. We’re looking for a skilled DevOps Engineer to join us on this ambitious journey, driving innovation in infrastructure and automation to support our growing platform. Your work will directly contribute to building a greener future by enhancing the technology behind our energy-saving solutions.
  
As part of our mission, we are currently migrating from EC2-based compute to ECS, optimizing our infrastructure, and improving resilience. We're looking for someone with the experience and vision to help lead this transformation.
  
  

**Your daily work includes:**  

Designing, building, and maintaining platform components in AWS to support our development infrastructure.
  
  

Optimizing infrastructure provisioning through Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) practices using Terraform, ensuring robust monitoring and alerting.
  
  

Troubleshooting complex production issues alongside cross-functional teams, ensuring high uptime and reliability.
  
  

Leading on-call incident response and actively participating in service restoration when needed.
  
  

Streamlining our CI/CD pipelines and automating deployment processes for rapid, reliable releases.
  
  

Empowering the engineering team with automation solutions that accelerate development.
  
  

**What you'll need to succeed:**  

**Cloud Expertise:** Hands-on experience with AWS services (EKS, ECS, S3, RDS, Route53) and deep knowledge of scaling cloud environments.
  
  

**Backend Development:** Proficiency in Python-based frameworks and microservices architectures.
  
  

**Containerization:** Expertise in deploying containerized applications using Kubernetes and Docker, along with experience in migrating services to container orchestration tools like EKS and ECS.
  
  

**Database Management:** Proven experience with relational databases like Postgres/MySQL, as well as NoSQL solutions like MongoDB/DynamoDB.
  
  

**CI/CD Mastery:** Solid experience in building automated pipelines for testing and deployment, and working with CI/CD tools like GitHub Actions, Travis CI, or CircleCI.
  
  

**Security and Monitoring:** A strong foundation in Linux systems, security best practices, and experience building monitoring and alerting systems with tools like DataDog or NewRelic.
  
  

**We’ll be really impressed if you:**  

Are passionate about automation and have a proven ability to reduce manual tasks through efficient, scalable solutions.
  
  

Have experience working with Terraform to manage complex cloud environments.
  
  

Can troubleshoot networking, security, and system performance issues with ease.
  
  

Have a deep understanding of DevOps principles and a passion for improving development processes.
  
  

Are a proactive problem solver with excellent communication skills, capable of explaining technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
  
  

Thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment and can juggle multiple tasks while maintaining high quality.
  
  

We place high emphasis on your interpersonal abilities at Greenely. Greenely's strength is drawn from team members who don't just do their job, but who actively shape the way we work. We seek individuals who naturally take charge, own their responsibilities with pride, and consistently hold themselves accountable. We're searching for someone who can gracefully navigate change, who sees challenges not as obstacles but as puzzles waiting to be solved, and who values the collective success of the team.
  
  

**What we can offer you :**  

**Flexibility:** We are an office-first company that values in-person collaboration, offering flexible work arrangements to support your work-life balance. Our vibrant office is conveniently located in the heart of Stockholm at Vasagatan 40.
  
**Growth:** Elevate your career with opportunities for skill development, challenging projects, and advancement within our forward-thinking organization.
  
**Influence and Impact:** Your voice matters. Shape the future of energy by contributing your ideas, expertise, and playing a key role in decision-making.
  
**Innovative Environment:** Thrive in an ever-changing industry, working on cutting-edge projects and staying ahead of the curve in a dynamic and pioneering work atmosphere.
  
  

About GreenelyGreenely aims to create the best customer experience for the modern energy consumer through technology. Greenely's integrated mobile application enables households to optimize their energy consumption, reduce their electricity costs, and participate in grid balancing services. By connecting various energy assets in the home, Greenely's platform allows consumers to manage their energy usage efficiently while contributing to the stability of the power system. Greenely's solution addresses the challenges of the modern energy landscape and promotes a more efficient, sustainable, and reliable power system. By providing consumers with savings and new revenue streams, Greenely drives the transition to a cleaner and more resilient energy system.
  
  

WE AREbold and push the limit.
  
WE BELIEVE THATfast is better than slow.
  
WE think like owners.
  
WElead with knowledge.

title: Digital Product Owner - iPaaS
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

**Who are you?**
----------------


I am passionate for Integrations platform, structured person, have strong understanding of iPaaS (Integration Platform as a Service). I am good in defining, prioritizing, and managing the product roadmap ensuring that it aligns with business objectives and delivers value. I like to work with teams to solve problems.  

Our Digital Product Owner have opportunities to work on product development, developing process, provide guidelines methods and instructions, ensuring the platform is established as per the Volvo Group security directives and Enterprise Architecture principles.

**Required Skills and Knowledge**
---------------------------------

* Create, prioritize and maintain a well defined product backlog ensuring alignment with the product vision.
* Define and communicate product vision & roadmap that aligns with the company’s strategic goals.
* Collaborate with stakeholders for requirement gathering and work closely with development team to provide clear product requirements, guide and mentor the development team to deliver with high quality.
* Write well defined product features, write user stories and acceptance criteria for development team. Prioritize the product backlogs.
* Experience with iPaaS platforms (e.g., MuleSoft, Dell Boomi, Workato) and their capabilities for data integration, orchestration and process automation.
* Knowledge around cloud platforms such as Azure, AWS and high-level view of their integration services.
* Experience in the Integration Architecture.
* Agile mindset and ways of working ensuring delivery happens providing incremental value.
* Proactively identify and highlight any risks and provide mitigation suggestions.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills
* Product evangelization skills to make business start using the appointing product.
* Good problem-solving skills
* Eager and quick to learn new tools and technologies
* Good and working knowledge with Office 365 suite of products
* University/Master’s degree or equivalent
**Good to have skills**
-----------------------

* Experience with SaaS and APIs.
* Knowledge of integration patterns and best practices
* Azure DevOps
* SAFe Agile framework
**Who are you?**
----------------


We are looking for you who is structured and passionate about product development, has strong grip in gathering business requirements and understanding the Integration needs from stakeholders. Build MVPs and strong products with appointed framework to address the business requirements. Create relevant artifacts in the appointed tools to comply with governance and processes.  

You always put the consumer in focus and are curious to understand the needs of the business to be able to provide the best product, feature or enhancement. You always have an ear with your stakeholders and believe in the power of collaboration. Working in a global context is something that comes naturally to you.

  

Ahmad Nawaz, Digital Product Area Manager Event Streaming and Messaging, Group Digital & IT  

Blohm Peders Cecilia, HRBP, Group Digital & IT

  

Union representatives:  

Akademikerna – Therese Koggdal, +46 470 387855  

Unionen – Lajla Dahlsjö, +46 31 3224575  

Ledarna – Ulrika Holmberg, +46 31 3225071

  

The location for the position is Gothenburg, Sweden.  

We are happy to get your application.

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.

 **Arrow Truck Sales**, part of Volvo Group, is the leading retailer of used medium and heavy duty trucks in North America, with locations throughout the US and Canada. Since 1950, Arrow has built a solid reputation in the trucking industry by providing high-quality, pre-owned vehicles to customers who want to maximize the value of their purchasing dollars.
company_description: Every day, we work with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to leave our society in better shape for the next generation.

title: DevOps Engineer at FLIR
description:
We are looking for a DevOps Engineer to pioneer our Cloud Team!
   

  

 This role is perfect for someone with experience in AWS and Docker who is passionate about building scalable solutions and enhancing cloud-based infrastructure. If you thrive in an innovative environment and enjoy working on cutting-edge technologies, this is the role for you!
   

  

**Top qualities we value in our new DevOps Engineer:**
 ✅ Expertise in cloud infrastructure
   

  

 ✅ Proficiency in automation and CI/CD pipelines
   

  

 ✅ A proactive approach to problem-solving
   

  

**About The Job**
 As a DevOps Engineer at Teledyne FLIR, you will play a pivotal role in managing and enhancing the infrastructure that supports our innovative cloud platform and applications. You’ll join a newly formed team tasked with the ambitious goal of taking over and advancing our cloud platform development.
   

  

 What You’ll Do
   

  

**Design and Implement Scalable Infrastructure:** 
 Enhance our cloud-based platforms, ensuring scalability and reliability.
   

  

**Automation Mastery:** 
 Build and refine automation tools to minimize manual interventions, integrating seamlessly into our CI/CD pipelines.
   

  

**Performance Monitoring:** 
 Use advanced monitoring tools to oversee infrastructure and application performance, ensuring optimal operation.
   

  

**Advanced Troubleshooting:** 
 Handle complex infrastructure challenges swiftly and effectively.
   

  

**Security and Compliance:** 
 Uphold high standards of security and compliance across all cloud operations.
   

  

**About You**
 We are looking for candidates with experience in cloud development, who are ready to take the helm in a complex technical environment.
   

  

**Experienced in Cloud Technologies:** 
 Proficient with AWS and eager to deepen your expertise in cloud infrastructure.
   

  

**Proficient in Containerization:** 
 Skilled with Docker, you’re adept at managing containerized environments and integrating them into development pipelines.
   

  

**CI/CD Savvy:** 
 Experienced in crafting and managing AWS CI/CD pipelines, you’re a pro at automating builds and deployments.
   

  

**A Collaborative Problem Solver:** 
 With strong collaboration and communication skills, you take initiative and tackle problems head-on.
   

  

 Why FLIR?
   

  

 Since our inception, Teledyne FLIR has been at the forefront of thermal imaging and sensor technology, enhancing how critical industries operate worldwide. We are a leader in developing the technology that ensures safety and sustainability. By joining us, you will contribute to a team that values innovation and supports your professional growth with continuous learning opportunities. Plus, you will enjoy our vibrant company culture, community events, and much more.
   

  

 Apply now and help us shape the future of safety and sustainability technology.

title: Senior Cloud Architect
description:
**Company Description**
 We're an award-winning Google Cloud partner. We're the experts in transforming businesses and shaping the future of cloud technology. Join us and collaborate with top minds, build groundbreaking solutions, and make a real difference for our clients. Enjoy extensive professional development, global reach, and a supportive, Google-inspired culture. If you're passionate about the cloud, this is where you want to be.
   

  

 With over 13 years of experience in Google Cloud under our belt, offices in 18 countries and more than 600 experts, we have deployed practical innovation alongside Google. We focus on infrastructure modernisation, data management, smart analytics, application modernisation, and AI & machine learning.
   

  

 Curious about our projects? We got you: Check out our success stories
   

  

  

**Job Description**
**Day-to-day life** 
  
   

* Implement specific GCP-solutions for our clients, build and expand infrastructures, write infrastructure-as-code and execute seamless migrations from on-prem setups
* Work with team members and Google experts to guide customers to new solutions
* Contribute to pre-sales and help train teammates and solve complex problems
* Work with the latest developments in Google Cloud Platform, Kubernetes and Terraform and continue to develop your expertise
* Manage presentations and direct communication with clients, bridging the gap between customers and technical solutions


 Want to know more? Check out our people stories on Youtube
   

  

  

**Qualifications**
 You're passionate about the cloud and love to learn and explore its ever-evolving possibilities. As a senior team member, you're a self-starter who can manage your workload and drive projects forward, while enjoying the collaborative energy of our team. You're client-focused, able to understand their needs, translate them into technical solutions, and deliver presentations that resonate with your audience.
   

  

  

  

 You're comfortable designing and building GCP architectures, understanding networking, security and containerisation concepts, and working with Infrastructure as Code. You will be able to read and debug code in at least one of the following languages: Python, Golang, Java or HCL. You can manage customer interactions and work effectively with diverse team members. Bonus points if you have experience of migrating from on-premises environments and alternative cloud providers to GCP. Fluency in English is required.
   

  

  

**Additional Information**
 Why Choose Devoteam G Cloud?
   

* Innovative Impact: Work on the forefront of cloud technology at a globally recognized leader in Google Cloud solutions.
* Direct Google Connection: Collaborate closely with Google teams, shaping the future of cloud and AI.
* Unleash Your Expertise: Thrive in a fast-paced environment where sharing knowledge and success is paramount.
* End-to-End Impact: Drive complete business transformations, from strategy to implementation and beyond.
* Accelerate Your Career: Grow within a Google-inspired culture, gaining specialisations and certifications.


*"Partnering with Devoteam has been a highlight of our efforts at Google Cloud. Their dedication and expertise elevate every project we undertake together. It's truly a collaboration that delivers exceptional results." — Alexander Percivall, Senior Partner Engineer, Google Cloud Nordics, Stockholm, Sweden.*
 We do plenty of activities, like meet-ups, hackathons, and partnerships. Don’t lose any of them: follow us on LinkedIn 
   

  

  

  

**Benefits**
* Encouragement and support for training and certification, in the form of coaching from other team members, cost coverage, and financial incentives.
* Challenging and rewarding assignments, many of which are end-to-end.
* A hybrid work model as standard, with flexible working hours and location to support your work-life balance.
* An international, diverse, and inclusive team.
* A human-centric and value-based company culture.
* Wellness grants for sports activities (5,000 SEK/year).
* A modern office in central Stockholm.
* Full provision of work tools.
* A variety of social events.


 Our culture is based on continuous learning and career development, supported by a genuine, inclusive, and expert team that really loves pizza. 
   

  

  

  

 Want to know more about life at Devoteam? Check out our Instagram page.
   

  

  

  

 Ready to join an elite team? Apply for our Senior Cloud Engineer position and become part of something exceptional!
   

  

  

  

 Is this not the right position for you? Don’t worry, we have plenty of opportunities! Check out our Career page
