title: Senior Product Owner
description:
**Techster Solutions** 
 befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst
 **5+** 
 års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.
   

  

 Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.
   

  

**Rollbeskrivning** 
 :
   

  

 Our client is currently expanding their capacity and capability within Test management tools. Therefore, we are now seeking a Senior Product Owner with several years of experience in a business environment.
   

  

 In this pivotal role you will be responsible for defining, driving and prioritizing the product backlog and roadmap, ensuring that the test tool meets the user needs and aligns with our client’s business objectives.
   

  

 You will work closely with their cross-functional teams, including three teams of developers in two different countries, Method developers, Coaches and end customers to deliver a high-quality test tool for the Embedded tool chain. The three teams operate in a toolchain environment where close cooperation with other development teams as well as customers will be a part of the daily work.
   

  

 We need you to be an experienced leader who can keep calm in a complex environment and is used to multitasking. Since our client is a diverse company, you need to adapt your leadership to fit many different cultures and different people.
   

  

**Scenario:**
 Current solution: On prem solution for test management system built by our client used by primarily our clients users
   

  

 New solution: Migrate IT-solutions to a cloud based solution accessible from any country where our client is present. Secure a strategic roadmap that fits our clients visions.
   

  

**Tasks:** 
 Product owner responsibilities (in SAFe frame work). Some example of tasks would be manage and meet stakeholders for the Business Intelligence teams, prioritize the backlog, set a roadmap and estimate time for when tasks and deliverable would be complete. Very close cooperation with ScrumMaster, architect as well as team sponsor and line manager.
   

  

**Output:** 
 excerpt of out e.g., Product roadmap, Strategic intake resulting in EPICs in our JIRA environment, Stakeholder map, business contact to both flow and line organization, be the point of contact to all our other teams, prioritized backlog, prioritized ongoing items.
   

  

**Education**
 Master of Science, (other level of education is also acceptable if proven track record of work can match the education level), Scaled Agile Framework, SCRUM
   

  

**Meriting**
* Running IT migrations and business intelligence organizations.
* Experience from software tool development preferably related to test management tools.
* Knowledge about Scania´s electrical system and/or embedded systems in vehicles.
* Experience from operating as product owner in a true global context
* Experienced leader with at least 5 years leading large teams.


**Language**
 Swedish & English on a professional level (Swedish can be excluded if necessary).
   

  

**Remote work:** 
 Wednesdays are today mandatory to be on site. Requirement to be able to be on site 3 days a week minimum. At crucial situations there must be a possibility to work 5 days on site.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Tror du att du är
 **Techster Solutions** 
 nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Arbetsplats och kultur
   

  

 Vi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.
   

  

 Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Account Executive
description:
**About Vainu**
 With offerings globally, Vainu is the Nordic leading company data provider for B2B companies 🌎 We believe that being data-driven across the organisation is key to success and we want to help our customers increase their revenue with actionable high-quality company data.
   

  

 Our offices are located in Helsinki and Stockholm with colleagues all over the Nordics, serving hundreds of customers in SME, Large and Enterprise businesses.
   

  

 We are now on a journey of growth and looking for new colleagues to join our motivated sales team, so if you think a company who takes pride in their product and culture sounds awesome - make sure to apply!👇🏽
   

  

 What do we expect from you?
   

  

* Located in Stockholm
* Previous B2B SaaS sales experience, minimum 1 year
* Confident to drive sales processes from start to finish
* A good understanding of the CRMs we integrate with (HubSpot, Salesforce, Dynamics, and PipeDrive)
* Native-level proficiency in Swedish or Finnish and ability to work fluently in English Proficiency in other Nordic languages is a plus
* Comfortable in calling prospects
* Preferably a bachelor's degree in business, marketing, or a related field


 We offer you
   

  

* Fixed salary and generous commission structure
* Time for personal development. We invest 10% of our working time into learning & development
* Work equipment (MacBook laptop and an iPhone)
* 6 weeks of annual holiday
* Nice events: breakfast/lunch at the office every Wednesday, AWs at least once a month, sports activities, quarterly team meet-ups in different offices, great company parties and trips, etc


*If you have any questions related to this role. Feel free to reach out to Corinna, HR Manager (corinna@vainu.io or +46721658770).*
**We're excited to hear from you! 😃**

title: Infrastructure Architect and Tech lead, Engineering (Full-time)
description:
*At Nexus, part of French IN Groupe, we are shaping the digital future by securing trusted identities for millions around the globe. Our cutting-edge Smart ID solutions and IoT platforms redefine how we trust and interact in a world driven by digital transformation. Do you want to be at the forefront of this technological revolution?*
**We’re looking for an Infrastructure Tech Lead and Architect**
 Henrik Hjelm, Director of Infrastructure, is seeking an experienced, hands-on technical lead to drive the strategic direction of our Infrastructure team in Stockholm. If you have a strong foundation in both public and private cloud environments, a passion for automation, and the expertise to architect secure, scalable infrastructures, this is your opportunity to make a meaningful impact.
   

  

**What We Offer You**
* Lead or team in their day-to-day operations and act as a senior architect to advanced, secure, and scalable infrastructure solutions for global products and clients, impacting millions of users.
* Join an innovative company driving the "Zero Trust" identity revolution for people and things, in both physical and digital worlds.
* Be the technical authority for infrastructure strategy, helping the team towards high levels of automation, efficiency, and security.
* Collaborate closely with product teams and clients to deliver critical infrastructure solutions and services.
* Continuous professional development in the security, identity, and cloud automation space.


**What You’ll Do as Infrastructure Tech Lead and Architect**
* Architect, design, and guide the development of secure, scalable, and highly available infrastructure solutions across public, private, and hybrid cloud environments.
* Ensure alignment between infrastructure architecture, strategic business goals, and client expectations.
* Help define and drive the technical roadmap for infrastructure automation and optimization using technologies such as Terraform, Ansible, OpenStack, AWS, Azure, and containerization.
* Lead incident, problem, and change management processes, ensuring the team’s timely and efficient response to operational needs.
* Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to ensure seamless communication and process optimization across teams.


**Your Expertise**
* A proven track record as an Infrastructure Architect, Infrastructure Engineer, or similar role, with significant experience managing complex, scalable, and secure environments.
* Expertise in Infrastructure as Code, using tools such as Terraform and Ansible for automation, and extensive knowledge of cloud environments (AWS, Azure) and Linux.
* A deep understanding of best practices in security, scalability, and cloud-native architectures.
* Proficient in modern infrastructure tools like Datadog, Azure DevOps Pipelines, and container orchestration platforms.
* You work independently, driving processes with minimal supervision, while also collaborating and lead the team to achieve collective success.


**Qualifications**
* You are senior team member, with a very strong technical acumen and broad knowledge within Infrastructure. You don't need to have previous leader experience, but curious about taking steps towards more leadership roles
* Many years of experience in infrastructure architecture with a deep technical background in Linux, cloud environments, and automation technologies.
* A passion for automating infrastructure processes and a desire to work with complex, scalable solutions.
* Experienced in leading technical project/technical project management
* Due to customer requirements you need to be unhindered in Swedish (written and spoken) as well a proficient in English.


**What’s Next?**
* Apply now by uploading your CV in English.
* The final candidate will undergo a background check to ensure our commitment to transparency, security, and trust.


 At Nexus, we believe in diversity and equal opportunities for all. We’re committed to building a workplace where personal experiences and unique perspectives thrive. Join us to innovate and help secure the future in a dynamic and evolving digital world.

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
**Business Intelligence Consultant - Specialised in cloud based platforms** 




  





 Nigel Frank are partnered with a leading BI consultancy who continuously keep an eye on the market for skilled consultants who are interested in delivering an entire data project to their customer, not just working on a small section.
 



  





 They were founded by highly experienced consultants (each with 20+ years of experience) who felt as though the larger consultancies they worked with, didn't deliver what the customer actually needed; a tailored and thorough data delivery.
 



  





 Their consultants work with the customer to thoroughly understand their need, consulting on what would be the best route and then build and deliver that with a team of highly-skilled consultants. They will then continue to work with these companies to ensure the platforms are being used to their highest potential and often these projects can take up to two years.
 



  





 If you're somebody who's either feeling the same as their founders and want to explore a more consultative environment, or you want to step into a consulting role as you feel ready to work with interesting projects that will challenge you to progress in your career, this could be a great option for you.
 



  






 What can you look forward to?
 



* Hybrid policy with an encouraged 2-3 days in their Stockholm office
* Your choice of laptop and set-up
* With over 30 customers who consistently work with them they have interesting projects in various industries Logistics, Transport, Manufacturing, Automotive and Retail
* Competitive remuneration package: high base salaries, collective bonus, you specify your pension level and over 30 days' vacation
* Monthly catch-ups with your manager to make sure you’re happy with your work and on the right path to reach your goals
* A fantastic team and culture which is friendly and supportive
* Highly senior team that supports knowledge sharing and progression
* Time and budget devoted to training and development
* Team trips abroad and in Sweden throughout the year



  





 Their technology stack includes Azure BI and Data stack inc. Data Factory, Databricks, Synapse, etc., GCP, AWS, Power BI and some Tableau. They are now also working with customer that are encouraging more Data Science methods.
 



  





 If you want to develop within the most prominent data platforms and join a team of colleagues who encourage knowledge sharing and progression, take a look at the requirements below.
 



  






 What we need from you
 



* At least 2 years of BI or data engineering experience: building data pipelines, modelling, cleansing, transformation, data warehousing, etc.
* Proficiency in a cloud platform: Azure, GCP or AWS
* Skilled in working with databases, both on prem and cloud: Snowflake, SQL, Postgres, etc.
* A desire to learn more and keep on up-skilling – current consultants are building their experience in advanced analytics (AI/ML) and project leadership
* Strong communication demonstrated through managing and engaging stakeholders and eliciting requirements effectively
* Analytical and problem-solving skills
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team – you will be working alongside your skilled colleagues while also taking the initiative
* Experience with visualisation and tools such as Power BI, Qlik, Tableau, etc.
* Fluency in Swedish is required



  





 This is an established company that has a fantastic reputation and since they prioritise having a great culture and working environment, you can expect to be surrounded by the latest tech and very best consultants; offering you a great chance to continue to grow your skill set.
 



  





 As a consultant, no two days will be the same, really giving you an opportunity to propel your career forward.
 



  





 If you find this opportunity interesting, apply and we can run through the details. Alternatively, if you have any questions, drop me a message on LinkedIn or give me a call: +46 77 588 86 15

title: Technical Support Specialist
description:
Job description:
 
 At Bluebeam, we empower people to advance the way the world is built. We create smart software solutions that make construction sites more efficient, connected and safe and improve the lives of design and construction professionals everywhere.
 



  
 



 The 
 **Technical Support Specialist** 
 , a mid-level software support position, is expected to assist Bluebeam customers via telephone and email who are having technical challenges installing, configuring and using our products. It is essential that the Technical Support Specialist partner with the customer at a professional level, provide effective resources or solutions within a reasonable amount of time, and contribute regularly to the general improvement of the team and the customer experience.
 



  
 



**About the Role** 



* Masters the Bluebeam voice to deliver an extraordinary experience to customers by answering telephone calls and emails, managing expectations and setting boundaries.
* Researches questions troubleshoot issues related to the use of Bluebeam software applications, including plugins into other software applications.
* Captures detailed call log notes and accurate case details to categorize issue types and case reasons appropriately, including feedback and case status/solution.
* Becomes familiar with AEC industry workflows and terminology, software best practices and 3rd party applications to manage expectations and advise customers on software workflows and best practices, helping them achieve the desired result with Bluebeam solutions.
* Learns and applies KCS Methodologies for each customer interaction by attaching, creating or updating knowledge articles on all cases.
* Demonstrates strong prioritization, time and task management skills to manage the daily workload that involves scheduled phone queue coverage, email cases, KCS documentation, bug logging and other tasks as assigned.
* Demonstrates professional maturity, accountability, take initiative and be consistently reliable.
* Acts as an advocate for the customer and effectively communicate feedback to and from the members of different internal teams in a clear and concise manner.



  
 



**About You** 



* 2+ years of technical support experience, pererbaly software/business application support
* Strong troubleshooting/problem solving skills: Ability to understand the question/issue, identify knowns, unknowns and apply product and environmental (e.g. Windows Operating System) knowledge to ask qualifying questions to determine appropriate troubleshooting steps to move towards and achieve resolution.
* Customer service skills. Bluebeam has exceptional standards for customer service, not only for the clients we support, but also for our employees. It is our expectation that the person in this role will like to work with others and will help them solve problems with a positive attitude and helpful spirit.
* Solid understanding of Microsoft Windows operating systems (Windows 10, 11) i.e. installing and uninstalling programs and drivers
* A positive and proactive nature.
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal



**Extras:** 



* A+ or Microsoft IT Certification (i.e. MTA)
* Experience with PDF software
* Experience with architectural or structural programs such as AutoCAD, Revit, Navisworks, Tekla or SolidWorks
* Experience working within the AEC (Architectural, Engineering, and Construction) industry
* Experience working with mobile platforms
* Experience working with virtual environments (i.e. Citrix, VMware, Hyper-V)
* Experience in setting up and utilizing software deployment tools
* Experience with Knowledge Centered Service (KCS) is a plus



  
 



**What we offer** 



* People-focused, entrepreneurial culture with the backing of a stable, global, corporate entity – Nemetschek
* Competitive compensation and benefits package
* Work-life balance fostered through a culture of diversity, inclusion, and appreciation of individual lifestyle needs
* Opportunity for continuous professional development
	+ Free & unlimited access to LinkedIn Learning
	+ Up to $5K annual education reimbursement (after 1 year tenure)



  
 



**Below is our DEIBA (Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, Belonging, and Accessibility) mission statement:** 




 Bluebeam is committed to building an inclusive environment in which everyone, regardless of background, has an opportunity to experience a deep sense of belonging. Each of our unique perspectives amplifies our collective power, and by encouraging diverse perspectives in an environment infused with mutual respect, we arrive at better solutions. And when we bring the best version of ourselves to work, we can make our best contributions to the global community of people who build our world.​
 



  
 



**About Bluebeam** 




 The construction industry is adopting new technology at a feverish pace. Tablets and cell phones are replacing paper blueprints, drones are surveying jobsites in 3D, and cloud collaboration is changing the way teams work together. Bluebeam plays a crucial role in this transformation. The key to our success is a customer-focused approach to product development: we work with the industry to create solutions for the industry. Today, over 3 million people throughout the world use Bluebeam. In the US, we’re a critical partner for the majority of top AEC firms, and rapidly expanding our presence globally, with offices in Sweden, Germany and the UK.
 



 Come design and build your future with us!
 



  
 



**Bluebeam is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, parental or pregnancy status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or veteran status.** 




  
 







 #Bluebeam

title: Senior System Engineer (m/f/d)
description:
Join our dynamic team of five Systems Engineers based in Stockholm and Oslo, working in a hybrid model (60% onsite, 40% remote). You'll demonstrate your technical expertise in architecting, deploying, and sustaining complex server infrastructures across physical, virtual, and cloud environments.
 



  





 Our team is responsible for the operation, maintenance, and monitoring of financial services on Microsoft platforms, hosted in European datacenters and MS Azure. You'll also collaborate with international colleagues on internal applications, O365, and endpoint management.
 



  





 We are aspiring to adopt a DevOps culture and are progressively transitioning our solutions to the cloud.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 




  




* Design, automate, implement, and operate MS Windows-based server environments, primarily on-premises within datacenters in Frankfurt, Stockholm, and London, as well as in Azure.
* Maintain and operate internal applications, collaboration tools, and endpoints for the internal user environment.
* Monitor Infront financial services and market data processing systems.
* Resolve errors and alarms quickly and provide timely escalation.
* Work independently to troubleshoot, perform root cause analysis, identify, and isolate technical issues.
* Perform design, test, and implementation of complex technical solutions and architectures.
* Complete tasks required to maintain service levels and availability of all site features and functions.
* Help define and support process improvements.
* Provide on-call duty between 6am and 11pm on weekdays once every 5 weeks.



  





**Requirements:** 




  




* 7+ years of documented experience relevant to this position.
* Preferred knowledge and affinity with financial technology (FinTech).
* Experienced with O365 administration and operations.
* Demonstrated Windows clients and server skills.
* Experience with Azure cloud; Azure certifications (e.g., MS Azure Administrator, MS Azure Integration and Security, MS Azure Infrastructure and Deployment) are preferable.
* An enthusiastic, positive, and effective attitude with a get-things-done approach.
* Eager to learn about new technologies and trends; eager to further develop yourself.
* Good problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Good communication skills (English).



  





**Preferable experience in one or more of the following:** 




  




* Cloud computing (Azure, AWS)
* Virtualization/clusters (Hyper-V)
* Active Directory
* Security
* Database administration and management (MSSQL/Postgres)
* Endpoint management/automation (Microsoft System Center/Intune)PowerShell scripting



  





**Why join Infront?** 




  





 Infront offers exciting projects in an innovative and international environment, with modern systems and new technologies that are unique in Europe. We have a professional work culture and a start-up environment, with the advantage of being an established company. You have the freedom to contribute your own ideas and are given the opportunity to develop professionally and personally.
 



  





 At Infront, we emphasize work-life balance through our hybrid model, which allows for both in-office collaboration and remote flexibility. Our diverse team – close to 500 employees from over 30 nations and a leadership team that spans 6 countries – reflects our commitment to diversity and inclusion. We invite everyone to apply to join us (regardless of race, religion, gender, age, disability, etc.) and are committed to equal opportunities for all. Join us and contribute to our thriving, diverse community.

title: Engineering Manager - Data & Analytics Engineering
description:
Are you ready to lead the way in data innovation at NOBA Bank Group? We are looking for a dynamic and experienced Engineering Manager to join our Data & Analytics Engineering team!
   

  

***Data & Analytics Engineering** 
 is currently defining global subgroups focused on backend, frontend, and data management. As the Engineering Manager, you will lead a cross-country team, in Norway and Stockholm, and play a crucial role in advancing our data technology and personnel. Your responsibilities include guiding data initiatives, overseeing data solution development, and collaborating across various parts of the bank. This position offers significant opportunities for professional growth, including global leadership development and engagement in exciting projects like the Common Data Platform, global data modeling, and new business reporting.*
**With Us You Can Expect**
 ✨ A flat organization with fast decision-making processes
   

  

 ✨ Development opportunities within your role and within the organization
   

  

 ✨ Freedom with responsibility
   

  

 ✨ Fun activities together with your team and the office
   

  

 ✨ A culture where feedback, coaching leadership and community are important
   

  

 NOBA is an inclusive workplace that strives for diversity - we welcome all applicants regardless of who you are!
   

  

**Specific Responsibilities Include But Are Not Limited To**
* Lead one of the teams within Data & Analytics Engineering
* Oversee data-related solutions and projects within the Analytics Engineering area.
* Provide technical guidance and oversight for data solutions.
* Assume partial product ownership or technical lead responsibilities.
* Develop and maintain Power BI reports, datasets, consumer-specific models, and data marts.
* Drive the creation and maintenance of a common data platform for future global use.
* Manage stakeholder relationships and drive change within the team.
* Recruit and develop talent within the team.


**We Are Looking For Someone Who**
* Holds a bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, data science, engineering, or a related field.
* Has a minimum of 5 years of work experience in data engineering or a related field, with at least 2 years in a leadership or management role.
* Possesses strong leadership and team management skills, with the ability to inspire, mentor, and lead a team of data professionals.
* Has in-depth knowledge of data engineering and analytics principles, tools, and technologies, including data warehousing, ETL processes, data modeling, and data visualization.
* Is proficient in Microsoft on-premise and cloud data solutions, including MS SQL, SSIS, PBI, Azure Data Bricks, DBT, and Python.


**It Is Advantageous If You**
* Have project and product management skills, including experience with data-related project planning and execution.
* Is fluent in one of the Nordic languages


**To thrive and perform well in the role, we believe that you need to be:**
 To thrive in this role, you need to be a strong leader capable of driving change and managing a high-paced environment. You should excel in stakeholder management and cross-country team leadership, with a passion for innovative projects and modernization efforts. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills are essential, as is the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. You must be goal-oriented, focused on delivering high-quality data solutions within set timelines and budgets, collaborative with cross-functional teams, and possess strong problem-solving skills. A humble and team-focused approach is also important for success!
   

  

**In addition to this, it is important to us that you recognize yourself in our values: we are wholehearted, we collaborate and we take the lead.**
**Practical Information**
 Start: As soon as possible
   

  

 Location: Oslo or Stockholm
   

  

 Form of employment: Full-time
   

  

 Working hours: Hybrid
   

  

 Application deadline: 16.08.2024
   

  

**Take the chance and join us on a developing journey with us at the bank with big 🧡 and fast 👣.**
**What happens when you have submitted your application?**
 The number of steps in the recruitment process may vary depending on the position you are applying for, but we always try to keep the process as short and concise as possible, to protect your application experience. Typically, you can expect two interviews before reference and background checks. You can read more about how our recruitment process works in the FAQ.
   

  

**If you have any questions or concerns about the position, please contact Nina Alias (Head of Data & Analytics Engineering) on nina.alias@nordax.se.**
 We look forward to receiving your application! 🙏✨
   

  

 NOBA Bank protects your privacy and, with reference to the GDPR, would like to ask you not to include any sensitive personal data in your application. Examples of sensitive personal data can be information about ethnic origin, political opinions, religious beliefs or information about your health, such as sick leave.

title: ServiceNow Platform Architect
description:
Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services in strategy and consulting, interactive, technology and operations, with digital capabilities across all of these services. With our thought leadership and culture of innovation, we apply industry expertise, diverse skill sets and next-generation technology to each business challenge.
   

  

 Are you ready to take your expertise to the next level? Take this opportunity to develop your skills and build an extraordinary career, join our pioneering team at Accenture, where we've recently achieved remarkable milestones as
 **ServiceNow's #1 and Most Comprehensive Partner** 
 .
   

  

  

- In 2023, we were honored with prestigious awards including Global, EMEA, Americas & APJ Partner of the Year, solidifying our position as a leader in the industry.

- As the sole Global Elite Partner awarded customer and employee workflow badges, we uphold the highest standards set by ServiceNow's partner program.

 We are looking at significantly growing our
 **ServiceNow Business Group** 
 in the Nordics. Join our team as a
 **ServiceNow Architect** 
 and help our clients to solve their most critical business challenges, improve performance and gain a competitive edge!
   

  

**Responsibilities**
- Effectively managing key stakeholders both internally and externally to the organisation

- Analyse and translate business and technical requirements into an architectural blueprint to achieve complex business objectives.

- Engage with the customer’s Enterprise Architects to position ServiceNow as the standard digital transformation platform integrated with the customer’s core applications.

- Establish and manage a technical governance.

- Ensure the instance health by working with the engagement team to reduce technical debt and align to ServiceNow leading practices.

- Facilitating workshops or meetings to gather requirements, presenting, and validating solutions and test the interpretation of the client’s needs

- Demonstrate solid insights in designing ServiceNow’s capabilities

- Demonstrate strong experience working with ServiceNow platform (e.g., ITSM, ITOM, ITAM, GRC, SecOps, HR)

- Produce a detailed functional design document to match customer requirements

- Act as a mentor to support less experienced colleagues

- Serves as an active contributor of leading practices, standards, and thought leadership related to the ServiceNow platform.

- Contribute to the development of opportunities and provide input to grow our business

**Preferred Qualifications**
- Industry and project experience of 5+ years with ServiceNow

- Good understanding of several ServiceNow capabilities

- Thorough knowledge on workflows, tables, script, flow designer and integration hub.

- Excellent knowledge on Enterprise Security and Architecture, middleware and discovery technologies, database design schemas and data modelling

- Strong analytical skills, communication, and presentation skills

- Ability to manage development teams, customers and stakeholder expectations

- Have the drive and dedication to pursue learning opportunities and continuously share your knowledge with peers

- Experience in working according to agile, scrum or SAFe principles

- Knowledge and experience of Infrastructure Operations, migration as well as ServiceNow Integration with Third party system.

- Prior experience of working with international teams (this role is in the Nordics)

- Fluent in English (spoken and written)

- University degree in Computer Science or equivalent

- Experience working on RFPs and presales support

- Hold certifications in one or more of the areas: CSA, CAD, ITSM, ITOM, HAM, ITAM or HR.

**As a person you have**
- Valid Work permit for Sweden

- Strong interpersonal skills with a collaboration mindset both within and outside the immediate team

- Passionate about working in a fast-paced global environment

- Value collaborating within culturally diverse teams

- Creative and solution oriented.

- Eager to embrace new challenges and drive them to completion

**Why Join Accenture?**
 Join Accenture and become part of a passionate team committed to technology, innovation, and personal growth.
   

  

  

- Unlock significant career development opportunities with access to training, certifications, and a clear path for advancement with free ServiceNow training, we have an all-inclusive agreement with ServiceNow

- Embark on your journey to becoming a certified CTA or CMA with us! Join our exclusive ServiceNow certified CTA program.

- Working with large and complex solutions, our clients are some of the largest in the Nordic

- Be on forefront in technology working with the latest cutting-edge innovations like Generative AI

- Join the largest community of skilled ServiceNow professionals within the ServiceNow ecosystem.

 Pleasenote that due to the summer season, our hiring process may be slower than usual. We apologize for any delay in responding to your applications. Rest assured, we are committed to reviewing each application thoroughly. We appreciate your patience during this time.

title: Responsible AI Technology Architect
description:
**Who We Are:** 
 Join Accenture’s trailblazing Responsible AI team! We’re at the forefront of ensuring artificial intelligence is used responsibly and legally across industries. Our mission? To transform potential AI risks into growth opportunities for our clients.
   

  

**Your Role:** 
 If you have a knack for tech architecture and a passion for responsible AI, we want you! With your experience in creating cutting-edge systems and knowledge in AI fairness, transparency, and privacy, you’ll lead our efforts in building responsible AI solutions that make a real-world impact.
   

  

**What You’ll Do:**
- Design and guide the team on best practices and architectural guidelines for AI model development, testing, deployment, monitoring and auditing.

- Define, build and roll out our internal Responsible AI tools and assets.

- Collaborate on cloud-based data & AI integrations.

- Drive thought leadership in responsible tech.

- Mentor teams and provide technical training.

- Communicate complex ideas effectively to all stakeholders.

**What You Need:**
- A degree in Computer Science or related field.

- 3+ years of experience (more for senior roles).

- Architectural Expertise in cloud platforms like AWS or Azure and their AI Services.

- Proficiency in Python, R, Java or similar languages.

- Proficiency in AI and machine learning algorithms and frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).

- Familiarity with big data tools and database management.

**Preferred Skills:**
- Knowledge of Data & AI regulations, compliance, and standards.

- Expertise in Responsible AI and Generative AI risk management.

- Strong stakeholder management and risk assessment skills.

- Project management experience.

- Consulting skills in designing and implementing governance structures.

**Bonus Points:**
- Published papers or thought leadership in Responsible AI.

- Legal experience in AI compliance.

- Ability to lead project workstreams and manage resources.

 You’ll be shaping how businesses use AI responsibly – improving lives without compromising ethics or inclusivity. Plus, you’ll work on diverse projects that challenge your skills every day.
   

  

 Ready to make an impact? Apply now!

title: Kommunikatör
description:
**Kommunikatör med ansvar för den externa kommunikationen** 

  





  





 Som kommunikatör hos oss har du en nyckelroll i hur vi uppfattas externt. Din främsta uppgift är att planera, driva och genomföra externkommunikationen. Du är spindeln i nätet som formulerar och paketerar våra budskap, så fler kan ta del av hur vi bidrar till ett hållbart samhällsbyggande. Vi har höga ambitioner, fina kundsamarbeten och är stolta över våra projekt och självklart arbetar du nära våra arkitekter. Du fungerar som ett stöd när arkitekterna behöver kommunikationshjälp men det är också viktigt att du självständigt kan driva arbetet så den externa kommunikationen stöttar vårt varumärke, våra övergripande mål och vår vision.
 



  





**ANSVARSOMRÅDEN:** 



* Tillsammans med tf. kommunikationschef ansvarig för att externkommunikationen är i linje med affären och varumärket.
* Tillsammans med affärsansvariga och tf. kommunikationschef planera externkommunikationens fokus på lång och kort sikt.
* Ansvar för webben och webbens utveckling.
* Ansvarig för kommunikationen i våra sociala kanaler – planering, produktion och publicering.
* Ansvarig för att kvartalsvisa nyhetsbrev produceras och skickas ut.
* Ansvarig för att den grafiska profilen följs.
* Kommunikativt stöd till arkitekterna i samband med presentationer, anbud mm.
* Stöd vid marknadsaktiviteter.



  





  





**FÖR ATT LYCKAS MED ARBETET HAR DU:** 



* Cirka 5 års erfarenhet inom kommunikationsbranschen.
* Stor vana vid att identifiera, formulera och paketera budskap med hjälp av text, bild och/eller rörligt på ett sätt som skapar nyfikenhet och intresse från målgrupperna.
* Stor vana från att göra komplicerade texter/resonemang lättillgängliga och intressanta för relevanta målgrupper.
* Erfarenhet av att driva kommunikationen i sociala medier, med fokus på Instagram och LinkedIn.
* Viss erfarenhet av och känsla för formgivning.
* Vana vid att arbeta i organisationer där kommunikationsarbetet hänger på bidrag från personer som inte arbetar med kommunikation.



  





  





**SOM PERSON SÖKER VI DIG SOM ÄR:** 



* Driven i att planera, producera, förankra, och följa upp extern kommunikation med fokus på egna kanaler (webben, Instagram, LinkedIn, nyhetsbrev).
* Kreativ i att hitta infallsvinklar, sätt och forum att beskriva verksamheten, projekt och annan kommunikation så den blir relevant och intressant för målgruppen.
* Språkligt stark med känsla och viss kunskap om formgivning.
* Engagerad, prestigelös och van vid att samarbeta över kompetensgränserna.
* Van vid att arbeta med Adobe Creative Cloud, framförallt InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop/Lightroom och Premiere Pro. Erfarenhet av arbete i After Effects är meriterande. Du bör även ha goda kunskaper i WordPress och vara van vid att hantera verktyg för digitala nyhetsbrev. Utöver detta hanterar du Office-paketet obehindrat.
* Det är en stor fördel om du är insatt i hur arkitekt- och/eller samhällsbyggarbranschen fungerar.



  





  





**OM TJÄNSTEN** 



* Omfattning: Heltid
* Placering: Stockholm
* Tjänst: Tillsvidareanställning (6 månaders provanställning)
* Startdatum: ASAP.



  





  





**ANSÖKAN** 




 Deadline för ansökan är 4 oktober 2024. Vi kommer intervjua löpande under processens gång så skicka gärna in din ansökan så fort du har möjlighet. 
 



 Mejla in ditt personliga brev och CV till rekrytering@awlark.se. 
 



 Har du frågor kring tjänsten hör gärna av dig till Charlotte Mörner Stein, tf. kommunikationschef, charlotte.morner-stein@awlark.se eller 0733-676606.

title: Northern Europe Technology Development Lead (R-16409)
description:
**Why We Work at Dun & Bradstreet**
 Dun & Bradstreet unlocks the power of data through analytics, creating a better tomorrow. Each day, we are finding new ways to strengthen our award-winning culture and accelerate creativity, innovation and growth. Our 6,500+ global team members are passionate about what we do. We are dedicated to helping clients turn uncertainty into confidence, risk into opportunity and potential into prosperity. Bold and diverse thinkers are always welcome. Come join us! Learn more at dnb.com/careers .
   

  

**About The Role**
 The Northern Europe Technology Development Lead will be responsible for the strategy, ownership and delivery for a number of our key Local Markets (Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Finland, Estonia and Latvia). This role is the pivotal partner for our business units in the segment on those markets, understanding the Business initiatives, potential opportunities and Technology requirements and owning the delivery from Technology to meet those Business Objectives.
   

  

 In addition to delivering for our business units, this role will be responsible for the modernization of the local markets within Northern Europe. Understanding the Technology platforms and organizational structure and defining the strategies for modernizing those platforms and bringing them together. D&B is growing rapidly within the Northern Europe markets and as a result we are looking for a Leader who can continue to drive and evolve our platforms to keep pace with this growth.
   

  

 Owning the strategy, approach and outcomes for these markets will be challenging as each local market has its own Business Deliverables, challenges and platforms to modernize. This will require a comprehensive mix of Technology skills, primarily as a leader you will need to define and drive the North Star for the Northern Europe markets. This will require heavy strategic thinking and direction, coupled with the fact that there is a large and complex delivery book of work. This role will be owning all of this and tracking/driving these markets and the programmes within them, so programme management and governance is imperative. Understanding and managing the cost base for the area will require good budget management capabilities, with the incumbent responsible for the budget, delivery within it and driving innovation to deliver more efficiently.
   

  

 Our platforms underpin some of the more complex businesses in Northern Europe and so require good knowledge of cloud-based technologies, microservices and high availability platforms. Finally excellent communication and stakeholder skills are required as the incumbent will be expected to provide domain management and updates to the full Northern Europe team.
   

  

 This role is fundamental for D&B International. Reporting into Senior Director Local Markets Europe and working close to the Senior Director Technology Development Strategic Products Europe you will be responsible for one of our largest and most complex markets, and to ensure that they continue to be successful whilst managing the modernization of Technology with zero impact to each market.
   

  

 This role will ensure that D&B can meet the needs of our ever-growing set of clients, products and data so it is a vital portion of our Technology transformation.
   

  

 Delivering on those technical commitments to meet our commercial objectives and responsible for keeping the European Leadership Team and other stakeholders updated on progress.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Overall E2E ownership for the Technology Functions within the Northern Europe Markets.
* Stakeholder management for the Northern Europe markets, representing Technology in the Northern Europe Leadership team and representing the markets for Technology.
* Working in partnership with the Local Market Leads, define, track and manage these projects to ensure delivery to budget and committed timelines.
* Develop the strategy and process for modernizing the Northern Europe markets, including product, resourcing and back office.
* Develop the vendor and location strategies for the domain, looking to utilize Technology centers in addition to the local market resource.
* Ensuring SLAs, metrics and continuous improvement measures are in place and can be demonstrated.
* Manage a significant domain budget, understanding, challenging, and proactively managing their cost and time position to mitigate potential delays and identify efficiencies.
* Identify any dependencies, risks and issues and ensure mitigation plans in place.
* Work closely with regional representatives from multiple global teams to ensure an effective cross-functional approach.
* Act as pivotal connection between the Technology delivery team and the commercial business to ensure requirements and timelines are understood and aligned.
* Coach, develop and challenge project teams (direct reports or otherwise) to a successful implementation.
* Effectively communicate timely and relevant updates to multiple stakeholder groups including International Technology and the European Leadership Team


**Key Attributes**
* Proven track record of leading a major Technology programme across multiple countries as a senior project director or lead preferably within a large organization.
* Strong project management and organizational skills with experience of managing complex projects and performance management of suppliers.
* Strong Technology background – knowledge of agile delivery practices, large scale data platforms and Java
* Ability to define and implement KPI’s around quality, efficiency and delivery for large distributed scrum teams.
* Exceptional multi-tasker, strategic and tactical thinker
* Ability to prioritize and adapt while maintaining the highest attention to detail.
* Able to shape, lead and control the delivery of complex, cross-functional projects, including optimization of resources and delivery to challenging timescales.
* Relationship management, able to build and maintain effective working relationships and work collaboratively with a wide range of colleagues.
* Understanding of relevant data legislation and privacy compliance across Europe


**Skills**
* 10+ years of experience of Leadership experience relating to critical Domains or Programmes.
* Extensive project management skills with a focus on business-centric projects
* Ability to develop governance methodologies as an integral part of successful program execution.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group of leaders, managers, and subject matter experts.
* Able to successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously.
* Demonstrable skills in presenting information effectively and delivering effective reporting mechanisms.
* Able to produce high quality, effective and thorough documentation.
* Able to manage and prioritize competing requirements.
* Fluent in Swedish and English language


**Why Join Us?**
**Benefits**
 Does this role sound like a great opportunity but you’re not sure about making a move? We are really proud of our company and culture and think we have some great things to offer. Some of our benefits in Sweden include:
   

  

* Two paid volunteer days to contribute to causes in your community
* A paid day every year to use for your health and wellness
* Instead of half days before public holidays, you will have 4 additional full days a year for you to use to celebrate what is meaningful to you
* Annual wellness/sport benefit
* Collective agreement, pension, insurance and parental pay allowance
* Access to free services providing support and counselling
* Flexible working arrangements and hybrid work arrangement for most roles


***Whilst some roles do have certain requirements which are essential, we try to focus on hiring based on potential rather than CV as much as possible. If you are unsure you fully meet the requirements, we would still love to hear from you!***
 All Dun & Bradstreet job postings can be found at https://www.dnb.com/about-us/careers-and-people/joblistings.html and https://jobs.lever.co/dnb . Official communication from Dun & Bradstreet will come from an email address ending in @dnb.com.
   

  

 Notice to Applicants : Please be advised that this job posting page is hosted and powered by Lever. Your use of this page is subject to Lever's Privacy Notice and Cookie Policy , which governs the processing of visitor data on this platform.

title: CTO for Edtech Startup
description:
**CTO till snabbväxande EdTech-företag – ta HP-appen till nästa nivå!**

***English further down***




 Är du redo att leda den tekniska utvecklingen av ett snabbväxande EdTech-företag? Vi söker en engagerad CTO som vill vara med på resan att revolutionera plugget inför högskoleprovet.
 



**Om HP-appen** 




 HP-appen startades 2021 med visionen att skapa den mest älskade tjänsten för förberedelser inför högskoleprovet. På bara tre år har vi blivit den snabbast växande plattformen inom området, med över 10 000 nya användare i år och omkring 1 000 betalande kunder. Vi siktar på en omsättning på 1 miljon SEK under 2024, vilket innebär en ökning med 400 % från föregående år.
 



**Din roll** 




 Vi står inför en spännande fas där vi vill integrera AI, gamification och socialt lärande för att lyfta HP-appen till nya höjder. Som vår nya CTO kommer du att:
 


* **Strategiskt planera** 
  utvecklingen av nya funktioner, bestämma prioriteringar och strukturer.
* **Leda och inspirera** 
  vårt utvecklingsteam på fyra personer för att maximera effektivitet och kreativitet.
* **Fatta avgörande tekniska beslut** 
  i samarbete med teamet och grundarna.
* **Aktivt bidra** 
  i programmeringen av framtidens HP-appen.



 Under hösten kommer vi att stärka upp och göra vår kodbas mer robust, och du kommer att komma in direkt och forma denna process.
 



**Vem är du?** 



* **Erfaren fullstackutvecklare** 
  med stark kompetens inom React, Node.js, JavaScript och TypeScript.
* Van vid 
 **stort ansvar** 
  och att arbeta 
 **strategiskt** 
  med både team och ledning.
* Har förståelse för och erfarenhet av att 
 **implementera AI** 
  samt utnyttja AI-verktyg för att effektivisera utvecklingsprocesser.
* En drivkraft att ta ett företag från dess tidiga stadier till mognad och att vara en nyckelperson i denna resa.



**Ersättning** 




 Detta är en heltidstjänst utan fast lön. Istället erbjuder vi en betydande 
 **ägarandel av bolaget** 
 . Vi söker dig som är villig att investera din tid och kompetens för att tillsammans med oss bygga något stort och framgångsrikt.
 



**Varför HP-appen?** 



* **Globalt team:** 
  Vi har inga fysiska kontor; all kommunikation sker online. Du kommer att samarbeta med kollegor i Stockholm såväl som i Argentina och Pakistan.
* **Påverkan:** 
  Din insats kommer att vara en viktig pusselbit i HP-appens framtid och framgång.
* **Entreprenöriell möjlighet:** 
  Med en stor ägarandel blir du en central del av företagets tillväxt och framgång.



  





  





  





 ----------
 


**CTO for a Rapidly Growing EdTech Company – Take HP-appen to the Next Level!** 

 Are you ready to lead the technical development of a rapidly growing EdTech company? We are looking for a passionate CTO who wants to be part of the journey to revolutionize studying for the 
 **högskoleprovet** 
  (Swedish university entrance exam).
 



**About HP-appen** 




 HP-appen was founded in 2021 with the vision of creating the most loved service for preparing for the högskoleprovet. In just three years, we have become the fastest-growing platform in the field, with over 
 **10,000 new users** 
  this year and around 
 **1,000 paying customers** 
 . We are aiming for a turnover of 
 **1 million SEK in 2024** 
 , which represents a 
 **400% increase** 
  from the previous year.
 



**Your Role** 




 We are entering an exciting phase where we want to integrate 
 **AI, gamification, and social learning** 
  to take HP-appen to new heights. As our new CTO, you will:
 


* Strategically plan the development of new features, set priorities, and establish structures.
* Lead and inspire our development team of four to maximize efficiency and creativity.
* Make critical technical decisions in collaboration with the team and the founders.
* Actively contribute to coding the future of HP-appen.



 This fall, we will strengthen and make our codebase more robust, and you will step in right away to shape this process.
 



**Who You Are** 



* **Experienced full-stack developer** 
  with strong expertise in React, Node.js, JavaScript, and TypeScript.
* Comfortable with taking on 
 **significant responsibility** 
  and working strategically with both teams and management.
* Experience with 
 **AI implementation** 
  and using AI tools to streamline development processes.
* Motivated to take a company from its early stages to maturity and to be a 
 **key player** 
  in that journey.



**Compensation** 




 This is a 
 **full-time position** 
  with 
 **no fixed salary** 
 . Instead, we offer a 
 **significant ownership share** 
  of the company. We are seeking someone who is willing to invest their time and skills to build something big and successful with us.
 



 Why HP-appen?
 


* **Global Team** 
 : We have no physical offices; all communication is online. You will collaborate with colleagues in Stockholm as well as in Argentina and Pakistan.
* **Impact** 
 : Your contributions will be a crucial part of HP-appen's future and success.
* **Entrepreneurial Opportunity** 
 : With a large ownership stake, you will be a central part of the company's growth and success.



**For more information or questions please contact us at** 
  magnus@hpappen.se or phone number 0704326924

title: Territory Account Manager
description:
**Description**
*Position at Wind River*
**Territory Account Manager**
**Location: Stockholm, Sweden**
**Reports to: Head of Sales, Aerospace & Defense, EMEA**
**Job Type: Regular, full-time**
**The Job**
 The Wind River sales team are a power-house in our organization, ensuring customers engage in collaborative & strategic, long-term partnerships, allowing them to unlock the full potential of Wind River solutions. We strive to become the premier provider of solutions & services with customers, engaging at senior management level, in a visionary capacity.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 We are looking for a dynamic and ambitious salesperson to help evangelize Wind River solutions. Successful candidates are creative, curious about technology, energetic self-starters who understand, and have experience in managing technical sales cycles. We are seeking candidates that love learning about technical solutions and products in-depth, and who are passionate about communicating its value to Customers and prospects.
   

  

 The Territory Account Manager (TAM) will not only sell Wind River solutions, professional services and training to existing Wind River customers, prospects and partners but will be required to actively ‘hunt’ within the territory and uncover those new customers/clients with whom Wind River has limited exposure. They (TAM) will work alongside Field Application Engineers (FAE) who act as the technical point people and product specialists to close deals and create demand for Wind River solutions. Although there are many established customers in the geography, this is a hunter role with a focus on net new logo acquisition.
   

  

 The role will require occasional travel within the EMEA territory.
   

  

**Who You Will Work With**
* A team of colleagues across Wind River, supporting you to achieve your vision and revenue goals. This will include pre-sales technical experts, professional services, MST, management, post-sales technical support and dedicated sales administration.
* You will engage with internal sales experts to review business opportunity qualification.
* Global and cross vertical sales teams within Wind River, collaborating on best practices, sales enablement and tools to effectively execute company goals and revenue targets
* Marketing teams, to create strategic campaigns, providing feedback on previous campaigns and asset effectiveness
* Field Account Teams and Inside Account Executives to build and execute outbound prospecting strategies that are tailored to the account/vertical/territory needs


**What will you do?**
* Meet with and listen to the needs of current and prospective customers to understand their current and future business and technical requirements
* Sell to mid-level and senior engineering decision makers
* Orchestrate technical product demonstrations and manage discovery calls/meetings
* Build and manage an accurate forecast to achieve quarterly and annual goals
* Review complex sales contracts and legal documents with customers
* Understand the strengths and weaknesses of competing products
* Maintain customer and contact data in CRM system
* Nordic Region (primarily) will be the territory to cover.


**Requirements**
* 4+ years technical sales experience in quota bearing, closing capacity
* Embedded software sales and cloud infrastructure experience a plus
* Demonstrated success using a consultative, solutions/value oriented sales approach and team selling environment
* Track record of success achieving or exceeding assigned sales goals
* Professional work ethic and integrity
* Strong hunting and prospecting skills
* You may have experience working in a high-performance team and thrive in a fast-paced stimulating environment
* Evidence of success selling solutions to new and existing customers
* Excellent listening, presentation and public speaking skills
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Excellent organizational skills
* Experience using Salesforce.com a plus
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English Language. Swedish or other Nordic languages is a plus.
* BS/BA Degree, MBA a plus


**Why Choose Wind River?**
 Have you been on an airplane or used a cell phone recently? Chances are you didn’t even realize that Wind River’s products are making it happen. How about a trip to Mars? This is second time around for Wind River. Interested in joining the world leader in safe, secure & reliable Operating Systems driving the leading edge of technology enablement? We have a spot for you.
   

  

 In addition to working on amazing technologies, we offer opportunities to grow your career how you see it, with lots of opportunities to shine. Want to work on the systems that will be in the next jet (commercial or defense), autonomous car, AI robotics, or space craft? Want the opportunity to be challenged and grow professionally? Then join Wind River today!
